title: Awesome! Will Stay Again
text:
I feel that any poor reviews are from people who do not have proper expectations and are unfamiliar with NYC and what constitutes a GOOD hotel. First off, Manhatten is old. The buildings are old. There are 2 million people living just in Manhattan, and it is doubled to 4 million people during work days. Space is prime. If you can find a hotel room that is not only affordable, but clean, with its own private bathroom, AND in a fabulous location then you have A BIG WIN!! The La Quinta fits all of the above. It is a BIG WIN! Every employee we interacted with were polite and helpful. The woman who runs the morning breakfast room was exceptionally kind and hard-working. She must prepare hot food and keep restocking and cleaning in a small space for many people every day - and she really deserves a raise! We upgraded our room to the King Bed, and the upgrade was worth every penny. We scored a room that was MASSIVE by NYC standards! Meaning, we had a tile hall vestibule to enter the room [handy for our wet umbrellas on rainy days], a separate area with a writing desk, two small closets [we called them "his & hers"], and plenty of room to walk all around the bed [this is seriously a big deal in NYC]. We had packed light, so we had no issue finding room for things, but if you bring a big load of clothes and other stuff you will need to use your suitcase as your storage drawer. [PACK LIGHT] 

We had a good chuckle at the tiny bathroom with a sink barely the size of my two hands [washing your face is an adventure - and you might as well combine it with taking your shower]. Again, this is all NORMAL for a budget hotel in an old NYC building. What is important is that everything inside our room was spotlessly clean [older, yes, but CLEAN]. Our huge King-sized bed had a new mattress and was very comfortable. The small window unit kept the room appropriately heated or cooled as needed to the temperature we set. Because we were on the 2nd floor if someone smoked outside the front door of the hotel we would have to shut off the unit or it pulled in the cigarette smoke. This was only an issue 2 times out of 9 days. 

Yes, the elevator is very tiny and slow [NORMAL for an old NYC building]. We were on the second floor, and always used the stairs. So, if you can walk the stairs, I would recommend simply asking for a room on a lower floor and don't use the elevator. 

The location of this hotel is priceless. Just a half block to gorgeous Central Park - which is a destination to explore all on its own.  a couple blocks north to the Natural History Museum, and a quick half-block walk to the 72nd Street Central Park subway station which is served by the B Train on weekdays, the C train all days of the week [except late nights], and the A train during late nights only. You can get everywhere you need to go from this station because the trains take you to Penn Station which literally connects you to everything else [subway/metro, Long Island Railroad, and bus lines]. 

We stayed at the La Quinta for 8 nights, so we bought a 1-week unlimited subway pass on our second day for $34 [each person needed their own pass] which covered all our rides to anywhere, and it saved us so much money [otherwise each ride is $4.60, so get yourself an unlimited pass!]. This hotel is located in a very safe, desirable Mid-Town West Side area just 4 blocks away from Lincoln Center [we walked one evening to a Metropolitan Opera performance], multiple delicious restaurants, and bakeries, and if you like to walk everywhere like us, then it is just a 15 min brisk walk [or 20-minute stroll] south to Times Square [we walked to and from our Broadway shows in mere minutes] - however, the hotel feels like a world away from all the chaos and noise of downtown/broadway/etc. DO NOT stay down there! [I once paid big bucks to stay at Marriott Times Square and had to endure sirens and street noise all night, plus it was required that I enter and exit through the Times Square madhouse every day. NOT worth it!] The La Quinta Central Park hotel is in the middle of a quiet one-way residential street with no traffic. Out of 8 nights, with a window facing the front of the hotel and being close to street level, we only heard a dog bark once, and a siren once from a distance. In other words, nights are peaceful here - which is unusual for Manhatten. 

PLEASE prepare yourself to understand that NYC is just like any very big city with millions of people - there is a lot of trash generated and it must be put out at the end of the day for late-night pick-up.  This La Quinta must stack up their garbage bags at the end of the day. And, when you see that, it is a sign they are conscientious about keeping the property free of garbage each day. Just like the inside of the hotel, they keep the sidewalk and hotel entrance very clean. Arrive with appropriate expectations, and you will have a wonderful time. We will absolutely stay here again when we return to NYC, and have already recommended it to friends and family.

title: Compact but not efficient
text: Friendly staff but super slow elevator. Chipped, scratched furniture. Incorrect even smaller room given to us on check in. Key card reader didn’t work. Shower smaller than most closets. Super tight hallways. No hooks even in tiny room, where they would help a lot.

title: Good
text: Room was small. No bathtub, water was HOT, AC was strong in keeping the room cold. OK pricing, internet was in and out. Bed was firm, blankets kept us warm. Had a black out blind. There was no window view. Overall rating is 5 out of 10

title: in a word--awful
text: Possibly the worst hotel I've stayed in and probably the first time I've awarded one star.  I wish I could have the option for zero stars.  This place is simply terrible, with the curtains falling down, broken tile in bathroom, a refrigerator packed with ice on the sides, black mold in the shower....you name it.  I highly recommend you avoid it and I wish I'd read more of these reviews before staying there.  Simply awful.  All supported with photos below.

title: The worst hotel in the world
text: It is the worst hotel I have been in my life. I couldn’t take breakfast at 6:30 am, the front desk man was so rude and charged me 4 times the night at my credit card and never say sorry. The floors are dirty, the food is so regular and they have a very bad service. Don’t stay ever at this place. NY is so big, find another option.

title: Two words: Black Mold
text: There’s something to be said about a hotel where every time you come to the lobby a customer is frustrated. My room was SHOCKINGLY small, but okay. Then I turn on the heat and I see black mold in the unit. I was constantly waking up because you can hear all sorts of things from customers in other rooms to the opening and closing of the doors to get to the elevator. And the elevator: one. Tiny. And it takes forever and ever. Housekeeping knocked on my door before 9 *sigh* also… the lobby is closed at certain times? It’s not clear when those times were but I just thought, really? For all I’m paying to be in a room where two people couldn’t open their suitcases and have room to walk about the room. The benefit was that it really encouraged me to stay out and about. This isn’t a bad review of the *workers* but it is certainly about the hotel. If I hadn’t pre-paid I would have left. The room was generally clean and beds were relatively comfortable. TV was giving early 2000’s.

title: Well done, La Quinta
text: Way to go, La Quinta! It was a really nice overnight stay. I was expecting less, but was overall quite pleased. Clean room, but a little run down but it far exceeded what some reviews here may suggest. I'm not paying for fancy. La Quinta is a great value for a stay in the city. I got a comfy bed with more room than I expected. Bath was clean. Linens smelled fresh. Check out time was noon which was more than enough time if I wanted to head out early and circle back for luggage. Location was perfect for my travel itinerary. Having visited The Met early in the day, it was a nice 20-minute walk through high points of interest in Central Park to arrive at La Quinta. If you are up for walking in the city, it's an easy and enjoyable distance to walk to most attractions. I attended a live taping of The Late Show and walked back to the hotel well after 2am and felt safe walking alone. And after a late night, I woke up to La Qunta's FREE BREAKFAST. I was expecting to grab a coffee and a danish and just head out. Instead, I made myself a plate of scrambled eggs, sausage and home fries! Hello! Fuel to start the day! Well done, La Quinta. And that you are dog friendly to boot, makes you deserve even more praise. I hope to be back again soon. I have found the perfect affordable place in "The City".

title: Absolutely disgusting!
text: Absolutely disgusting! Hallways were filthy. Room was tiny and cramped with not even a luggage rack. At 5AM someone was smoking weed in the hallway and was so strong it woke me up. I was supposed to stay for 4 nights but checked out after 1. It was the worst experience. There wasn’t even a phone in the room to call the front desk to report the smoke. Stay away!

title: Bon rapport qualité prix mais infrastructures pas au niveau
text:
Le rapport qualité prix est bon. Chambres propres, pas de cafards contrairement à ce que nous avions lu dans beaucoup de commentaires, petit déjeuners corrects.
Ce qui nous a forcé à baisser la note que nous souhaitions attribuer est le fait que la fenêtre de notre chambre ne se fermait plus pour les deux dernières nuits de notre séjour de 4 nuits et après l'avoir signalé à l'accueil, quelqu'un est venu constater et nous dire qu'ils ne pouvaient rien faire avant le lendemain et nous a donné un chauffage et une couverture supplémentaire.
Le lendemain, rien n' a été fixé et ils ont fixé de l'adhésif sur le rideau afin que celui ci ne tape pas contre la fenêtre à cause du vent...

title: Great Stay close to Central Park
text: Really wonderful and enjoyable stay close to Central Park. Subway real close and easy to take. Neighborhood feels safe and is beautiful with lots of restaurants and places to see. Close to the Smithsonians Museum of Natural History.

title: Muy buena ubicación
text:
Muy buena ubicación, accesible para 2 estaciones de subte cercanas que conectan con el centro de Manhattan.
El desayuno completo pero un poco variado. 
El internet conectaba en el lobby pero la señal hasta las habitaciones era intermitente / se cortaba

title: Excelente ubicación y relación calidad-precio.
text:
La estancia en este hotel ha superado mis expectativas toda vez que reúne:
1.- Buena ubicación (A unos pasos  del Dakota y  Central Park) .
2.- Medios de transporte (A unos pasos del metro).
3.- Excelente relación calidad-precio, valorando el costo, la habitación aseada y buena calefacción, desayuno incluído).
Y algo muy importante: La atención y hospitalidad que nos brindó en recepción la Srita Milka.

Disfrute de La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham New York City Central Park porque: La VIDA...es un VIAJE!

title: Unfortunately dirty
text: The location is really good, next to Central Park and metro. The staff is really friendly! But very, very tiny rooms and dirty hotel. I had insects in my room. I had the opportunity to change, but still the general cleanliness was not ideal.

title: Clean room.
text: The room was clean, which is my basic standard of any room.  That is about all I can say for it.  The bathroom was 36” wide.  When you sat on the toilet, the sink was in the way.  You had to stay IN the shower in order to dry off and get dressed if you had the door closed.  There was a double bed pushed up against one wall.  While trying to sleep, I accidentally hit a picture that was hung on the wall directly above the bed and knocked it off hitting me in the head.

title: Incredible Service/Experience!
text: Angela's exceptional service truly stood out during our search and stay! After a long drive from Utah, we expected a late check-in, and amidst hours of contacting various places on the road, Angela's professionalism was impeccable! Her communication was direct, efficiently addressing all our queries. Despite a 16-hour shift and a busy lobby upon our arrival, Angela greeted us with a warm smile, providing comprehensive information about the hotel's amenities. She made the check-in process seamless and swift. The hotel room was spotless, had blackout curtains- perfect for a restful night after hours on the road. The room's easy access from the parking lot added to the convenience. Having stayed at many hotels and other La Quinta Inn's, this experience was truly unparalleled! Breakfast was the best I have had at any location, so make sure to wake up on time to enjoy a delicious meal before checking out!

title: Le pire hôtel où j’ai séjourné
text: Cet hôtel ne devrait même plus être proposé tellement il est sale et en piteux état. Tout est mauvais et inconfortable pour le prix payé même si c’est New York. Les chambres, le lit, la moquette, la salle de bain, le hall pour accéder à l’unique ascenseur, tout est sale et en très mauvais état. C’est inadmissible

title: The hotel could be better for the location
text: I picked this hotel because of the location only to be disappointed. The dresser in my room was worn out and the door to my room looks like it had previously been broken into. The bedsheet was not changed from previous guest and I had to request a new room. The hotel pictures online is a bit deceiving. I’m very disappointed. I would not recommend

title: Location not Luxury
text:
The front desk staff was pleasant.  The location is great, right next to Central Park and close to the subway.  We parked in a lot on 72nd st for $63/day.  

The hotel may have been a former row house as it’s very narrow and the rooms are tiny.  We were in the back of the hotel and our windows faced the courtyard between the buildings.  Normal NYC street noise could be heard.  It was a fine place to stay for one night.  But don’t expect luxury—-you get what you pay for.

title: NOT FOR THE FAINT HEARTED
text: The problem with hotels in New York in December there very expensive i personally wouldn't recommend  this hotel it really needs a total make over it would be ok for a few guys but not for the luv of your life ok

title: Filthy, run down…..
text: While the location is very good, this hotel unfortunately is very dirty paint peeling off, mould in the bathroom and the dust on my night table you could write your name on it! I don’t like giving bad reviews but as far as cleanliness and appearance this hotel is very dissapointing! The toilet cover was broken and a smaller one was placed o dr top of it backwards so it wouldn’t fall in and the towels were placed on top it literally one inch from the toilet water! The sink was broken and detached from the wall! There was mould and paint peeling off! The staff however was amazing and the breakfast area had everything for a good breakfast!

title: Great location but grubby hotel
text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.  Staff were great.  Rooms are cramped and very old.  Sloppy paint jobs inside the rooms especially the doors in the bathroom.  Grotty old furniture that’s too big for the rooms.  Good location but way overpriced I wouldn’t stay here again.  Ever.

title: November '23
text: Wi-Fi cut in and out on 10floor. My room door didn't seem to lock behind me at times. Breakfast was good. Location was great. Staff, for the most part, were helpful and pleasant. I'd consider staying again if the security of the room doors were looked after.

title: No lo recomiendo
text: Mala experiencia. La calefacción de la habitación descompuesta. Se reportó e hicieron caso omiso de la misma. Toallas sanitarias en los botes de basura. La recepcionista de nombre EVELIN demasiada grosera, sin modales y pésima presencia .

title: Ideal para vacaciones
text: La ubicación es perfecta, a media cuadra está ubicado Central Park y estaciones de metro. El personal del hotel muy amable. Las habitaciones son ideales para parejas y completas con lo que se necesita.

title: Great staff and location
text:
Every thing was great the location was just across the street from Central Park… steps away from shops and many restaurants and bodegas 
We were there for the NyC marathon and would be happy to stay there again 
My only complaint was the bed the linens were very low quality, the pillows were not good quality as well as the comforter and the bedspread seemed to be made of paper

title: Horrible - the worst NYC has to offer
text:
The only thing good about this hotel is its location.. everything else sucks.. Starting with the room where they gave us a queen bed for 2 adults and 1 kid.. After advertising on their site that 1 kid can stay free - and where is the kid supposed to sleep ? In the bathroom? The room size are smaller than your average bathroom at a good hotel. 
the lift buttons don’t work for some of the floors..  This place quite literally should be banned for all travelers.. DONOT waste your money by booking this utterly crappy hotel.

title: Ótimo local!
text:
Hotel com ótima localização. Na esquina tem entrada pro metrô, ao lado do Central Park e vizinhança muito tranquila. O quarto era pequeno, mas o suficiente. Tinha cafeteira e secador de cabelo. Tinha ar condicionado e calefação. 

As atendentes eram cordiais e muito simpáticas. O café da manhã era suficiente, apenas era num local pequeno, mas nada que não pudesse ser manejado. 

Ótimo local!

title: Amazing Days in NYC
text: We had really great days in NYC and La Quinta is part of it. The hotel was really great. Delivers exactly what it promises. The room was small but comfy for us. The breakfeast iwas great. And the location is amazing!

title: Disapointing
text:
If this hotel would be al Terlingua,Texas , I could believe how is it. 
If the price by night would be $100.00 USD maybe I could believe it. 
 The total cost was 4,000.00 USD by five nights. Is the olny bad experience of New York

title: Worst place ever experienced
text: I spent one night in one - I think - of the more spacious rooms. Experience I strongly advise against. Very dirty, several broken furnishings, windows so dirty that there was no view of the beautiful street below. An unpleasant feeling of being in a bad 80s movie. For that price there is a multitude of alternatives. Stay away from it.

title: Horrible hotel and staff
text:
Do yourself a favor and find another hotel. Staff rude, unfriendly and unhelpful.
Room the sizes of a prison cell
Sink falling off the wall
Dead bolt woukd not latch closed
Was told by staff that their was no one on staff to help us.. it was 7pm at night

title: Cucarachas por todo lado
text:
Pésimo servicio! 

Somos los huéspedes de la habitación 705 (09/10/23 - 14/10/23), escribo porque tuvimos problemas de cucarachas en la habitación

1. Se informó en la mañana del 12/10/23 a la señora de limpieza de las cucarachas 

2. Se informó la noche del 13/10/23 a la recepcionista Jazmín de las cucarachas, Jazmín dijo que no habian mas cuartos disponibles, que enviaba una señora con un insecticida y adicional iba a hacer un reembolso por las molestias.

3. Sin embargo, la recepcionista del 14/10/23 dice que no hay ninguna nota en el sistema, es por eso que me da su correo y por eso le estoy escribiendo a usted, solicitando un reembolso.

4. 14/10/23 Envié un correo al administrador comunicándole la situación y hasta hoy no he recibido ninguna respuesta ni ningún reembolso

title: MEH.
text: The only good thing about the room I had was the view of the west side brownstone homes and buildings otherwise the carpet was extremely filthy! Not dirty…FILTHY!! The bathroom was clean but the light blew out. Only one elevator and it took forever. The positive was directly across the street from Central Park and the subway station down the street. The continental breakfast was okay. Lots of variety from hot to cold food. The bed was lopsided so it was hard to sleep. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel at all.

title: CUCARACHAS
text:
El hotel bien ubicado, pero en 2 días nos cambiaron a 3 habitaciones diferentes por cucarachas. En la tercera ya decidimos no movernos más a pesar de que seguimos encontrando cucarachas en el cuarto. Hablando con la gente que trabaja ahí en limpieza nos dijeron que es algo común y que el gerente no quiere poner plata en esas cosas.

Positivos, nos devolvieron una parte de lo pagado y nos dieron un upgrade, pero igualmente no compensa lo vivido. 

El desayuno básico pero bien

title: Great location
text: Really close to Central Park so we were able to have lovely walks. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast choice was good but hot food could have been hotter. Rooms and hallways look a bit tired but the room was comfortable and clean. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Normal pero bien comunicado
text: El hotel tiene una buen ubicación y está bien comunicado por metro cercano. El precio es alto, como todo en Manhattan, pero no deja de ser una gran comodidad el poder ir y volver desde  el centro en pocos minutos. Nuestra habitación triple era una doble muy pequeña con una cama supletoria, pero ya estaba así anunciado. Si el huésped está relajado y sin apuros, lo pasará muy bien. Si es de los "ansiosos" le anticipo que hay un solo ascensor para 99 habitaciones, que tambien lo usan las mucamas y demás personal de servicio. El desayuno normal, sin muchas pretensiones pero con una esmerada atención de parte de la Sra,Miriam.

title: Bitten Up By Insect
text: Hi, I was bitten by insects in this hotel, and I also saw Cockroach. I was not compensated when leaving the hotel, and still haven't been compensated yet. I'm trying to get in touch with the hotel. Please can you compensate me for the damages. It's really bad what I've been through, and is going through with my foot. Thanks for looking into this, and this is my reference number 89078EE023940.

title: Room for flight cancellation
text: I was able to get a room here after a flight cancellation.  I was actually just happy to have a bed to sleep on as most everything was booked. I got in late, staff was very nice and helpful, and that is about the only nice thing I have to say about this place.  I was not told,(nor saw) a breakfast the next morning. The key cards were not working so staff had to let you into your rooms. My room was tiny.  Double bed, dresser and nightstand with a narrow path to walk around 2 sides of the bed only.  Bathroom was tiny also.  You could sit on the pot and use the sink (and almost the shower) at the same time.  There was a roach in the bathroom.  The shower was probably the best part of the whole room. Big enough for an adult and good water pressure with hot water.  The towels were like new and fluffy.  Bed was very firm.  Window AC unit was struggling to keep room cool. One elevator for 14 floors with approximately 8 rooms to a floor.  The front door was nice and location is half a block walk to Central Park and it is a fairly safe looking neighborhood.  This could be a great place with a little TLC.  Pricey for what it was.

title: Worst room for most money ever experienced
text: Dirty, unsanitary conditions throughout, no air conditioning in halls, elevator, rooms cramped and filthy. Staff unconcerned and over worked, card reader for rooms broken, mold on bathroom wal, room  air conditioned load, windows filthy, bathroom sink held on with calk, toilet positioned so sink was in way, towels threadbarel

title: Fabulous Location at a Bargain Price!
text:
Stayed four nights in the Executive King room. This was plenty of room for two people. The bathroom was small, but manageable. We were on the 2nd floor so we didn't have to deal with the elevator inconvenience others have mentioned - we took the stairs. 
The price (for NYC) is an incredible bargain.
Breakfast was better than expected - hot offerings every day, a waffle station, bread & bagels, cereals, juices, and coffee. 
The best feature is the location, however. Located in the wonderful Upper West Side, the area is quiet, yet close enough to the chaos of Time Square - easily accessible by several nearby subway lines. 
There are many restaurants on Columbus Ave, and Central Park is half a block away - we enjoyed walks through it every day.
We are already planning our next visit!

title: Tiny Room
text: The configuration of the room was incredibly awkward - L-shaped with the queen bed in one space and a single bed placed in the area where you open the door to the room.  The bathroom was poorly designed for a small space making it so you had to be careful not to bang against the sink when you tried to move around.  Suggestion - if they are limited on space they should look at more efficient use of the space - consult an RV space designer.

title: Déception...
text:
A 250 balles la nuit on peut légitimement s'attendre à un minimum de confort mais non, pas ici, pas dans cet hôtel dans tous les cas... Commençons par les points positifs: l'emplacement bien entendu, c'est ce qui fait l'attractivité de cet établissement situé à deux pas de Central Parc, pas loin à pied de tas d'endroits sympas de Manhattan. Le petit-déjeuner n'est pas mal du tout, copieux, changeant (un peu) tous les jours et personnel super sympa. La salle est un poil petite au vu de la quantité de chambres de cet hôtel (14 étages). La literie est top, vraiment. Nous avons eu deux fois les WC bouchés, réactivité immédiate et réparation dans les 10 minutes. Appréciable.
Les points négatifs: les chambres (la notre était une double de luxe) sont minuscules avec un peu d'espace pour se mouvoir, idem pour les sdb. C'est un peu vétuste, un peu en mauvais état (porte de la sdb défoncée). La clim' est vraiment le point noir, notre chambre donnait sur une cour intérieure (on avait l'impression d'un jour d'orage permanent) où toutes les sorties clim' de l'étage donnaient, résultat un vacarme d'enfer, franchement un bruit d'avion. Bouchons dans les oreilles toute la nuit malgré les fenêtres closes. Une mini clim' intérieure se trouvait en bord du deuxième lit, réglée sur glacial il était impossible de la laisser en action car elle gelait la personne qui dormait là!^^ Bref, nous avons voulu changer de chambre: compliqué, pas ce jour mais demain puis, finalement, un post-it collé sur la porte nous à mentionné que pas possible, l'hôtel étant finalement sold-out. OK, on va faire avec. Personnel à l'accueil soit charmant soit totalement indifférent. Une carte de la chambre ne fonctionnait plus, nous n'avons pas pu la faire changer (appareil en panne soit disant). Bref, moyen, si vous êtes allergique au bruit n'y allait pas, si vous voulez du confort et des chambres cosy, n'y allait pas. Si cela ne vous gène pas et seul l'emplacement compte, alors cet hôtel fera l'affaire...

title: Good enough for a weekend
text:
Posizione ottima. Pulizia abbastanza accurata! 
Colazione un po' povera, ma buona.

Camera un po' piccola per tre persone e sistema di ariazione da migliorare, una persona ha congelato durante la notte e altre due hanno sudato.

title: Muy buena ubicacion, excelente trato del personal.
text: La ubicacion es muy conveniente, a media cuadra del Central Park, muy cerca del subway y omnibus. El personal es excelente, muy buena limpieza y desayuno abundante.  Las habitaciones son muy pequenas y el balo es minimo, como contra a lo anterior. Tambien tienen un solo ascensor para 14 pisos, es incomodos. Pero como nuestro viaje consistia en estar todo el dia afuera, no era un problema. El barrio es muy tranquilo y seguro,

title: Would not recommend.
text: Bedroom and bathroom extremely small.  Cannot sit on toilet without hitting head on sink.  Sink extremely small.  Water easily splashes over basin onto the floor.  Single hotel elevator that is inadequate for number of people hotel accommodates, and often in use by hotel staff.  Usually ended up having to take stairs to 8th floor room.

title: Unforgettable for the wrong reasons!
text: Dreaming to forget this hotel experience.  The front desk staff was solid at this hotel and the individuals cleaning the rooms and changing the sheets work very hard and are quite cleanly.  The problem: the hotel is old and literally stinks.  The carpet is moldy and musty.  Worst of all, you will come out of this hotel begging for a washing machine and an exterminator.  There are cockroaches in the hallways and rooms as well.  It is disappointing. The hotel needs renovation and an exterminator.

title: Même pour une seule nuit, je ne le recommande pas
text:
Nous avions décider de rajouter une nuit à notre voyage à NY. En dernière minute j’avais le choix entre cet hôtel et d’autres avec de meilleurs standing à l’extérieur de Manhattan. J’aurais dû choisir les autres hôtels.
L’accueil de l’arrivée ne s’est pas bien passé, le concierge ne donnant pas les bonnes informations concernant le stationnement sur rue arguant qu’il valait mieux payer un parking au cas où.
Les chambres sont minuscules, les corridors de l’hôtel sont dans un piètre état, il n’y a qu’un seul ascenseur pour tout l’hôtel donc des fois il fallait faire la queue. En plus il est tout petit.
La configuration des chambres de 3 personne est ridicule, la salle de bain minuscule et la climatisation fait tellement de bruit que la nuit ne fut pas réparatrice.
Certes ce n’est pas cher mais ce n’est pas non plus un bon rapport qualité/prix.

title: Bargain
text: If you like the Upper West Side and have things to do in the city that require an overnight stay, this is a good bargain.  The room is small (just a little more room than the bed) and the free breakfast is bare-bones.  But you can't beat the price.

title: Excellent experience
text: It was really nice to stay there. Good deal between price and benefits. Excellent location and service of everyone from the Hotel. The room has a perfect space just what we needed. Surely, we would like to comeback and stay in the same place.

title: NYC trip
text: Stayed for 2 nights in the hotel. Overall we had no issues with it, service was satisfying. The size of the 3 person room was not that great. Double bed was quite narrow. There was only 1 power outlet available on the wall, but it had the air conditioner plugged in already. Air flow from it headed right to the single bed. Location was great. Breakfast was good.

title: Tiny room great location
text:
Cons: Sketchy tiny elevator, you wait a while for it because everyone uses it including housekeeping. Postage stamp sized room. Weak air con. I didn’t reserve through TripAdvisor and ended up paying way too much. 
Pros: Excellent location and friendly staff. Free breakfast. Central Park just outside your door.

title: Great location!
text: A block from Central Park gave us ample opportunity to explore the park. A block from the subway made it very convenient to get any place. A block from Columbus Avenue where many great restaurants are located. Staff was helpful and the street was quiet despite the fact that we were in the city.

title: Excelente Localización
text: Excelente ubicación,facilidades muy comodas. La cama y almohadas 10 de 10 es como estar en casa.El personal muy atento. Ademas de estar a unos pasos de Central Park tambien tienes un subway en la esquina, lo cual hace mas rapido la transportacion.

title: Great Value right next to Central Park!!
text: This was the perfect location! Half Block from Central Park! Near great restaurants! Book the Kingsize bed! Not only do you get a bigger bed, but you get a bigger room! Very nice breakfast! We will definitely come back!

title: You get what you pay for...The worst hotel ever
text: The most unprofessional, un hospitable un groomed, most unfriendly. Customer service is not a part of the equation. Terrible especially a Wyndham Hotel group. We stay at the Empire usually! Never.....

title: Experiencia regular
text: A la llegada al hotel la persona que me atendió fue bastante amable, la habitación estaba descuidada necesita mantenimiento da apariencia de suciedad, habían bichos y se escuchaba ruido de la maquinaria

title: Close of everything
text:
That hotel is a great location, close of the Park, metro, museums and close of nice and not too expensive restaurants. The staff is very helpfull. Room was a little bit small, but clean and confortable.
We walk a lot, but there is a lot of buses around.

title: Great location
text: Clean hotel, room was a little small but very clean. Friendly staff. Location was perfect and in walking distance to everything. I would definitely stay here again. Parking on the street is metered and you have to pay it on the app every 2 hrs or find a parking garage which is about 3 or 4 blocks away.

title: A gross hotel, with very rude staff.
text: This hotel, to be blunt, is an overpriced dump. To add insult to injury, as others have noted, the staff is extraordinarily rude and incompetent. We stayed 4 days at this location. Our air conditioning broke every single day we were there, so we woke up each more inside an inferno. Everything appears filthy and unkempt in the entire hotel. There's no nice space -- not the hallways, rooms, lobby, nothing. The photos on the website are NOTHING like the actual dilapidated, shabby rooms. This place is a like a Motel 6 in the Upper West Side.

title: Pleasant experience; free breakfast!!
text: Had a nice stay here. Room was average size/small bathroom but adequate with small desk area as well. It was nice to have the free breakfast and staff there were very attentive and helpful. Very close obviously to walk in Central Park and short walk to Lincoln center which is where our activities were centered. Would stay her again.

title: tiny over priced room
text: the staff was very helpful and the hotel is in a great location. the room and beds were super small and stuffy. the room smelled of bleach. the breakfast was over cooked with limited choice and there was no secure area to leave baggage. very disappointing for a Wyndham at such a high price point

title: Find another place to stay
text: I booked this hotel through booking.com and had to cancel. I cancelled well within the free cancellation period. I was still charged for one night. I had to dispute the transaction to get my money refunded. When I called the property directly, the clerk was rude and unprofessional. I do not recommend this hotel.

title: Not what we had hoped for - but not bad - served it's purpose.
text: Chose this one because of the location - near to family we were visiting. Breakfast (everyday) came without butter (had bread and toasting facilities - but no butter). Staff were polite but very indifferent. Room was clean and functional; sometimes got cleaned, sometimes not. Unfortunately our room was opposite the ice & drinks dispensing machines and we discovered that people tend to require cold drinks and ice through-out the whole night...not a single hour without someone using this facility.

title: Hospitality for Roaches
text: We had roaches in the room, the elevator was unreliable, and were told the internet was not working and they had no way of knowing when it might be addressed. Stay away at all costs. The ony plus was the location, but there are many other options on this side of town.

title: Good for the price.
text: This location serves us very well, the breakfast is good enough, the room was clean and comfortable. We will definitely return here because we don’t need to spend 5-star prices for our visit. The only negative is the small, only elevator.

title: Horrible staff
text: we booked a room with 2 double beds for 3 people, the first night they sent us to a room that was already occupied and then they gave us a room with only one double bed, the next day after being mistreated by the receptionist who demanded that we be at 12 noon and we canceled our already paid tours, they gave us a room for 3 people. In addition, they did not leave us towels and only after several requests they left us only 3, the room was extremely narrow and every day we found an insect inside. We will never stay there again.

title: Stay from
text:
1- dirty hotel
2- badly maintained
3- dirty rooms with dirty sheets
4- insect and roaches in the room
5- kristy or krissy recepcionist insulted my wife myself for asking to speak to a supervisor. she lied and called a friend instead of the supervisor through her cell phone instead of using the hotel phone which we asked he to do and it was until another supervisor told her to call the manager to clarify she called from her mobile again a person with a name not like before. she threaten us to call the police and then when we didn’t leave as we has paid and only wanted to speak to a manager on our room she called them and the police said we were not doing anything wrong just asking for a manager so they would not show. A supervisor came along and she apologized for Kristy/Krissy behavior agreed the establishment was not up to par and Krissy/Kristy at that point lost it again and started yelling like crazy at her threatening to sue her. at the point we decided to leave.

title: Flophouse
text:
We stayed at the Wyndham's LaQuinta between the 21st and 26th of April 2023 (5 nights). On arrival at the hotel, we were informed quite nonchalantly, that our room booked room (a king-size) had been given to other guests, that the company have oversold. We were instead given a smaller room which was very shabby and had faults (Room 908). 

After complaining to the desk staff we were informed that we would have the room we booked by the second night. We were told to come to the desk at midday to arrange this. Unfortunately, as it was a holiday, we had things to do, booked tours etc and had no time to hang about the lobby. 

As a result, no room change had been arranged and we had to stay in the the shabby 908 for a second night. I complained to a different receptionist who also suggested I come back at midday the following day, which I told him was simply unacceptable.

It wasn't until we spoke to the receptionist in the morning, a lady called Jasmine, that she presented a solution and proactively helped us secure the king-size room she booked. She admitted that both of the previous receptionists had the facility to help us in the same way but had simply decided not to. On the third night of fifth we were given the room we needed.

First of all, this was a very disappointing result overall. We'd carefully chosen the hotel based on photographs which depicted a neat boutique style hotel, not a scrappy, tired establishment with graffiti in the elevator and cracked tiles on the lobby floor, peeling wallpaper, chipped masonry and paint... The photos online are misleading.

The hotel was a trip to celebrate my birthday, we had travelled a long way and the stress your hotel caused was unnecessary and unkind. Also the first two receptionists passive and unhelpful.

Room 908 has chipped paint on the walls, no safe key, and a faulty lock on the bathroom door which locks the room from the outside. On the second day, we arrived to find that the room had not been turnover (bed changed), yet there were no towels. We called reception three times over a 90 minute period for new towels to no avail. I had to go down to reception to ask for some to be ready for collection at reception when we returned from dinner.

We were given a small discount for services but no compensation for being given the wrong room and our booking dishonoured. We are looking for a sincere apology from your company and a refund. We have been to New York on several occasions and this is the very worst accommodation we've stayed at by a very long way.

title: Good
text: The hotel was nice , love the decorations , the service took long to check in , it’s only 1 worker assist customers, the room key didn’t work . The room was nice but the room was cold and the heat didn’t come on .

title: Worst staff in the city
text: I stayed for approximately a month between moves and was treated horribly as a single woman. The staff called me derogatory names in Spanish Yasmin at the front is the worst. I am contacting corporate

title: Hotel perfeito e bem localizado!
text: Limpeza/higiene impecável, temperatura adequada, bom café da manhã, bem localizado, equipe educada e sempre disposta a ajudar, cama excelente e perfeita acomodação, quarto espaçoso comparados aos hotéis de NY, o nosso tinha 26mts quadrados.

title: You get what you pay for.
text: room was dirty.  heater was broken, staff wouldnt fix it or off3r another room.  almost burned myself on the waffle maker because of a missing bolt, pointed it out, staff said management knew about it and didnt care.

title: Uncleanness
text: The space is super small, bad smell, the receptionist is not friendly, they use the same elevator to take the dirty laundry where the clients go up. The rooms are extremely small, the windows dirty and no view at all

title: Small rooms, require maintenance
text: Small rooms, small bathrooms, broken vanity, very small lift and congested hotel overall. Cleaning staff was good and cooperative, some front desk staff was good and some were extremely rude. Breakfast guy was chill, and doing his job nicely 👌 , would recommend this hotel if your budget is low and u will want to stay in the city, location was very good.

title: Worst hotel stay ever!
text: I stayed over the weekend. I sustained an electrical burn from a light shade socket which blew out the electrics in the room. This was at 11:30pm on Friday night. The staff were really not very helpful & treated me as if I was an inconvenience. I was moved to another room. Which was smaller & not what I paid for. I asked for a refund only to be told that this is up to the management & they don’t work on weekends. Who leaves a hotel in New York City with no management responsible for decisions? The room was dirty with stained blinds. The windows were drafty & the room was freezing. I had to sleep in a hoodie as it was so drafty. It is now Tuesday, and no-one has called me to confirm I at least get a refund for the difference in rooms. Let alone to apologize

title: Apenas uma localização.
text: Eu sabia que os quartos em NY eram pequenos mas nós colocaram em um que não dava para nós e as malas daí tivemos que pagar a diferença para um “melhor” era de fato melhor que o primeiro porém ainda não era bom. O hotel tem um péssimo Cafe da manhã se não tiver incluso para vc não faça nem questão de pagar por ele por favor. Implorei por 1 fatia de pão caixa que eles colocam contado na mesa lá posta pro Cafe. Só tomei Cafe no primeiro dia depois não fiz questão alguma. A limpeza é deficiente tanto do quarto quanto do espaço do Cafe. O ponto de metrô que fica mais próximo não leva direto ao centro vc tem que andar um pouco mas é próximo tb. A rua é estreita e calma. Se me perguntar se eu voltaria a me hospedar lá??? Procuraria algo melhor mas se não encontrar dá pra se hospedar pela localização apenas, mas lembrem-se, peçam o “melhor” quarto.

title: Hidden Gem! Top location, great staff, good deal, quiet, clean room
text: Hubert and Yasmin made my sister and me feel at home immediately. This location can't be beat -- it's literally a half-block from Central Park. By NYC standards, the price was a steal. The room was very clean and very quiet. It was small but perfect for us, as she was there for a race and I spent my time out and about. There's a full hot breakfast, too. The area was safe -- I felt totally comfortable wandering around on my own. I hesitate to recommend this place too much, as I don't want my "hidden gem" to be unavailable the next time I need it! :) Seriously, though, highly recommended.

title: Pet friendly and budget friendly
text: If you’re looking for a pet friendly and budget friendly hotel that is within a block of Central Park, this is it! Not luxurious at all but a very clean, pet friendly, good hot breakfast and a good location!

title: Recommended hotel
text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is not looking for a fancy place to stay but will use the hotel room just to shower and have a sleep. The room are small but clean and the hotel is located very close to central park and the main attraction. We walked from the hotel to the center of Manhattan and it saved us a lot of money from taxi. The beds are super comfortable and the room warm. The breakfast was better than expected, some very fresh waffle and omelette to taste as cereals and sausages. We got the room for a bargain price considered how Central the hotel is + breakfast included. I recommend it

title: Great staff!
text: Walked in at 10 PM, not sure if there were any rooms available. The excellent staff found a wonderful room at the last minute! Only issue I had was it was a little difficult to find the hotel from the street.

title: Great choice on west side
text: Great people, great breakfast, great location, a little pricey, an older building. But I do recommend! Very good experiences all around, and the front desk staff is very well trained. You won’t be disappointed

title: Pésimo hotel no vayan
text: Hay cucarachas en los cuartos, agua fría, habitación caliente, muy pequeña habitación, el WC tiraba agua, el teléfono no servía, nunca arreglaron nada. La alarma de incendio más de una hora la madrugada del 1 de enero y no los hicieron nada a los que fumaron mariguana. El gerente nunca apareció

title: Trip to Bestwestern in Central City
text: I Nicholas  Golden  arrived on the 14th of December. As I enter the lobby of the Best Western Cindy the front desk clerk  greeted me with a smile. She was a very nice lady,she was quick on getting me into my room,an assured me that the stay was going to be a good one . The stay was a very pleasant one so when I say she gets the 5 stars  yes ,but i think that  she needs a raise, only because of some people can be rude but she takes it with a smile. She gets the 5 stars

title: UWS Location Near Lincoln Center
text: Affordable accommodations located within walking distance to the Lincoln Center.  Short walk  to the Metro station and Central Park.  I have stayed here several times since 2005.  Staff have always been nice and accommodating.

title: Stay away!!! Filthy!!
text: Stay away! Absolutely filthy! Room Tiny but I could cope with that if it would have been clean. Sheets and pillows dirty and smelt, blood stain on carpet ( carpets filthy anyway) brown stain on very old towels and bathroom tiny and again filthy . We had to kick the door to open the room, you couldn’t see out of the windows with the dirt, plugs falling off the walls. Breakfast room seats about 15/20 people- there are 90 rooms apparently! Breakfast was terrible and all on plastic plates.staff were miserable probably because of all the complaints. Managed to book an apartment  at radio city apartments and moved the next morning. Radio city apartments are absolutely beautiful, cheaper and bang in the middle of everything. Please do not stay at La Quinta!

title: Only for a short stay
text:
We stayed in this hotel for one night and it worked out perfectly but I wouldn’t recommend it for a lengthy stay.   

The good:
Friendly staff
Location- amaizing
Breakfast included
Minimum noise

The bad:
Tiny room, even by NYC standards
Noisy AC/Heather unit
Just one elevator for a 14 story building
Shower towels need to be replaced urgently

title: Ehhhhhhh
text: The hotel was a good location, parking on the street right in front of the hotel. However when i got inside the front desk girl was on the phone the whole time i was checking in. She was somewhat nice but I found it slightly rude. I was charged $100 extra and I’m pretty sure it’s because she wasn’t paying attention. Then our room was sooooo small. Like a box. Me and my friend couldn’t move. No sunlight and hot af. Wouldn’t stay here again but it’s a decent quick stay. Breakfast in the morning.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Muy bien ubicado, desayuno abundante y variado, silencioso y confortable. Las habitaciones bastante pequeñas, la calefacción excelente. Metro y bus al lado del hotel. El ascensor único para todo el hotel a veces lo teníamos que esperar un rato.

title: Great location close to Central Park
text:
This location was perfect - close to Subway and Central Park.  Room was clean, bed and pillows comfortable.  Breakfast had hot food which you don't find often.

Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.  They had luggage areas in lobby to help store for couple hours before and after checkout.

I would definitely stay there again.

title: Horrible, Dirty, Tiny Dump!!
text:
This cannot even be called a hotel!, there was only 1 tiny elevator, which was also used by housekeeping!, No Parking!, the bathroom was smaller than you find in an airplane!, I am not kidding!!.
Avoid at all costs!!!!

title: Beware- mandatory $30 "resort fee"
text: The hotel is fine. The rooms are small (like most in NYC) but clean, the staff are helpful, the breakfast is adequate, and it is a nice location. But, there is a mandatory $30 resort fee added to the price after you book.

title: Upper West Side Secret
text: I knew about this property as I lived in the area over 25 years, but didn't realize just how tiny the rooms were, I guess that's NYC! We actually spent more time in the room since I have a child with special needs and he needs more down time, but if I were on my own I would not have spent as much time, great location for us, near museum and Central Park, nice breakfast, staff.

title: Dirty and small rooms.  Unhappy front desk staff.  Not worth the location.
text: Do not be fooled by La Quinta name.  The quality and services are not consistent with La Quinta name.  Room was not cleaned.  Front desk did not answer the phone.  Had to go back down on a very crowded and slow elevator.  When I mentioned to the front desk that I tried to call to tell her no one answered, she became aggressive and said the front desk is not connected.  Amazing.  Do Not Stay.  La Quinta should not put their name on such a property.

title: Just don’t
text: Do not stay there! Worst experience! They overbooked and didn’t have room for my family (w/2 kids) even though I’d called weeks prior to confirm our reservation. Staff started screaming at each other!

title: Don’t stay here.
text: This place is outdated, there’s one elevator, my room (1402) smelled like wet dog/wet carpet, the water shuts off spontaneously when taking a shower, and there are no outlets near the bed for you to charge any devices. I am literally embarrassed for trip advisor that they advertise for this hotel.

title: Despicable - DO NOT STAY HERE
text: We stayed there for 4 nights. Filthy, unsafe, pollution infested water came from the bathtub faucets.  When we told the desk, they said that we should have reported it earlier and that they couldn't do anything about it.  Reached out to the manager on 2 different days and times - but the manager was never available nor did they ever reach out. No remuneration was offered.  Shame on you Wyndham

title: Never again
text: Miss communication with rooms. A room to small for one person not alone three. Small bathroom dirty shower. Roaches  hair on bed pillow. Remote did not work well. Staff not really fixing the problem. We should have received a larger room for three adults to be comfortable in.

title: Outdated and small
text: Only one elevator. Rooms were small. Hallways and elevator was small also. Could not get down certain areas with wheel chair.  5 people in elevator was a tight fit. Breakfast was mediocre. Some items good some needed improvement. Overall would not recommend unless your a bit desperate.

title: Tiniest room ever for the most money ever!
text: Location is great for Central Park and American History Museum but....rooms are tiny, not good air circulation, elevators are SLOW as molasses and breakfast room is tiny.  Not sure why people pay what they do for this hotel as it is really a 2 star.  Beds were comfy, sheets and towels were nice but desk service was very spotty and staff not very helpful.

title: Dirty Hotel with a Youth Hostile Vibe
text: The elevator takes forever, it's used excessively by hotel staff extending the wait even further. It's often piled with dirty laundry and garbage. The rooms are depressing and the windows are so dirty it looks it's in a war torn city.

title: Clean room, great breakfast and super staff.
text:
Centrally located, clean room, great breakfast included and staff - especially Jasmine, Kalipha & Makayla were friendly and knowledgeable. Can’t say how great all staff were - our stay 10/1-10/3. We did not hear any noise from rooms above, below or adjacent. Fair price too! 
Can’t wait to return when we can plan a low rate.

title: Worst hotel
text:
Where shall we begin.
Check in we asked for a Top floor and the  front reception told us we have a top floor 14 floors we got 11 floor, even though we bioked over the phone with Wyndham for a top floor.
On our way up to the elevator once it arrived we were walking towards the room looking at the dirty carpets with pain on them.
Opened the bedroom door to find a closet size bedroom.
Notice  bad smell in the room, could of been mold.
Bathroom door could not close if sat on lavatory.
Step into saddle to bathroom is a 2 1/2" tripping hazard at night or day.
No soap in the bathroom dirty towels and pillow cases.
Rust in shower.
Smoke alarm missing or removed. 
Couldn't open top drawer. 
Clock radio not working
Dirty carpet stained. 
Cigarette on landing floors
Long waits for very small elevator. 
Broken door under sink in breakfast room. 
Very smalk breakfast room for the amount of guest. 
Bad untidy reception room.

title: Great location but a disappointment as a hotel
text:
Great location near Central Park and restaurants but the hotel was a disappointment.  We expected a small room which we got but it wasn’t in good condition.
It wasn’t very clean and had the feel of a youth hostel.

The elevator was crazy slow and the stairs weren’t air conditioned so walking up was sweaty work.

The resort fee was just a way to get more money since they didn’t have any amenities.

The breakfast was fine and the staff were friendly.

title: Lovely receptionist, but Hotel non - functioning
text:
Position of Hotel fine, but our door wouldn't unlock, 4 times we were sent back, but it wouldn't open.                      Given a key to a different room, someone else's stuff was already in there; the room was already taken.

The breakfast room was small and stuffy, with limited seating area, and the tables were sticky and slow to be cleared. Loud air conditioning.

title: Short break
text: I cannot think of a single positive about this hotel other than its  convenient location for Central Park. Its beyond  tired,  we had an ensuite you could barely turn around  in, the first room we were given  wasn't made up, the staff were dressed in jeans. The lobby is a mess, I could go on.....

title: Meh.
text: Nice looking hotel in a nice area near Central Park. Check in was slow as they only had one person on duty. The room itself was okay except the carpet needed serious cleaning!!! Also the bathroom light stopped working which was not good. Only a small piece of soap was available to wash with. The internet didn’t work which unfortunately was part of the resort fee. The free breakfast was surprisingly good and plentiful. The location was perfect down the street from Central Park and trendy Columbus blvd. the money I paid including the resort fee should’ve been better spent.

title: DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL
text: Unfortunately if I could give less than one star to this hotel I would. We spent a lot of money at this hotel for three nights. We booked the room for 4 adults through Booking.com with one double bed and two single beds. When we arrived to the room it was super small. You hardly have any space to walk. We only got one double bed and one single bed. We went to the front desk to complain and they said they did not have a room with more beds and tat they were sold out. We asked if they could bring a rollaway bed and they did not have any. We called booking.com. and they did their part by communicating with the hotel and try to solve the issue. I myself worked in hospitality for more than 10 years and work in revenue with the director of revenue. I talked with GEORGE, the hotel manager and I explained that the right thing to do was to accommodate us as they uploaded the wrong inventory in the third party. He acknowledged that the situation was unfair for us but he chose not to help us. One person had to sleep on the floor for 3 nights. The room is dirty and has bugs in it. Also, the service at the front desk is horrible. I think as a team in general, they still have a LOT to learn and improve. Communication between them is really poor.

title: Late Summer Stay 2022
text: I booked a 1 night stay for Sunday August 21st, which I ended up checking-in at around 8 PM. The Lobby is small, so once I walked in and there were 5 people with their luggage you felt like you was back at the airport waiting on the long TSA line. There is only one tiny elevator, which fits only 4 people with their luggage. So if you're not in the elevator, you will be waiting a long time for that elevator which was my case after I checked-in. The room seemed like it was cleaned since the bed was made. The room temperature was great once I walked in, but the big issue was that the AC filter cover was rattling. I found out that the reason the AC cover was rattling was because it was broken. As I watched TV in bed I noticed that the lock to the room had been compromised. You could tell someone had forced the door at least if not kicked. After that all you can ask yourself is "how secure is that lock anymore?" I can't remember why I picked up the phone to call the front desk but I think it was to complain about the AC being too loud, especially since the room was small and the AC was right next to the bed. When I got off the phone I noticed that the phone was filthy, if I would have noticed that earlier I wouldn't have called to complain. As I continued watching TV I decided to keep looking around the room and noticed the furniture was chipped. I decided to take a look at the TV remote and realized it was also filthy. The next day I noticed I had long brown hair coming off my head in the shower, weird since I have a faded set of hair black hair. That made me think, were the beddings cleaned??? Or did they have long brown hair and that's why I saw long brown hairs? Hot Breakfast, this was something I was looking forward to. I pretty much booked my stay because they had Hot Breakfast, but the quality of the Hot Breakfast was very low. To tell you that my highlights were my waffles I made in the waffle maker & the yogurt I got from the fridge. So, do I recommend a stay there? NOT if management does something to fix my issues. Will I stay there again? I will highly think about it, but IF I do, I will inspect the room once checked-in and then request for another room IF I get another room like my last stay.

title: Don´t recomend this hotel
text: Dirty overall - no air conditioning ventilation, dirty windows, towels and products offered at the room. Breakfast area packed with guests and no one to clean the tables. Not accessible to wheelchairs nor strollers, the corridors and tight, as well as rooms. Elevator really small and slow. Bad location to who returns after sunfall, as it gets desert and dangerous around the region

title: Disgusting Urine and Fecal on the Bedroom Carpet
text: Absolutely disgusting that we were given a room with wet carpeting that turned out to be coming from the toilet. The smell and when we discovered what was going on with the toilet will make you vomit. The worse part, no one was slightly interested in resolving the issues we had in the room, not one! We packed and left but everyone will hear our story! BE AWARE ROOM 901 the toilet does not flush, the telephone does not work, there was no remote control, and the carpet was wet, and the smell tried to be covered up with some kind of white solution. This hotel has one elevator.

title: Horrified by how dirty the room can be
text: I booked a room with queen bed and a twin bed, the room was dirty, there were many cockroaches crawling around, I was terrified by how dirty the room can be, I really wish the city sanitation and health department was there to see it. Definitely not recommend to anyone!!!!!

title: Pésimo hotel
text: Pésimo hotel. Está viejo y desgastado. Las instalaciones parecen de transporte público. Está rayoneado y sucio. Las habitaciones son diminutas, las camas viejas, incomodas. Los aires acondicionados son viejos y hacen mucho ruido. Jamás lo recomendaría.

title: 2 days without an elevator on a 12 floor
text: I was there for 6 nights, after the 3d night the elevator broke, we stayed 2 more days without an elevator on a 12 floor , I had an injured knee, so I decided to check out early because I had no way to get down and up again 12 floors with and injured knee, we requested and got no help to get our bags down 12 floors, so I had to carry down a 50 pound bag down 12 floors with a busted knee. Front desk was aggressive and useless, and refused to refund any money for 2 days being in a 12 floor accidental prison for the lack of elevator. We don't know if and when they managed to fix the elevator, but it was out for at least 2 days

title: Worst sleep ever
text:
AC didn’t work. No fan available. Room had no ventilation. Drawers do not work properly. Bathroom barely has any room. 
 
I have never had such a horrible
Hotel experience. I will not return to this hotel. Save you a headache and don’t book here

title: Deben mejorar
text: Por favor mejoren los detalles de calidad y servicio, la habitación no vale lo que pagas, la limpieza y mantenimiento son necesarias, ahora mismo el cuarto se ve deteriorado sucio y sin cuidado, la locación es extraordinaria.

title: Don’t stay here
text: I leave my bag in the hotel custody before checking in. When I came back, my bag with all my personal belongings was not there. We reported the incident to the police and the stuff was very very rude and not helpful. No compensation, or apologies so far.

title: Small but nice
text: Very tight room in space, but clean and comfortable.  Great staff, coffee all day and breakfast was good.  Convenient for our purposes and very quiet street (for the city).  On street parking hard to find, but a garage is around the corner.

title: Warning!
text: This hotel and it's staff are horrendous. If u can, I would stay anywhere else before chosing this hotel. The staff are combative, the amenities are not there are poorly functioning. There are many other locations to select from, especially considering the price point. I feel like I'm an around about way, my stay was a form of theft.

title: These rooms are too small if you like sleeping and a matches box then it’s ideal for you
text: Parking wasn’t too bad seems like you can always find parking on the block but you have to pay attention to the parking rules posted by the city it’s very convenient as far as Proxima city tour great shopping and a short walk to Central Park

title: Amenities included not provided
text: Hotel well located, one block from Central Park, but 25 minutes walking to Broadway. It was chose because breakfast included, there was none. Internet worked poorly or didnt work at all. Nice pressured shower

title: Visit to La Quinta
text: The hotel is located in a very good location, the hotel needs to install more lifts as the hotel has 15 floors and only one lift is available. It will be nice to provide breakfast for the customers and reduce the deposit amount. If it is possible the hotel can have a data bank on the tour programs available in new york

title: Worst hotel I've stayed in
text: Worst hotel I have stayed it. Dirty carpets and elevator, small rooms, elevator takes forever, personnel not friendly and not helpful to solve your issues, noisy, very warm during the night unless the 3rd guest is freezing in front of thr AC (bad room distribution, not as nice as in the pictures online). The only good thing is the breakfast.

title: Cockroaches
text:
Cockroaches on the walls.Terrible!
Poor customer service.
Will not contact back until next week.
Want money back.
Talked with 3 customer services personnel. No help 
Cockroaches on the bedroom walls
A terrible experience!

title: Great price small room location was worth it
text: Would definitely stay there again! Great price and location. Staff was friendly and helpful. Decent breakfast especially for the price. The location was great! For Manhattan, you cannot beat the location. Subway was close. Central Park very close.

title: Terrible hotel… never again….
text: The only positive things is the location close to Central Park and the several metro connections all around. The hotel is generally quite dirty, old fashioned, rooms incredibly small and not suitable… not to be chosen

title: Evitatelo è un tugurio meglio dormire sotto i ponti
text:
Definirlo hotel è già  una bestemmia...
La hall è un deposito merci e materassi usati , stanze minuscole maleodoranti  a nche le lenzuola del letto puzzano (le valige per essere aperte vanno appoggiate sul letto altrimenti impossibile farlo ed inoltre anche tenendole chiuse impediscono il movimento essendo la stanza un buco bisogna letteralmente  passarci sopra o scavalcare ogni volta) , per le stanze doppie ci aono solo letti a una piazza e mezza e nonoatante gli venga fatto notare che la prenotazione comorendeva 2 letti singoli lo staff richiede altri soldi per il cambio, bagni minuscoli per sedersi sul water bisogna incastrarsi tra esso e il lavandino , mancano gli accessori garantiti alla prenotazione come asciugacapelli  e asciugamani , aria condizionata funziona ad una sola temperatura  ed è evidentemente  da igienizzante usciva aria ammuffita, ascensore scricchiolante e dico ascensore perché c'è ne uno solo per un hotel con un centinaio di stanze..... inoltre non viene rimborsato  in nessun caso la prenotazione .... vergogna

title: STAY AWAY
text:
Stayed there 6/1/22. 

It is beyond me that Wyndham would allow this tenement to operate under its name.  For the remainder of my life I will never stay at another Wyndham property, regardless of location or property type.  Further, I am removing Wyndham properties from the list of approved hotels that our employees may use for business travel.  

This property was clearly a tenement building and public housing project turned into what is supposed to pass as a hotel.  The one tiny elevator it has services all 14 floors of this hotel and 100% of the six times I needed to get to and from my floor, it was fully occupied by housecleaning staff with two cleaning carts and no room for others in the elevator.  The housekeeping staff (who all look like LaQuinta/Wyndham long ago destroyed their souls) don’t even look at you when the elevator door opens; they just say No room! and carry on to the next floors while you wait for that one dingy elevator to return.   Getting to the 4th floor or lobby took anywhere from 14 to 20 minutes.  Needless to say, the cleaning staff did not exit the elevator to make room for the guests.  

Room 407 is their “Executive Room, King Bed, Corner” and is the best room that this property has to offer at any time.  This shambles of a shoe box-sized room cost $327.57 for the night.  The hallways were strewn with empty coffee cups and assorted debris.  The carpets which appear not to have been changed in my lifetime were filthy, worn, and had bleach stains and other stains of unknown origin.    The ottoman has a large round stain on it that looked like poop or blood.  The air conditioner was a small house air conditioner was damaged and filthy and the air coming out of it smelled like urine.  The lampshade was broken and cracked.  The bathroom had rust and the wrong size tank cover.  The doors and walls were filthy.

There are only 7 rooms per floor at this hotel because that is what New York City Project Housing provides.  The entire size of my room would fit inside a 1-car garage.  

This property is located on the upper west side of New York City; one of the most affluent areas in the entire United States.  Mind boggling.

title: Big Apple, Wet Day, Comfortable Sleep
text: This property was just right for my biz trip to NYC for an evening work function at the American Museum of Natural History (about .5 miles away). Like most Wyndham properties and NYC hotels in general, the room was small, but that really shouldn't be a factor in judging the room because we're in NYC! We should be out and about and not stretched out in the hotel room. I just wanted to get that out of the way. My bed was quite comfortable and the A/C was just right so I slept soundly and restfully. Pro tip I got from a fellow hotel guest...the elevator door is kind of wonky sometimes and if you want to make it stops re-opening and stranding you at the lobby you need to hold the button for your floor until it is all the way closed and starting up. I boogied out early to hit the road home, so I didn't have the breakfast options or see the breakfast room. There's a tasty Mexican restaurant called Santa Fe a few doors down where I enjoyed a delicious meal with the fluffiest rice I've ever had. The hotel is a half block down from Central Park, and around the corner from the famed Dakota apartment building where John Lennon lived (for you history/music buffs). There is no hotel parking. You either need to hope for street parking, or there is a 24 hour public garage you can access .3 miles down the street (find and pre-book NYC parking garages using SpotHero).

title: Fabulous stay!
text: Nice accommodation.  Room was small but perfect for 1 person.  A great area.  When going to Manhattan anything below 80th st is good. It was close to 2 subway stations. Central Park was nearby. Breakfast also fab!

title: Excellent rates and location
text: The hotel is one block an a half from the subway station and one block from Central park. The room was small but enough for our needs, since we spent most of the day enjoying the city. The room rates were reasonable, considering that it is New York City.

title: good place for the price
text: Considering how expensive NYC can be to travel, this was the best deal!  The location, what was included, you will not find a better solution.  Yes, it is dated, and very small but to know the NYC experience, this is it.  It was clean, the housekeeping was amazing, and everyone was helpful.  Alberto was a great help in fixing our TV issues, a long-lost remote control!  I had my mom with me who was excited to have Spanish-speaking staff.  They could be more organized, they stored their cleaning supplies in the hallways, and they needed more staff to keep the eating area neat and tidy.  Our only grip (my husband's grip) was that the bathroom door didn't latch.  For the NYC experience on the budget, this was good.

title: Very Dated and Unkept Property
text: The rooms are very small, which is fine, but everything is so dated.  The TV, the shower/tub, bathroom, a/c/ unit.  The TV actually didn't work at all, but we didn't bother to call down because it wasn't worth it for one night.  The a/c unit just blows hot or cold air directly onto the bed (based on the way things are positioned in the room) so hat's not very comfortable at all. The hallways outside of the room are extremely cramped and the elevator is very sketchy.  It actually did break down during our stay, luckily with no one on it.  I wasn't getting any messages on my phone while I was connected to the wifi, but I was able to stream okay.  The staff was nice enough and I believe the amenities were clean.  However, cleanliness is hard to determine when everything just looks grimy and dingy with age.  In typical NYC fashion, you will hear everything on the street all night.

title: Room size is choking and broken furnitures
text:
The room was super small , choking and very uncomfortable,compared as placed on the website.
The furnitures were falling off, and all old.
The bed was not comfortable to sleep on, also the rugs are super old and smells dusty and flared my allergies.
The elevator keeps you waiting for long that ended up using elevator while carrying my luggages and was uncomfortable.

title: Buena ubicación pero servicios regulares
text:
No ducha, no internet y la moqueta sucia y mojada. Mal olor de la habitación. 

El personal en general bien, excepto chica del checkin. 

Los desayunos no estaban nal, aunque zumo de naranja no hubo casi ningun dia.

title: Buen hotel con aspectos mejorables
text: El check-in fue muy sencillo. La habitación tal como la habíamos reservado, era espaciosa con una cama amplia. El personal se mostró siempre disponible y muchos de ellos hablan castellano;  el servicio de habitaciones fue impecable y la limpieza de la habitación estupenda. La ubicación junto a Central Park es muy buena, aunque no hay vistas al parque. Sin embargo, desde la habitación se escuchaba mucho ruido de otras habitaciones. La sala de desayuno es pequeña para la cantidad de gente, más de un día tuvimos que esperar fuera; y otros días la comida no alcanzó para la hora en que nosotros bajamos (09:00AM) y tuvimos que salir a desayunar fuera (nos devolvieron el dinero del desayuno). En el check-out nos guardaron las maletas para pasar el día. En general, la estancia fue muy agradable, pero ciertas cosas podrían mejorarse.

title: Μικρό ξενοδοχείο με καλούς επαγγελματίες
text:
Tο ξενοδοχείο είναι μικρό με πολύ φιλική εξυπηρέτηση . ¨Ολο ανεξαιρέτως το προσωπικό είναι επαγγελματίες , ο Anthony μας βοήθησε πολύ με οδηγίες για την περιήγηση μας στην πόλη, η Cynthia εξαιρετική επαγγελματίας, ο Alexys μας έκανε να αισθανθούμε φίλοι! Ακόμα και η πολύ καλή κοπέλα στα πρωινά έδινε την ίδια αίσθηση!
 Το δωμάτιο, ευρωπαικών προδιαγραφών, μικρό μεν , αρκετά εργονομικό , σηκώνει λίγες βελτιώσεις  (τουλάχιστον λίγες κρεμάστρες στους τοίχους..) Το στρώμα ήταν πολύ άνετο , η ηχομόνωση εξαιρετική. Λόγω covid η καθημερινή καθαριότητα (έστω το άδειασμα των σκουπιδιών) γινόταν μόνο μετά από ειδοποίηση , ενημερωθήκαμε μόλις φτάσαμε γι αυτό, και στις 10 μέρες τα σεντόνια αλλάχτηκαν μόνο μια φορά ...για τον ίδιο λόγο έπρεπε να έχουμε το νου μας στα είδη υγιεινής αλλά ευτυχώς στην ρεσεψιόν τα παιδιά ήταν πάντα πρόθυμα να μας εξυπηρετήσουν. Η τοποθεσία είναι αρκετά κεντρική - στα όρια του Hell's Kitchen που δίνει πολλές επιλογές για φαγητό και ποτό πολύ κοντά .  Τέλος το πρωινό είναι επαρκές και μόνο ότι παρέχεται είναι σημαντικό, γλιτώνεις χρόνο σε μια πόλη που έχει παντού ουρές!

title: Dirty beds with hairs and poor quality overall
text:
Found hair on top of a white old ran down comforter, hairs on my pillows and looked like from a thrift shop. No quality at all. And they don’t mention a $150 hold on top of the price room total so is misleading from day one. 
Sanitation is very important, and the room looked like where homeless stayed during COVID!not to mention an wall installed air cond. unit with lots of dust in the room . That charges $170 a night . Food is ok

title: A Bed in a Closet
text: This was not an enjoyable experience: disorganized, haphazard, check-in was delayed (great way to start), a tiny lobby which was too crowded with waiting guests, a slow elevator (which serviced th housekeeping staff), a claustrophobic room with no floor space. Better to go camping in the Park...

title: Was ok, it has great location
text: Location is the best and it includes breakfast, but very bad internet and room is too small. The water in the shower stagnated. We were left few days without internet and tv signal. Breakfast is not bad and location is correr with central park which is great

title: No vayan!!!
text:
Fue mi primera experiencia con Wyndham. Seguramente será la última. El Hotel tiene un solo ascensor para 12 pisos! Se rompe y te dicen que subas por la escalera.
Nadie se hace cargo, la chica de la recepción en forma antipática te dice que ya pidió arreglo. 
Es lamentable que el Municipio de Nueva York los autorice a funcionar con un solo ascensor.

title: Tiny, great location, clean
text: The hotel was easy to miss, just the name, small logo, on the awning out front.  They do not have parking as was implied on web sight. Staff were very nice, helpful and caring. The room was TINY but clean and had everything we needed. Except soap! We asked at FD but they apologized and said they were out. 😬  Full Breakfast included  was limited but good. We could see Central Park from the street in front of hotel, 1/2 block away. Several parking garages within walking distance.  Shops, bakeries, restaurants close by also! Bikes were allowed in our room.

title: Trip in New York
text: This hotel has a perfect location to visit the city! The room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom is really small but there is What you need after à long day out. The worst is the breakfast! I advise you to eat outside.

title: Low budget (but not matched in price b/c it's a prime NYC location)
text:
Given a dirty room at first. Had to open hot water valve for sink. Painter's tape left on door frames. Slowest elevator ever. Be prepared to wait for check in/out due to inadequate staff. Even the iron decided not to work for a bit!
Other than that, the staff was perfectly polite, the bed and bathroom worked. Just needs better maintenance protocols.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I came here for an interview. They allowed me to check in early, they lowered my room price, overall very accommodating. Great location right across Central Park. The room and the bathroom were quite clean and I had and excellent view

title: Close to Central Park and imagine
text: Close to subways east and west, and close to Central Park and Imagine, La Quinta was a nice surprise with friendly staff and small but clean rooms, and really enjoyed it. We will be back with our whole team in a few weeks

title: Apenas bien
text:
Positivo: Cerca de Centrak Park, habitación limpia y buen desayuno (variado).
Negativo: No hubo Wi Fi durante toda la semana, instalaciones viejas y descuidadas. Un poco costoso. Un costo de ressort que no aparece en el precio de inicio  Wikipedia y considero abusivo..alrededor de 70$

title: New York city experience
text: The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. As someone who goes to NYC hardly every staff was patient and very helpful. Do not be surprised by the small hotel room. Get out and enjoy all of the wonders of NYC just steps from the front door of the hotel. OF course after enjoying your free breakfast.

title: Cerca de muchos lugares turísticos ¡recomendable!
text:
Es una muy buena opción si vas de turística a New York. Se encuentra en Manhattan a media calle de Central Park y a una calle del Edificio Dakota. El personal es amable y eficiencente. Varios de ellos hablan español. En el lobby tienen un cajero automático, lo cual es muy conveniente. 

El desayuno y las instalaciones están bien por el precio que pagas. En mi caso sólo estaba en el hotel para desayunar, dormir y bañarme. Entonces no me importó que el cuarto era pequeño. La regadera funcionó excelente. Y llegaba a Times Square en 25 minutos caminando por Central Park.

Además, las habitacines son silenciosas, pude dormir muy bien.

title: Mal olor ruido y muebles rotos
text:
Malas las instalaciones y mal olor el desayuno pésimo y no funcionan las máquinas 
El reclamar no se resolvió y continuó mucho ruido de puertas y pasillos murallas delgadas que permiten pasar el sonido
