title: Excellent
text: It's a good place to stay in New York. I will recommend it to my friends. The breakfast was so good and the people who work there are warm and friendly. The place is near to the metro and Central Park.

title: Awful don’t stay here
text: We had roaches. Ice machine and tv were both broken. Room looks so much larger in the pictures. One side has air conditioning that blasts on you and the other side of the room was so hot we had to open a window

title: Overnight in Central Park West
text: Hotel location is great. Hotel is dated and small, rooms are very small and furniture was dated and not maintained well (drawers didn't close). Rooms are clean and we only needed beds to sleep in so it worked out fine. Staff was very friendly. Not a good hotel if you have a vehicle.

title: Only good thing is the location.
text:
My room was dirty, I had a lots of problems during my stay. The only thing that was good was the location, half blocl away from Central Park and near to metro Station.
Probably I would not book it again.

title: SERATA HORROR- DISONESTI NON RIMBORSANO
text:
Avevo prenotato una camera e al mio arrivo ascensore ROTTA (stanza al 5 piano / bagagli da portare di 30kg e persona con difficoltà deambulazione). Mi hanno chiesto di pagare $150,00 di cauzione che mi hanno preso 2 volte + $ 370.00 di camera che ci hanno fatto pagare (transazione VISA) due volte.
NON CI RIMBORSANO NULLA, aspettano sempre una risposta dal manager..e avvisano che si debba aspettare 5-7 gg per rimborso ma dopo 20 giorni non rispondono nemmeno più alle mail.
NON CONSIGLIATO

title: You get for what you paid
text: Nice location in a crappy hotel. Elevator didn’t work, in winter they have pre set the heater, so we frozen at night. Breakfast really poor. You don’t think you are in a hotel in America, seems more than is a Hostel

title: Perfect Location, Not 100% Clean
text: Once you get out of the lobby, Central Park is to your left! However, the rooms are miniature (I knew this coming in so am not going to say much about it) and the bed was an arms-length away from the room door and the bathroom door. It’s perfect for 1 person. The cleanliness wasn’t very thorough (had a hair in the shower and a stain on my towel!). I wiped everything down with my personal hand wipes beforehand as things were dusty or grimy (handles, AC, remote, inside drawers, closet). I also ironed the sheets and pillows before using them to steam off any germs. Overall, it wasn’t too bad for the location (and the price for the location). We got to the hotel easily from JFK using the Jamaica Air Train and subway.

title: DON'T BOOK THIS HOTEL
text: It was HORRIBLE staying here. Will never do that again. A hotel with so many issues should not be operating at all. There should be someone paying attention to this hotel and saying something to the manager who has poor management skills. Nia, the manager, was helpful at the beginning but there was no explanation at all as to why the hotel did not have a working elevator and when it would be fixed. (This should have been advised before people make the booking). Also we were locked out of our room and there was no explanation or help. The only solution was to sleep in another room without our bags, toothpaste or things. It was a horrible experience. Nia was never there at 6 am as stated by the receptionist who needs A LOT more training as she does not even know how to activate keys properly. Everyone just covers their mistakes and does not honestly correct them. Only good people there were Alberto, Guadalupe and Freddie who were very honest about problems in the hotel and helped fixed the issue. Upper management should shut down this hotel or change its management right away. I always had good experiences in la quinta and this was the worst ever. Our room was opened up by different people and we also opened up a room that was occupied so they clearly don't have a good system stablished. I hope there is repercussions for the manager of this hotel Nia. Never coming back. I did get a refund for the elevator and the horrible night we had but that does not fix the HORRIBLE experience.

title: Not satisfied
text: The breakfast has very limited options, there is just one elevator, it was broken and took days to fix it. There is just one way to get up/down (same as the emergency stairs). Good location, close to metro station but the hotel is not good overall. Will not stay again and would not recommend unless you're only looking for a place to sleep.

title: Do Not Waste Your Money And Sanity
text:
MANAGEMENT DOES NOT CARE ABOUT GUESTS OR EMPLOYEES.

Elevator doesn't work and we (my self and my 8yo child) are given a room on the 9th floor. Management's response is to offer free cancellation and no resort fee. The resort fee is a joke because this place is not maintained at all.  Also the elevator has been down since 2/14/22 according to signs on the doors, although I was not notified until 2/18/22, the day before our check in. As of now the elevator has been broken for 1 WEEK, is not expected to be working again soon, and apparently this is a recurring problem.  3rd day we arrive back to our room (after walking up 8 flights of stairs) to find that our room key doesn't work - the guests next door have the same problem as well as a man on the 12th floor. Response: they put us in a different room for the night, we can't access any of our luggage, passports, toiletries, etc. The only employee at the desk has no authorization to help guests in any form. The hotel has no emergency maintenance. There is no night manager. The only response this hotel gives to every problem it creates for its guests is "deal with it." Don't stay here because WHEN something goes wrong, they will not help you. If you expect a working elevator, don't stay here. If you expect a working door to your room, don't stay here. If you expect a hotel that allows its employees to help guests in need, don't stay here. I really can't think of any reason to ever stay here.

I have just checked out to spend the last night of my trip at a different hotel. There was NO REFUND given. Every employee told me to speak to the manager, who was not there and they wouldn't call the manager. I was first told the manager would ve there at 6am, then 7am, then 12pm. Employees have no ability to help anyone with anything.

title: Ascensor descompuesto
text: El único ascensor del hotel se descompuso y no se nos entregó información alguna, compensación o  ayuda cuando tuvimos que bajar 10 pisos por las escaleras al hacer el check out. Considero que se debió compensar de alguna forma mantener un ascensor descompuesto por la mitad de nuestro hospedaje

title: Offered price was a scam and room so dark I decided to sleep in another hotel
text:
When I booked the stay the rate which was displayed in Booking, and which I accepted, was around USD 69 + taxes. To my surprise, only after confirming my reservation I was informed the hotel charges an additional "resort fee" worth USD 30 + tax. This means, the fee is worth 43% of the total room rate. In other words, the fee is a hidden and disguised room rate. 
Finally, the room I was given was disgustingly dark, no natural light and above all not even similar to the photos in internet. I decided to loose the paid money, but I was not going to sleep in that dark dungeon, where only 1 of multiple light bulbs was working. 
The room was maybe worth USD 69 per night, but definitely NOT the USD 99 (69 + the hidden 30) which, was actually, the true price.

title: Room size
text: Great Hotel except that room extremely small for comfort; other than that it’s a wonderful place to stay. Breakfast is quite okay but other variety could be considered. This way can make the stay a worthwhile experience

title: Perfect hotel in a perfect location
text:
From check in to check out nothing was too much trouble for the staff here, and always with a welcoming smile.
24hr coffee, grab n go breakfast, tea time cookies etc etc.
Location perfect for anything midtown.
Special mention to Diana and Cynthia...Will definitely be back here x

title: Front desk and customer care
text:
Rude racist careles front desk . Don t stay here they are hustler.
I have experience abouf this hotel . I was in vacation and they charged me as 2 x time more with no reason . There is a girl in front desk who was rude careless person

title: Convenient and comfortable
text:
Great location for UWS and Central Park. I stayed here for 3 nights and was very comfortable. The Queen room was very petite but had everything I needed, comfortable bed and a good shower. There was no view but I was only sleeping in the room so not really bothered. 

Very special mention to the receptionist who checked me in on Wednesday 19th Jan in the afternoon. 
I left my wallet on the reception desk and she found it and returned it to me for which I am very grateful indeed. 

Would recommend for location, friendly staff and although amenities are basic the hotel offered what I needed. 

Thank you.

title: Otima Localização
text:
Localização excelente, se chegar cedo o café da manhã é bom 
Próximo ao metro e do lado do central park
a cama é boa, mas os quartos são pequenos 
o chuveiro é excelente e os funcionários são muito gentis

title: Hotel
text:
Day one front desk called a taxi fir us and we were ripped off. He charged $40 for 2 mile ride to St Patricks 
Day2 Frint desk guy gave completely incorrect directions.  
After being  there one night, we realized the hot water didn’t work in the bathroom so we had to change rooms.

title: Bad experience
text: Didnt received the room I booked, staff its not friendly and very lazy. You were supossed to ask every day for towels, the air dryer nos broken, the tub didnt worked when we arrived, the elevator(just 1) worked every now and then, stairs, lobby, always dirty. Great location.

title: Do not stay here!! Believe the reviews
text: Nasty rooms, rings around toilet, only one elevator for 14 floors and it only fits 2 people. Front desk think everything funny. $32 resort fee for NOTHING!! The breakfast looks like it’s never remade for 4hrs, just avoid this place! Stay at a Hilton in Time Square or the Comfort Inn in Brooklyn

title: Extremely small rooms and bad service
text:
The room was extremely small and it wasn’t clean
People in the front desk was very rude and kept me waiting for an hour to give me the room by saying that the room was not clean and they were cleaning it 
The elevator would take long time to arrive
Breakfast was acceptable
Location is really good 
Heating was very noisy and would not work properly 
I would not go back to this hotel

title: Natsha is devil
text:
Do your self a favor and book elsewhere 
The front desk natasha needs to get her self fixed. She is BAD being 

Location is nice
Room is super small
Bathroom is extremely smale
Elevator is pin in z as$

Do not recommend even if its for free

title: Great hotel for price :)
text:
Brilliant space and the room was clean and well kept. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was cleaned everyday. 
The hotel is situated  literally a minute or two from Central Park is a 20/30 minute walk to the theatre district.
I loved the location and would come again.

title: Our stay at La Quinta Inn
text:
Very small, but effective rooms. Works great if you do not plan to spend much time in the room. There's no desk or chair and not much of a view. Perfect location by Central Park. Quiet night. Very fast check-in and check-out. Bathroom is separated from the room by a glass sliding door that is NOT see through, but also NOT sound proof. Bathroom has a small window. Only downsides are that breakfast starts at 7am (our train departs at 7 15am, so I can't comment on breakfast) and our coffee machine was not working and also had only decaf option, but I'm sure that could be fixed if reported. 
Overall, I would decide based on the price you are offered if it is worth it or not. If you want a good deal and are flexible (not relying on this accommodation), I recommend booking the same night you want to stay.

title: Wyndham Reservations has HORRIFIC customer service
text:
I was calling the hotel to confirm my reservation booked through a third party operator and the man on the line (who did not speak fluent English, in his defense) refused to look up the confirmation code saying, "I should have booked directly with La Quinta" and when I asked him to look up the number he hung up on me. This was one of those truly bizarre customer disservice encounters; like, it's literally your job, guy. 
Again, this is not targeted at this particular La Quinta, just at Wyndham Reservations overall. So now I guess I'm hoping that the reservation went through, since the people employed at customer service, frankly, seem to suck.

title: Big disappointment in a lovely area of town.
text: For what they charge for the room they could easily invest in upgrades that could have provided an infinitely better experience. Pleasant staff do not make up for the short comings of this facility. Nestled in the beautiful upper west it was a disappointment.

title: Rooms are dirty and staff is horrible
text: If I could give this zero stars, I would. We booked a king size room but when we got there they said they were sold out and had to put us in a Queen room. When we got to the room I was disgusted with how dirty it was, but the only reason we stayed was because we were planning to be out of the hotel as much as possible. The longer I looked around the room, the worse it got: Our shower had mold growing all over it, the toilet paper holder was absolutely disgusting with rust and grime, the bedside tables were dusty and filthy even the lamp was caked with grime and clearly looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in years, the ledge above our sink was slanted because the shelf was falling off from the wall, and even when we went to turn on the TV we saw that the battery back to the remote wasn’t even on it! Then I accidentally injured my foot and couldn’t walk as much, so we decided to leave one day early because it was so uncomfortable in the room. The day we were leaving I told the front desk about all the issues to which they didn’t offer anything and just said “this isn’t the first time we’ve heard this”. THEN I just happened to get in the elevator with the manager. He spoke to me first, asking how my stay was, so I was honest and said the room is disgusting and I didn’t have a good stay so he came by to look. He immediately started gaslighting me, telling me the mold I saw is because it’s a different grout than the other silicone they use in the corners to which I asked then why on the “different grout” it’s clearly white in one part and changes to color further up the same line. He just kept trying to tell me I was wrong about everything that was dirty, and argued with me on how everything was fine as is, when I kept showing him issues he literally waved me off and left. I am horrified and warn anyone looking at this hotel to RUN AWAY.

title: Great location.  Subpar service and property.
text: I wish I could say something positive.   The staff were less than helpful, the heating/cooling system was broken in the room and even the toilet paper dispenser was broken, taped together and hanging by it's side.  I was accused of not checking out when I was booked for another night.  They called me at an event I had come into town for.   When they discovered their mistake, I didn't even get an apology.

title: Location
text:
The room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in! If you are claustrophobic this is not for you. Also tough having only one small elevator, sometimes it’s challenging to get on, specially around breakfast time. 
The location is great. This was our first time in NYC, I’m guessing the high price is normal for the great location.

title: Central Park
text: Brownstone set in a block from central park, nice stroll to the park or subway, did i mention free breakfast in NYC. Least expensive hotel i found in manhattan, let alone new york. Recommend for s weekend getaway

title: Scary check in
text: When I arrived at the hotel they did not have a room for me even though I had a confirmation code for a reservation. Be persistent the first front desk person was absolutely worthless, then a second one with more knowledge stepped in and was able to fix the problem.

title: Very professional staff and room were clean
text: Everything were perfect for my stay, I was impressed by the staffs knowledge and professionalism toward checking in and checking out. I will definitely stay longer when business allows me to spend the night.

title: Small room, great deal!
text: Two nights in NY so that our six year old could watch Macy’s Parade. Nine months in advance got us a great deal! The room was small but clean and ideally located for the parade. Book early for next year.

title: Location Only
text: Front desk is a mess. Hotel is dated. Elevator is slow. Rooms are not clean and they are small. I had to move sideways in the bathroom. Bathroom was not cleaned 100% . Location was excellent. It is a shame!

title: PESIMO SERVICIO
text:
Usan mucha PUBLICIDAD ENGAÑOSA para atraer alojamiento, pésimo servicio, pésima atención.  NO DAN DESAYUNO, lo cual te obliga a gastar fuera. NUNCA HICIERON ASEO DE LA HABITACIÓN NI ARREGLO DE CAMAS, Baños DAÑADOS, secador DAÑADO, no había quien saque la BASURA. Tampoco servía el control remoto, la tina no tenía tapa, las llaves de la ducha estaban en mal estado. Tampoco disponen de un lugar para guardar el equipaje.
No había nadie que hable en español, a pesar se alojaban latinos.
Nos asignaron una habitación y las tarjetas de entrada no funcionaban. Nos cambiaron de habitación y el problema persistía. Fue una auténtica molestia.
No había quien te lleve las maletas, no hay quien limpie las áreas comunes. TODO ESTO CON EL PRETEXTO DE LA PANDEMIA... cuando en realidad no querían incurrir en gastos. Apestaba la basura en el corredor y olía a comida podrida.
En el hotel solo había 1 persona en la recepción, de ahí nadie más atendía.
No cambiaron la toalla del piso del baño y estuvo 6 días sucia. Al desocupar la habitación, nadie te atiende. Nadie te entrega las llaves formalmente. Si deseas pasar las PEORES VACACIONES DE TU VIDA, aquí puedes venir.

title: Spend a little extra
text: I thought I had gotten a good price but didn’t realize until I got there that quality was sacrificed. Staff was not welcoming. The room looked dusty and I did not feel comfortable sleeping on the bed. Also there was a toilet flushing sound all night. I had surgery the next morning and because my lack of sleep it cause me more anxiety. It was a waste of money and time.

title: Not Even 1 Star Filthy Disgusting Nothing Works
text:
Nothing work. 
Clock with wrong time that cannot be changed. 
TV with 3 Channels. No Cable. 
No Internet. 
Scratched Furnture 
Torn Lampshade 
Safe but no key. 
Hairdryer that is broken. 
2 hangers and they have no more. 
AC/Heat does not work. 
Staff instructed to lie to guests. 
Non responsive Manager. 
Filthy And Disgusting. 
The worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. 
Maybe worth $50 a night but no more. 
Awful and Disgusting.

title: Dump
text: It looked pretty reasonable in the booking page, but it was a tiny room with a pokey little bathroom, no desk and chair to work from, and barely any light came through the little window that looked into a back wall.

title: Horrible stay
text: We stayed one night at this hotel as we were in nyc for a funeral. The first room we received had hairs in the bed, crumbs all over, and no phone to call the front desk. We were given a new room, which seemed better at first until the bed bugs came out. Upon check out we informed the front desk of the bed bugs (including pictures), and were time someone would be in touch to follow up about a refund. I emailed them the pictures, called and left messages and have yet to speak with or hear from anyone. Very disappointed

title: Location A+ Everything Else C
text:
When we checked in the very small lobby was overrun. There were suitcases stored against the wall, people sprawled across the love seats, and ok but not great mask compliance. Staff were wearing masks and guests mostly were although some were beneath their noses.

The first room we were sent to was locked from the inside so it appeared it was occupied. We ended up moved to a room on another floor which was a corner room so it seemed to have more space than others have commented about.  

The bed was comfortable and firm.

The elevator is teeny tiny and not too reliable in terms of when it will show up. We have walked up and down many flights during our multi day stay here.

For some reason mask wearing became less common as we reached early work week. Sure we are vaccinated but we still don’t want to run into an exposed person or a few. Museums felt much safer in that regard vs hotel.

Parking is free on the street IF (big if) you are lucky enough to nab a spot. We were for a couple of days (yea!) but paid over $60 for 3rd day of parking. It evened out for us but if we had to pay $150 plus for 3 days of parking it would not have been worth it.

Overall a very mixed bag.

title: Great Location - Ok Property - Not Worth the $$$
Awful place, you are better off paying a little extra elsewhere
text: We got a room here through the app Hopper, which contained completely unrealistic pictures of what this place actually looks like. The bedding was stained and disgusting, and there was hair on it. The toilet clogged up and overflowed, and when I called the front desk to ask for help, they thought they put me on hold but I could hear them laughing on the other side of the line about the fact they didn’t have any other rooms to put us in. They said they would bring me towels so that I could dry the room and I said, nope; one of YOU are doing that. And I’m talking to the manager about some reimbursement. Absolutely disgusting room, sh*tty plumbing for both toilet and the shower, super small room,  and staff that doesn’t give a d*mn. AWFUL. You are better off paying extra somewhere else than staying in this s** hole.

title: Unsafe Covid practices
text:
Do not rent this place. They misrepresent what you are getting. They do not practice standard safety protocol for Covid.
Great location but nothing else is worth the hassle of this place
Our stay was 5 days and our room was never made up. There wasnt a single chair in the room to sit in. We paid extra to upgrade to a room with a sofa and were told upon arrival that they didnt have any sofas in their rooms. I wrote a long lust for management of the inadequacies of the hotel and the only response I got was one word ‘sorry’

title: Amazing place to stay
text: I was very happy with the stay here. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate me and were very understanding and flexible with some of my requests. I felt taken care of and welcomed. I was shocked to see that each staff member was happy and willing to go above and beyond.

title: Amazing compassionate management
text:
My beautiful magical wife was near the end of a fantastic stay and became ill with a debilitating migraine.  Unable to travel, we needed to alter her plans, add an additional day to her stay, and move her flight.  The hotel's policy would ordinarily require her to come downstairs to the front desk to sign a couple documents and present her payment information.  However, when explaining the situation to the man who answered the phone, he immediately understood how challenging their policy would be for my spouse.  His name is Steve and is one of the managers of this Wyndham property.  He went above and beyond to accommodate us and volunteered to bring the paperwork up to her to sign, allowing her to focus on her health and wellness.  In a world where "cover your ass" is the norm, especially within large companies, where policy and procedure rule the day, Steve was compassionate and kind, and this kindness was beyond words.  Thank you, La Quinta and Wyndham for employing the kind of person that can hear the guests so clearly and find solutions to provide comfort and care.  After all, hotels are a home-away-from-home, shouldn't they always feel that way too?  

Thank you, Steve

title: Seriously - don’t bother
text: I’m from New York and am used to small spaces but the room I stayed in was absurdly small. Since checkout I’ve been charged THREE times for the stay to which the front desk responded “we don’t see those charges” and did nothing further to assist when I called. There was no hot water so only cold showers were taken, the TV didn’t work, the heater smelled like it was burning, and one of the lamps didn’t even have a lightbulb. For as cheap as the stay was SUPPOSED to be I didn’t complain, but now the entire situation is unacceptable.

title: A sense of humor helps!
text:
Upon arriving at the hotel we struggled locating it.. it is not well marked by street number or name
 As scaffolding obscures them. Parking is available with a sizeable discount for hotel guests 1 block over. Check in was fast and easy.. while old,  the facility is spotless.. the Staff is great. And Central Park is 1/2 block away.
So that leaves the room.The room takes a sense of humor. We had never even considered the rooms would be as small as they are. About 3 foot clearance around the bed. 2 tiny side tables and an rv sized bathroom.  The mattress felt dreadfully hard. I'll admit it I was close to tears. Spending over $1020.00 Plus 24,000 go pass points for 4 days did not jive with the room we ended up in. It was more youth hostel than hotel.
Here's where the sense of humor comes in. We've made every joke conceivable about the size of the room. And in doing so it's taken on a charm of its own. Our highest praise is given with the promise, when we return to NYC we will stay here again. It's completely worth it.

title: Dishonest pricing
text: If you are comparing prices, be aware that this hotel charges an additional “facility use” fee on top of the room charge that you pay online.  The front desk explained that it was to cover Wifi, breakfast, etc, but of course there’s no option to stay in the room without the building it’s part of, so, it’s just a way of misleading people.  I suggest calling ahead before booking to find out what it will be.  The rooms are tiny, the Wifi is not strong enough to stream movies (had to use my iPhone to create a hotspot), and there is often a wait for the elevator.  The location is great, it’s clean and the staff are friendly.  Still I wouldn’t stay again because of the misleading pricing.

title: Stay away! La Quinta management: you should be ashamed.
text: DIRTY! A bug on the bed, an unknown hair in the bed. Yuck! We planned a 5 night stay but were out of there after one night. La Quinta management: you should be ashamed. The rooms are the size of a closet with a small double bed to match. Staff was nice and understanding, but not enough to offset the above mentioned demerits. My advice: stay elsewhere.

title: extra charging without noticing
text:
When you checkin , they ask for a guarantee, in my case 300 usd for a week, of which you are not informed at all before you get there. 
when you check out, they said verbally , everything will be returned in few days.. after 2 weeks, no refund , i try to contact them. no email for contact, just by phone. if you don't speak english , you're not gonna make it. I spend 2 hours on the phone, with several people, to find out they refund on a card that is not mine (possibile on their own card) and that they will refund me only 200usd. why do you hold the 100? the answer was "facility fee, everybody pays it" ... GREAT DISAPPOINTMENT

title: La peor experiencia en hotel
text: La Quinta habia sido para mi por mucho tiempo una buena opcion para hospedarse.  Cuando necesite un hotel para estos dias, no dude en hospedarme ahi.  Resulto lo peor que me ha sucedido. Un hotel  bien ubicado, pero asqueroso  y ademas te disfrazan los cargos adicionales por servicios que no te dan.  Pague 3 noches y use solo 2 ya que no pudimos mas.  preferimos pagar en otro lugar y por el mismo precio o hasta menos,  conseguimos un hotel excelente.  Recomiendo fuertemente no se hospeden en este hotel,  se van a arrepentir.

title: Unsatisfactory
text: 1)Noisy air conditioning unit, hard to sleep with that level of discomfort  2) 2 out of 3 nights , no towels available after making room . Front desk person always with a excuse on doing laundry for 25 more minutes but never provided. 3)Rug on room and common areas very old and very dirty. As well a very messy elevator 4) No hotel Manager on Duty for the weekend so no person at the hotel to take complaints 5) After all the above, I feel like overpaid for a $250 a night room . Should received my money back. 6) Pictures on Hotel Web Site, very far away from reality. 7) Smells pretty bad all over the facility,

title: Good location, everything else has room for improvement
text: very tight room, difficult to move inside and access the bathroom. Very loud air conditioning unit. A fault with the electric outlet attached to the night stand produced a shotcut, twice. It was not fixed, despite two reports to the front end staff.

title: Central Park concert
text: This hotel is best for its location only 1 block from the entrance to the concert. Trying to find it can be challenging as it’s name is only on one side of their awning and very small. Only their address was visible on the building by the front door. Breakfast was pretty good but they are overly strict in shutting it down at10am sharp. Do not be late or you can’t even get a cup of juice.

title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever
text: Checked in on August 1st and we were given a room on the 10th floor that had a leaky toilet and was repaired earlier that day and this room was taken out of service  by the maintenance personnel so the caulk could seal around the base of the toilet.   Our reservation was made about 3 or 4 months ago and later in the day on August 1st, we discovered the leaky toilet as it began to leak sewage  all over the bath room.   The Front Desk could not move us to another room and there was no Engineer on Duty after hours to fix this matter.   We had to experience this for 3 days until the Front Desk could move us to a room on the 7th floor.   Our room rate was roughly $150 a night and upon checking out we were told we would receive a credit of $30 a night for each of the 3 nights we were in the room that should have been taken out of service.   I am completely surprised we charged at all for the hotel's mismanagement !!!   Worst hotel experience ever !!!

title: Location
text: Location is the only positive regarding this hotel. Locks didn't work, toilet backed up and getting things repaired quite difficult. Employee yelling and using very inappropriate language in front of guests. Dirty furniture in the lobby.

title: I’ll never stay here again
text: This was the most terrible experience I’ve had I had to book a whole Nother hotel for the remaining of my stay you guys did terrible when booking my hotel from the room to everything up and above Terrible

title: Worst Hotel Ever
text: This place is 100 years old and it shows. Furniture is old outdated and ragged. Rooms are very very small. Elevator fits 3 people max. Lobby was filthy. Hotel looks like a men’s shelter. There is absolutely no parking anywhere. Carpets were heavily stained.

title: Location, location
text:
Fantastic location. Several good restaurants are just steps away from the lobby as is Central Park.
 Rooms are small. Pillows were subpar.
Very attentive & hardworking staff.
Breakfast buffet is helpful.

title: Behind Closed Doors
text: This is not our first stay at this hotel, but it was definitely unlike any other!  We lost power in our room and tried to call downstairs multiple times.  No answer.  Finally decided to go down and check on the status....our door would not open.  The 3 of us each started calling downstairs and even corporate!  Finally, someone came and had to drill the lock.  That's not the issue---the issue is that no one from management came to check on us while we were locked in our room or when we got moved to another room.  It was a very traumatic 2 plus hour experience.  Not to mention, we lost our whole morning New York.  We did get another room, but it was our last day and were leaving the following morning.  Guess they didn't care if we were locked in our room and lost half our day in the city.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: The only challenge is the smallness of the bathroom for a lengthy stay. If you are overweight, you will find it difficult to sit on the toilet for the kind of room we had, because the pedestal sink juts out too much. The staff is wonderfully courteous and helpful, and the hotel’s location to restaurants and stores great.

title: NYC MANHATTAN
text: Great location for your Manhattan adventure. Your neat Times Square, Harlem and the Fashion district. Parking is a concern, but your able to walk to so many amazing attractions. Customer Servive is great

title: do not stay here! They have ants and I attached pictures!
text: To start off, when we checked in there were two guys making a big deal about bugs in their room and were requesting a refund. Instead of taking that as a red flag, we still booked with them. We got up to our room and found a single ant but didn’t wanna make a big deal so we continued our stay and then two nights later we come in from a night out and find tons of ants crawling from the window and corner of the floor onto the nightstand. So, then we went downstairs with pictures and videos and the lady at the front desk denied what was right infront of her and said they had to send someone up to check and it would be about 10 minutes. 30 minutes later…. Someone finally comes up and after seeing everything, she calls the front desk from our phone and says “ yes there are ants and it looks like they’re coming in from the window and they’re all over the stand and phone and lamp, so you can probably change their room” then the lady hangs up the phone and exits. About 20 minutes later we call the front desk to and say hey what’s going on, are we getting a refund and a new room? and then she has the AUDACITY to say “oh our lady said she didn’t find anything”. She flat out LIED. I think it’s because the room service lady who came up spoke in Spanish and she thought we wouldn’t understand but she was utterly mistaken, we were right next to her as she described word for word the ants. I also have PHOTOS. In the end, the lady refused to change our room or give us a refund so that’s when I decided to post the pictures here and hopefully stop any future guests from staying here if you’re not a fan of bugs in your room. THEY HAVE ANTS. DO NOT STAY HERE. BUGS IN THEIR ROOMS. terrible front desk service. LIARS. PHOTOS BELOW AS PROOF.

title: Good and affordable
text:
Good location, good price and nice staff. 
Check in and Out were great.
The room was clean. The whole room and Bathroom a little small but not an issue. Breakfast could be better. Not one good cereal. No cream cheese or peanut butter.

title: Amazing location for Central Park
text: We stayed overnight for our stayover in NYC. Hotel is located half a block from Central Park, and is close to amazing restaurants, shops and stores. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Breakfast had lots of options, and staff was friendly and engaging.

title: This hotel remains a great location with friendly staff
text: We had stayed at this hotel several times pre-COVID. It's convenient--a short walk from our son's apartment and a block from Central Park. We didn't know what to expect this time since it had been over a year.The staff was friendly and helpful (as usual), the room was clean, the manager was extremely helpful, and they are back to serving hot breakfasts. It's a great choice (and value) if you don't require luxury hotel amenities. We don't.

title: Great location but that’s about it
text: Nice quiet street, close to Central Park. Tiny elevator leading to very narrow hallway then what might be the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. It also had a microscopic bathroom— you can brush your teeth while using the toilet. There was no shelf so clean towels and Kleenex were on the toilet tank. There were 3 narrow, dirty windows, one of which had the small window A/C unit that ran constantly. I had 2 bags, a dog in a crate and a crate dolly. It was difficult getting everything in the door and was nearly impossible to get leave due to the permanent bed position  and the door. There are no bell staff members and poor housekeepers have to use the same microscopic elevator for their equipment, trash, laundry etc.

title: great place to stay
text: A great place to stay, centrally located great location near trains and buses.  Nice staff, very helpful.   A good breakfast, very fast internet.  Would recommend it to friends, Associated, co-workers and family

title: Great Stay
text: After doing some research and reading the reviews, I chose La Quinta for it's proximity to Central Park and to the subway. It turned out to be a terrific choice. The staff was excellent, the accommodations fit the price and the room was very clean and very comfortable. And it was nice that the let me check my bag while I took a Sunday Morning walk in Central Park before heading to JFK. Thank's for a great stay!

title: Not for family
text: I’ve been charged before check in at the hotel and after I saw the room we didn’t fit I asked for full refund and I got charged the value Of Two nights instead of one. And haven’t received my refund of 17 days I was about to stay there.

title: Our hotel room had no hot water during  our stay . Hotel manager never returned a phone call not worth the money
text: Hotel had issues with hot water both days we were on the property. I had to shower in a different room both days as they had no other rooms to move  us to. Hotel manger never called back to make the situation right . Not a great place to stay

title: Great location
text: Great location near Central Park, within close walking distance to the subway. near plenty of places to eat. Try the Muffin Café for breakfast. Friedman's is delish as well.  Place was really clean and had sanitation down. Smaller rooms but to be expected for NYC. Prices were good.

title: Helpful front desk
text: I checked in late, when most businesses in the area were closed. Jesus and Dwane went out of their way to answer my questions and narrow down a way to get me food late night. True hospitalitarians in the face of what probably looked like a hungry/grumpy guest.

title: Cockroaches and broken toilet seat
text: Don’t risk staying here. You may very well regret it. When I asked at reception about the cockroach problem, I was told that this has been a problem on the past. I was also perplexed how it was possible that housekeeping didn’t deal with the toilet seat, assuming they were responsible for cleaning the bathroom.

title: Beware of a day House keepers.
text: Someone in House Keeping refuses to do their job correctly. I asked for clean towels, the used towels were stuffed under the bed, and I found med length black hair in the bed. I have cropped red hair. Sad.

title: Small room
text: Unacceptable about full disclosure of the room. Room was the size of twin bed child's room with no furniture in it. Was able to open the door without getting out of bed. Smh. Will not return to this location.

title: Nice NYC experiance
text: It was good value of money to stay at that hotel, with great location and good atmosphere, very close to the public transportation as well as to several museums and the central park. Good recommendation for people to stay especially single person or couples, the rooms are very small, but I never mind since I was a lone.

title: Great location. Awesome service!
text: We stayed there for few days in March. Very close to everything. We were able to park our car at the parking garage a block away for very reasonable price ($35/day - super cheap and good luck finding street parking in NY, was not gonna even try) Room was nice, clean and no issues. Steve was extremely nice!!! He was very helpful and always willing to answer any questions. Location is great, you can walk everywhere, plenty restaurants for food lovers. As I don't like to go back to the same place while I travel I would choose this hotel for Steves personally next time I visit NY. Thank you Steve for everything!

title: Best location at a great price
text: This is a prime location hotel, near everything you may need during your stay (2 min from the BC train or 5 from the red line). Extremely friendly and thoughtful staff, and with a reasonable price. My stay was great and uneventful. They have free coffee and fruit 24/7 which is a plus.

title: Toiletries not included.
text: No soap or shampoo. The room attendant didn’t care. Stain that looked like a $80 for 3 hour motel on the box spring cover. Room was cold. Desk attendant was pleasant. For the money I would expect more.

title: Good for a break!
text: Good rooms, privacy, staff was really nice and they were following health guidelines! Everything was great! They have ice and coffee all day, so my husband was very happy! We walked to a bunch of places and Central Park! and we were lucky enough to park right in front of the hotel!

title: A Very Cozy Hotel
text: Very clean and with a very nice knowledgeable staff.I will definitely come back there again. It was very close to my job and the location is nice.The room was perfect for me and very clean and comfortable.

title: Kicked In Door, Dirty Sheets
text: Yes, it was inexpensive, but the door lock had been broken and left un-repaired--really, a new door was necessary--making it impossible to leave any personal items that wouldn't fit in the safe. And while the sheets had been changed, I'm guessing it happened two or three days before I got there.

title: Awesome location!!!
text: If you’re looking for a fancy place to stay, this is not it. The room is small and window shades did not work. But that did not matter as we were only 2 minutes away from Central Park! Location, location!

title: Great Location.....Needs Attention.
text: Having stayed at this hotel twice within the last six months w/o issue, we were expecting a repeat of those visits.  NOT.  Upon check-in there were immediate maintenance issues with the room which should have been noted by housekeeping and the maintenance staff advised.  Small issues some...like the paper holder in the bathroom was loose and hanging, the toilet seat loose, and the shelf pitching forward enough that anything placed on it slid off.  Not so small....there was no smoke detector.  More seriously, on the first night the hall on our floor smelled strongly of pot/weed smoke, which penetrated well into our room.  On the second night, it was the same with cigarette smoke.  Not pleasant...but obviously the reason that the smoke detector in our room was missing.  Mask requirements were not enforced with neither staff nor guests.  The elevator ran so erratically throughout our 4 day stay that we often had to use the stairs...to the ninth and 12th floors. How could a hotel with one elevator not have a 24-hr elevator maintenance contract?  On the day of our supposed check-out, we found that an Ipad and a piece of art (in a tube) were missing from the room.  GM Steve was very nice and said all of the right things, showing me the key codes of all entry into the room....but regardless...we checked in with both items and they were gone.  Given the theft...and my EMT visit to the hospital after climbing the 9 flights of stairs (72 yo here), we missed our flight to Mexico and had to stay and extra 2 nights.  Our second room was larger, but the telephone did not work at all, and one bedside lamp had a broken bulb but still did not work even with a good bulb.  Steve comped one night, but seriously....this was the visit from hell....and the room would have been empty had we not had these problems.  Comping both nights would have been the right thing to do, but it is not at all the issue here.  That said...we love the location and actually the hotel....but have very mixed feelings about giving it another try.  We considered a bit of a treasure on the UWS..sadly gone.

title: Weed and smoke smell.
text: It smelled so horribly of weed and cigarette smoke. We had to sleep with windows open to be able to even breathe. All they said was “sorry” when we told them. Don’t advertise as being a smoke free hotel when it’s not. I’ve stayed in Vegas casino hotels that have smelled less like smoke than this place.

title: Sleepless nights!
text: You take a vacation to distress but I end up miserable after a 2 night stay in this hotel. The room is so small (8x10’), no windows, the A/C is so loud I end up turning it off most of the time, if u are not careful u will bang up your head on the sink standing up from the toilet seat. And the worst part of it  is they charged $50.00 resort fee...It was a nightmare! Please avoid this hotel at all cost...

title: Horrible experience
text:
I booked a room for 3 people on the morning of 10/2/2020. That night I wanted to check my reservation, never got an email and my credit card was never charged. So I booked it again and the same thing happened. I tried calling the hotel, no one ever picks up the phone. So I called Winyham customer service. They said they had both my reservations and to cancel one I would be charged $200.00. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was disconnected. When I got to the hotel I told them what happened and they canceled one of the reservations. I ask how come no one answers the phone. They said it doesn’t work. The hotel smelled like weed and air freshener. Got to our room, there where no towels. Called the front desk they said they would send some up. Two hours later we got 1 bath towel and 2 hand towels for three people. One of the shades on the window was broken and would not close. We had trouble sleeping because the smell of weed was so strong, I was feeling sick to my stomach. In the stairway between the 3rd and 4th floor there was a half of a smoked joint on the stairs. It says on the website free breakfast. It was stale croissants, stale donuts, and moldy apples. Upon leaving we noticed the smoke detector in our room was covered in tinfoil. When I check out I tried to tell the front desk what happened and there was a seedy guy standing there chiming in on the conversation. He was making me very nervous, I had to just leave. 
I tried calling Wyndham customer care. I told them what happened, then I was disconnected. They called me back and I was disconnected again. I called back twice and was disconnected. 
All the Wyndham Hotels we ever stayed at, we never had anything happen like this. We felt like we were staying in a drug den. 
Don’t ever stay in this hotel. You will regret it.

title: Great location to live like a New Yorker
text:
I stayed here with my daughter earlier this month.  This is a great UWS location if you want be in a neighborhood I kept missing the hotel entrance because it totally blends in with the vibe of the area.  So easy to walk to central park, natural history museum, tons of places to eat and shop without getting on a train.  The best part is we found parking on the street.  The room itself was not big but comfortable looking out on the street which is pretty quiet.  Don't plan on the breakfast but walk out the door take a right and lots of places within a minute walk.  
We stayed at marriott battery park a few days later much nicer room but paid $50 for parking so factor that into your decision.

title: Great location and rates
text: The rates were great.  The rooms are comfortable and clean.  The staff is very polite and helpful.  I stayed in this hotel several times and I will be back. I got better rates thru booking websites than with the hotel directly.

title: Great place
text: This La Quinta Inn property is great for its proximity to the American Museum of Natural History, Lincoln Center and other sites. The staff is professional, friendly and helpful. In these COVID-19 times the included breakfast is very limited: cold cereal, instant oatmeal cooked in a microwave, toast. The location feels like a residential neighborhood. The hotel itself and the street its on are quiet. The room I stayed in is very small; it had a queen sized bed  with barely enough room to walk around it. When I wanted to lounge in my  room I had to sit on the bed. There was not room for chairs in the room. The water got hot quickly and retained its temperature. The shower maintained excellent water pressure. The air conditioner was noisy. My room had a view of a "courtyard' which wasn't much to look at. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from within short walking distance of the hotel. Overall this is a terrific hotel if you're mainly looking for a comfortable room to sleep in when not out playing tourist for most of the day.

title: Awful experience.
text:
The worst experience ever, I reserved a room for a family of 6 and the confirmation explained it was to rooms separated by a door and non smoking rooms.
At the arriving time we got to small rooms , not as the ones on the pictures they showed and one smelled really bad to cigarettes/ skunk smell as well Not appropriate for families or kids.
We had no option at the last minute so we had no where el to stay. 
Administration should work on this issues.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: The experience at this hotel was welcoming and relaxing. My family appreciated the excellent customer service from Ms. Beverly at the front desk. During these Covid times a calm professional made an overnight experience very pleasant.

title: Front Dest shift turn over to other staff.
text: It was unexpected & unfortunate mistake of Front Desk staff..Didn't get  back our 2 Rooms Security deposit upon checked out. We waited for 3 months thru postage delivery due to Receptionist insufficient fund to repay us. We feel we've  taken advantage. Room is clean but very small for 2 guests. Safety box  when locked could not open with the key with my lap top inside and with the looming departure imminent with the prospect of abandoning my lap top in the safe, it was only release in the last moment as the safe was faulty. Elevator is small & unusable for a few hours as we were on the 10th floor. As seniors we are unable to walk up the stairs. We missed out our half day tour.  Close to Central Park is good & free breakfast.

title: Friendly
text: I stayed at LaQuinta Inn Central Park West for a week while my apartment bathroom was being remodeled. The room was clean. I had trouble connecting my work laptop (due to a security setting on my laptop) to the hotel WiFi and the girl at the front desk helped me figure it out. Steve, the manager, was also flexible with price matching Expedia prices when I had to extend the reservation by a few days.

title: Unbeatable location in Manhattan, 1 blk from Central Park
text: I would definitely stay here again...especially if I can get the COVID-19 scare discount price again. Surprisingly quiet--then again, everyone was hunkered down at home because of the pandemic. The location is unbeatable. You are one block from Central Park. You have countless bars and restaurants etc all within a short walk. This was a really good find for me!

title: Friendly staff, great location and comp breakfast!
text: Staff was very friendly and accommodating! Rooms are small (something I am not used to) but it gave me the full NY experience coming from Arizona. I'm not sure if there more elevators but we were all the way in the 14th floor and elevators were pretty slow. I am an active person, therefore I did not mind walking down stairs but if you have any problems walking steps, I recommend to ask for the lower floors. Breakfast was great, I was there for 3 days and each morning was a different menu. I loved how close we were to Park Central and subway stations. Location on this place is a 10! Literally everything only a few minutes walking distance.

title: A Gem by Central Park
text:
1/2 block from Central Park and 5 blocks from my kids. Perfect spot.
Near many restaurants, and cultural spots. Small rooms but very acceptable for the price with breakfast. Friendly and accommodating staff.

title: Nice, clean but small rooms
text: I booked directly with LaQuintaonline webside since the rates are the same, but when I checked in they charged my card again saying that when I booked online, it was just a 'hold' on the card and I should get a refund.  As of this writing, I still need to check my credit card bill. The place could be good or not so good depending on your purpose of being there.  There are some nice restaurants and shops around, but if you want to go the the East side of town, Uber can be expensive and there are no crosstown subways, only buses. The room itself where we stayed (Queen bed for two) was extremely small. Your luggage should just be a backpack or an underseater, however, it was functional. You can't move around the room. The room and bathroom were clean and the bed comfortable. As a rule, I never put my luggage on the bed.  Also a plus were the complimentary water bottles and breakfast. I thought the breakfast was good, you can make your own waffles, they served scrambled eggs and sausage, etc. Overall, it was okay, the property was located in the upper west side where is was less noisy.

title: Schrecklich und dennoch weiterzuempfehlen
text:
Wir verbrachten in Februar zu zweit 5 Nächte in diesem Hotel. 
Wir hatten glücklicherweise lediglich Handgepäck dabei, große Koffer hätten schlichtweg nicht in das Zimmer gepasst. Das Bett war ca. 1,20m breit und füllte das gesamte Zimmer aus. Das Bad war ebenfalls sehr eng. Es ließ sich nur ein kleines Fenster im Bad einen Spalt weit öffnen. Die Sauberkeit war zu keinem Zeitpunkt zu beanstanden. Das Frühstück ist für einen Europäer mit einigermaßen gesunder Ernährung eine Katastrophe. Es besteht nur aus fetten, zuckerhaltigen Fertigprodukten. Gemüse gibt es nicht, das wenige Obst, das vorhanden war, war schnell vergriffen oder bestand nur aus Druckstellen. Gegessen und getrunken wurde ausschließlich von und mit Plastikbesteck. Der Raum war so klein, dass Gäste teilweise auf dem Flur im stehen gegessen haben.
Das Personal war nur mäßig bemüht und engagiert. Einfachste Fragen zum Sightseeing in New York konnten nicht beantwortet werden. 
Der Aufzug stellt tatsächlich ein Problem dar. Nicht selten haben wir ca. 10/15 Minuten mit dem Warten und Fahren im Aufzug verbracht. 
Die Lage ist herrlich. Eine U-Bahn ist direkt um die Ecke, der Central Park eine Gehminute entfernt. Auch zu Fuß kommt man sehr schnell in das Stadt Zentrum.

Es war keine Erholung nach einem langen Tag in New York in das Hotel zu kommen. Dennoch hat es für 5 Nächte/ 6 Tage ausgereicht. Wir waren jeden Tag von 8:00 Uhr morgens bis 8:00 uhr Abends unterwegs. Wer sich gerne auch untertags in seinem Hotel ausruhen/ aufhalten möchte, ist in diesem Hotel nicht richtig aufgehoben. Wer lediglich eine "günstige" Möglichkeit zum schlafen braucht, ist mit diesem Hotel gut bedient. Für einen kurzen Aufenthalt ohne viel Gepäck würde ich dieses Hotel nochmals buchen, jedoch ohne Frühstück. Vor allem die Lage ist das ausschlaggebend Gute an diesem Hotel.

title: Correct
text:
Nous avons réservé cet hôtel pour un séjour de six nuits, petit-déjeuner inclus.

Rien à redire sur l'accueil et le sourire du personnel ! 

Petite déconvenue toutefois sur le petit-déjeuner : à notre arrivée, on nous apprend que celui-ci ne pourra pas être maintenu car la salle de petit-déjeuner est en plein travaux. Soit, ce sont des choses qui arrivent ! Sauf que, nous avions réservé sur booking seulement quelques jours avant notre arrivée et l'option a été maintenue par l'hôtel (sachant très bien qu'une période réfection de cet espace allait avoir lieu). Voyageurs, nous tenons au petit déjeuner qui permet de lancer la journée, et avons été un peu déçu sur le manque de transparence de l'établissement sur ce point et sur les "peut-être demain" que nous avons eu chaque soir à nos retours à l'hôtel. 

Concernant la chambre : celle que nous avions retenue était correcte : propreté au top (serviettes impeccables, sanitaires toujours très propres). Toutefois, nous aurions certainement du choisir la formule au-dessus : notre chambre était si petite que nous n'avions même pas la place d'ouvrir notre valise au sol ! Obligés de la poser en permanence sur le lit. Attention donc, les photo présentes ici ne reflètent pas la petitesse des chambres. Si vous le pouvez, choisissez la 2ème option qui propose des chambres un peu plus grandes (étant donné la différence de prix ça vaut le coup!).
Nous étions à New-York en février et avons souffert de la chaleur dans notre chambre : même le chauffage éteint nous avions chaud. Cela s'explique certainement par une conduite de chauffage dans la sdb qui diffusait énormément de chaleur. Nous dormions donc la fenêtre entrouverte.

Cet hôtel reste tout de même un bon compris car il est très bien situé : une rue agréable, à 30 m de Central Park, 5minutes à pieds de 2 stations de métro. La literie est confortable, et surtout, c'est calme. Jolie vue sur les immeubles du quartier. Le rapport qualité/prix restait tout à fait convenable pour NY. Si nous revenons à NY, nous reviendrons peut-être dans cet hôtel mais en prenant la formule du dessus!

title: Clean great value hotel in Times Square
text: I’m very clean newly modernized hotel on the southern end of Time Square. The rooms were small but certainly average by New York standards. The room was clean. The staff was friendly and attentive. Breakfast was included and was good. Certainly for the money a good value

title: Just know this before you go
text: We were in a king room. It was great. The bed was comfortable. Location is good. Know that it took us two hours to get our room after check in time. So, book the room, arrive at 3. Then leave your bags for a few hours and go walk the park or have a cocktail. After that, your room will be ready. Don’t expect it to be ready at 3. If you are good with that expectation, this place is adequate.

title: Great place to stay if your busy sightseeing and not in room much,
text: Our room was roomy. We had a nice view of the city from our 7th floor window. Check in was fine, even checked in a little early. the Elevator was a little small, but it fit us and our luggage in. Enjoyed the coffee at all hours. Clean towels daily and our bed was always made. I enjoyed our stay here even though we spent 99% of our time out in the city or Central park

title: nasty hotel - DO NOT RECOMMEND
text:
I stayed at this hotel for one night. Checked in at 12.20 AM which took 25 minutes!! the person who checked me in was less than pleasant and asked too many personal questions. She also made a copy of my driver's licence and kept it in a drawer. when i asked why? she said its their policy to make copies of driver's licence and keep them for their record. SO STRANGE!!!!!!!!!  She also charged me an additional $20 for incidentals that according to her was nonrefundable!!!  Their "resort" fee was an additional $36 for one bed room that was paid at the time of booking. But I did not know about this additional nonrefundable incidental for $20!!! 
The room I got was all the way on 14th floor right next to the elevator and staircase. Every half an hour someone would open the door to the staircase and slam it closed. So couldn't get any sleep. Bed was uncomfortable.  also the pillows were dirty with strands of hair on it. 
AT checked out, the young guy at the cashier asked how was my stay and I said horrible. His response "Oh Ok!"  
DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE!!! VERy VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE AND QUALITY.

title: Fuja para o mais longe que você puder desse hotel !!!!!
text:
Vamos listar os problemas 

1) Quarto minúsculo.
2) Armário minúsculo ( não dá para abrir as malas )
3) A porta da escada do lado de fora do quarto, abre e fecha várias vezes, fazendo muito barulho dentro quarto, não deixando as pessoas dormirem direito.
4)Não tem reposição de pão no café da manhã até o término do serviço
5) Nos demais dias, o café da manhã do hotel foi cancelado pela vigilância sanitária e o re embolso pela falta do café da manhã foi ÍNFIMO ( 6 dólares por dia / por pessoa)!!!!!! Um desprezo pelos clientes !!!!!!

title: Excelente ubicación!
text: A media cuadra del Central Park, a una del Dakota Building y a una de estación de metro. Muy buena relación calidad/precio. Es cierto, las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero ideal para pasar unos días si la idea es pasear por New York. Cama cómoda, artículos de tocador en el baño, desayuno muy completo incluído, café disponible todo el día.  Personal atento.  Hay una lavandería a una cuadra, el barrio es hermoso y en la zona hay todo tipo de locales.  Volvería sin duda!

title: Great Location, Great Price & Hot Breakfast
text: I stayed at La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wynham New York City Park back in January 20th and the stay was a very good stay. I was greeted with courtesy and respect by the staff, at the end of the check-in process I was given 2 bottles of water (complimentary). I thought that was a nice touch and a good start to my stay! I was also informed by the staff that breakfast was served the next morning (they gave me the hours). When I booked the hotel I booked it because of the location followed by the price, but I didn't know that they served breakfast so it was nice. I went up to my room and called the front desk to see if the free breakfast was worth waking up earlier, because if it was a continental breakfast it wouldn't have been worth waking up early for. I was told that the free breakfast was actually hot breakfast, so it was worth waking up early for. I would recommend anyone to stay there and experience the stay for themselves. IF you have any issues, call the staff which will be standing-by to help with whatever it is you need.

title: Good 3 star once your expectations are calibrated to its reality
text:
The pros:
Kudo to Steve, the manager, for resolving a room issue to my satisfaction
Friendly staff
Location is great
Breakfast is good
Usually reasonable rates
Cons:
Small room. Don't take more than two carryons if booking a standard room. More won't fit. The King room is much larger and worth the money.
Sloooooow elevator. One elevator for 14 floors. You need patience. Or request a low floor and use the stairs.
Breakfast room is crowded and way over heated (83 degrees).

title: New York favorite
text: Great location, helpful staff, comfortable bed. What more do you need?  We always stay at this hotel and usually greet the same staff from our previous trip. We don't eat breakfast, but it is there is you want it.

title: Not recommended at all!!
text: Upon arrival everything went well. We had made 2 bookings; 1 for 3 nights and the last booking for 1 night so we could use our Wyndham rewards. Bryce at reception said there would be no problem in staying in the same room for the whole time. Around 5pm on the last night Bryce called us up saying we had to vacate our room to another room, a little annoyed we packed up our stuff and moved. Arriving in the new room we saw it only had one bed - we were 3 adults and I certainly wasnt sharing a bed with my parents! We called Bryce at reception only to have him say he “didnt know there was 3 of us” - HE CHECKED US IN! When we asked for another room he then said “there wasnt one and he couldnt move us” as thats what the Manager told him. We asked to speak to the Manager who was “unavailable” and gone for the night. I asked Bryce where I was spose to sleep and he had the nerve to say “we can give you a roll away bed, for an extra price”. Like hell we were going to pay for another bed! We had booked a room for 2 beds, sleeping 3 adults! (We had confirmations confirming this). Again when asked where I was going to sleep Bryce said “he didnt care it wasnt his problem”. In the end he gave us the roll away bed for no extra cost which of course didnt fit in the room as the rooms are tiny (its New York so expected) so I ended us on the mattress along by the door (pictures attached). We have NEVER had such bad service!! Wyndham have always had such amazing hotels and staff who go above and beyond, their standards are so high and this did just not meet it. Honestly I wouldnt even recommend this hotel to anyone. Apart frm the location thats all it has going for it.

title: Keith is AWESOME
text: Keith was the desk clerk  he a beautiful person. I  booked my room for the wrong date but that didn't stop Keith from saving the day. The rooms are small but they will do. Management give Keith a raise.

title: NYC Stay at the Holidays
text: This hotel is old and staff are not attentive to the guests. Bed had hairs all in it like they don't even change the sheets after guests. There is only 1 elevator which is very slow. Air conditioner is very loud and walls are thin.

title: Cruise Cabin in greatest port in world
text: Just think of this hotel as your cruise cabin. Very small, tiny in fact. But at its doorstep is every thing you could want in terms of restaurants coffee museums and of course Central Park. Great location very very quiet room which I was surprised at. A great budget location with easy access to the subways and walking distance all sites within walking distance.  Remember tiny.  Teeny tiny interior cruise cabin.  Hot water.  Comfortable bed.  Very quiet.  Fabulous location.

title: Budget hotel for a great stay
text: The hotel is very well located (near the subway - 72nd st, Central Park, Museum...). Staff is great. Rooms are too small and breakfast area as well. Despite these minor details we liked the stay and we´d come back for sure.

title: $250 for incidentals, nonnegotiable.
text: Turned away at hotel with my luggage in the “completely PREPAID reservation.“ The hotel already had my money. However they wanted a credit card for $250 incidentals. When I explained that I did not have it they turned me away. Hotel room was paid for but they refused to let me in. It had been my fifth visit and they always accommodated me but their new policy for bills. They don’t even have a restaurant and I was with a toddler. The rooms are also the size of a closet. No room to even put luggage down. Horrible.

title: 最悪。”こんなホテルには泊まりたくない”を凝縮したホテル
text:
評価１ではなく０があれば０をつけたいくらい最悪。夫婦でNY旅行、4泊する予定でしたが当ホテル宿泊の予定を急遽短縮し他のホテルを探しました。これまで何度も海外旅行を経験しましたがとにかく最悪なホテルでした。

当ホテルの宿泊日より前にボストンに2泊し、その間、大きなスーツケースを預かってもらいたかったのですが「1晩で$100かかる」と。やむなく大きなスーツケースとともにボストンに行く羽目に。これは私のホテルポリシーの事前確認が不十分だったのかもしれませんが、さぁ、いざチェックインしてみるとスーツケースを広げるスペースもないほどのとにかく狭い部屋。机・椅子はおろか、冷蔵庫もなく、さらに、窓もありません（正確には窓はあるのですが開きませんし、窓の先は謎の壁。）。空調設備もいまいちで、音はうるさく、おまけに部屋もなんだか匂う。ロビー階のトイレにはゴキブリがうろうろ。朝食つきプランでしたが朝食会場は狭く、客室数に対して十分な席数は用意されておらず、席に座れなかった客が朝食会場やロビーで立ち食いをしていました。朝食メニューも貧相なもので期待すべきではありませんでした。またシャワーはお湯がでるのに時間がかかります。とにかくひどいホテルでした。1人旅、ホテルは寝るスペースだけあれば十分、という方にはよいかもしれませんが、家族での旅行には向いていないと思います。

title: Tiny, tiny rooms. Like closet size room.
text: As the title says, the rooms are very small. Location was a plus being that close to Centeal Park. All the staff I spoke with were very pleasant. Saw a few roaches, no refrigerator. Elevator can fit 3-4 people at most, and is slow. Hallways are very narrow.

title: New York, New York
text: We had so many things go wrong with this booking and stay it was remarkable. The assistant manager Keith fixed it all and made the stay worthwhile. The location is excellent with access to many venues.

title: Girls trip
text: Lovely hotel, great location right next to Central park, also round corner from subway station. Staff so nice and friendly. Breakfast lovely and tasty. Room 901 small but so cool..as so many windows and lovely views. Definitely will be back😁🇺🇸

title: Horrible Accommdations
text: Room had no heat, mold on ceiling on bathroom, the entire room needed a good cleaning and the check-in staff were not helpful. I was not allowed to take my complimentary bottle of water when I checked out because I didn't take it upon checking in - even though I was told I could. The free breakfast was inedible.

title: Truffa
text: Abbiamo prenotato una camera per due persone da 10 m quadri e ci hanno dato uno sgabuzzino. Abbiamo subito cancellato, ci hanno detto che la penale equivaleva alla nostra notte. Fatto il check out ci hanno detto che dovevamo pagare un’ulteriore penale. E avevamo la cancellazione di Booking in mano. Grazie Booking! Che nessuno mai vada in questo hotel orrendo e sporco, per non parlare del personale

title: Great Location
text: Keith was amazing right from the minute we arrived at the hotel. He was very friendly and helpful with things to see and do around town. Always welcoming when we came in the hotel.The location was perfect for what we wanted to see. Al thought the rooms were really small they had everything we needed in them to make them comfortable and were very clean. The breakfast in the morning was something we looked forward to. Overall it was a great place to stay and we were very satisfied.

title: Small
text:
One night stay - basically just needed a bed for the night prior to a cross country race the next morning.  So, at a basic level, this property met that need.  Booked a "double" which I erroneously thought was a double room, but it was just a double bed!  That's on me!  Used partial Wyndam Rewards points which brought the cost way down as well - I wouldn't recommend paying full price at this property.

It was undeniably small.  That double bed took up nearly the entire room.  Bath towels are also left on bed because the bathroom is also very tight.  

The room was clean, but some of the fixtures were worn (e.g. lamp shade full of holes).  The window A/C unit was incredibly loud as well.  It cycled on and off throughout the night. Other than that everything else was fine.  

The breakfast was average - nothing better or worse than you'd expect for a "free breakfast".  We skipped most of it and picked up something on the walk to the subway instead.  Note - subway is very accessible from this location.

title: Stayed at this location for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade.
text: The hotel rooms are a little small.  But they are clean and close to many NY attractions.  The staff did a fabulous job in taking care of the customers needs.  Including setting up breakfast early for the parade watchers.

title: Small & Dirty Room
text: First room provided was not only way too small but was dirty and musty! First 2 nights of our stay we had small cockroaches in the room!!  The small closet had peeling paint on the walls and ceilings.  We were transferred on our 3rd day to a much better room which is what saved this stay for us!

title: Great friendly location close to Central Park
text: I found this hotel on Orbitz & it turned out to be a treasure. The room is TINY yet I was hardly in it b/c I was out exploring the city. So if you're looking for a place super close to the park, try it!

title: Great value and service!
text: Hotel is well located right by the Central Park, and about 2 blocks distance from 2 subway stations. Staff is superb! Rooms are clean, bed is comfortable but hallways and bathroom are tiny(-.5), you cant even bend in the shower because the space is so cramped! Breakfast was delicious and a deal breaker when it comes to explore the city. One con is that the rooms that face the street you could hear and smell the cigarettes from people smoking at the front of the main entrance (-.5)

title: Great location
text: Stayed here many times—Always clean — despite small size and only one elevator.  Excellent safe affordable place  to sleep while out and about in nyc.  Everyone happy friendly— staff very attentive and responsive

title: Not worth it
text:
My wife and I stayed here for two nights since she has never been to NYC.  Immediately once walking in we noticed the place was way understaffed since there was a long check in/check out line and only 1 person working at the desk.  It would take us 20 minutes just to ask him a simple question.  Two people staffing the desk would’ve been far more efficent.

We were told the room wasn’t ready yet, which was fine because it was only 11 AM.  Once we got into the room it was very small despite being the “executive room.”  The bathtub can’t even fit a child let alone an adult, and it was showing some rust.  Windows were also so filthy that it was just a coat of filth on the outside of the window.

The couple of good things:
Very close to 2 subway stations
Comfortable bed

Needless to say, my wife and I were disappointed with the hotel.  And that’s coming from 2 pilots who each spend about 140 nights a year in hotel rooms

title: Viaggio in coppia
text:
Io e mio marito abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 5 notti e confermo che si tratta di una sistemazione ottima per la sua posizione ,vicinissimo al Central Park e alla metropolitana. Quartiere bello, tranquillo e con tanti ristoranti. L'Hotel offre camere piccole , essenziali ma pulite e la colazione è abbastanza ricca e varia.
Purtroppo, ci hanno dato una camera rumorosa e quando l'abbiamo fatto presente il personale non è riuscito a gestire il problema. In 5 giorni abbiamo cambiato tre camere, insomma ci aspettavamo di più.

title: Don’t pay more than $200 out the door (so like $140/night)
text:
Cons:This is a budget hotel and if you pay more for it, you will regret your choice. It is small, cheap and common areas as well as some aspects of room are well worn/funky.  (As in a 1x4 holding radiator in place). Anyway, breakfast at these places is bad unless you like yogurt or cereal which they can’t really serve stale or powdered. My room was also drafty. I asked for a blanket, got a sheet. Asked for someone to fix tv, never arrived. So negligent service. Elevator slow and tiny. Common areas not vacuumed. Like I said. A budget hotel. 

Pros: Quiet, relatively safe, near the Park.

title: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham New York City Central Park
text:
Habitaciones pequeñas, incomodas. El baño muy pequeño. Desayuno limitado con huevos duros, masa para waffles, cereal, jugo y café. 
Personal de limpieza muy amable. Personal de recepción rudo. No tiene cuarto de lavandería.

title: Overpriced and so dirty
text: Our biggest complaint is that we thought we could trust the name LaQuinta, but it was likely our most disappointing experience in a hotel EVER!! Mainly, due to the filth. The hallway looked as though it was never vacuumed, and our room was so poorly cleaned. Used dental floss on the bathroom floor, dirty carpets, filthy sink with previous person's usage. And their had been a mess in the lobby bathroom that took 2 days to be resolved and smelled up the entire lobby. We felt so cheated because of the money spent.

title: Moyen sauvé par l’emplacement
text:
Hôtel situé dans le Queens tout proche de 2 stations Métro, côté bon et positive.
Les chambres sont assez pleins de tapis que donc accumulent poussière si les femmes de ménage ne nettoient pas comm il faut et comme je l’ai constaté. 
Petit-déjeuner très très simple, mais bon, au moins ça aide. 
Par le prix n’était pas mal de tout cet hôtel...

title: Vacanza in coppia
text:
Prezzo oltre 300$ a notte.
Ottima posizione nell'Up West Side, di fianco a Central Park.
Discreta colazione con dolce e salato.
Personale gentile e piuttosto disponibile.
Camera, pur avendo scelto una Queen risulta piccola, con un bagno fornito unicamente dell'essenziale ( lavandino microscopico ).
Conclusione: si paga soprattutto la location comoda per visitare tutta Manhattan mediante le 2 linee (C e 1).

title: Bed bugs in our room
text:
My daughter got bitten by one and found several in the room, THAT IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE 
ROOM 508 and 1408 she couldn’t sleep. I understand they’re all buildings but bugs is humiliating for visitors 
The toilet was nasty... rooms super small and tiny I could barely walk in between 
We’ll Never ever stay there again....
My poor daughter I hope she is ok after those bites I cant upload the picture we took of the bugs

title: "I'm an englishman (& woman) in New York" as Sting would sing...
text:
Everything in USA is normally larger versions / portions than we see or get in UK….however not the case with the hotel bedroom sizes it appears…in La Quinta Suites anyway. Cheapest room at £271.00pn I could find 6 months prior to trip….exchange rate doesn’t help us brits visiting USA at the moment…but we didn’t plan to be in room much which is just as well. Location of hotel was brilliant for us, it’s a 2 min walk to Central Park (Dakota Building entrance) & subway. It’s really quiet compared to say staying in Times Square where it’s 24/7 sirens.
 
Staff were all great, friendly and helpful. Room and tiny bathroom was clean. Breakfast was good, varied offerings, cereal, fruit, pancakes, muffins, breads….brilliant. Rooms have a safe, TV and hairdryer, noisy air condition unit, good free WiFi.  Really efficient check in and our room was ready when we arrived…bonus. Excellent little hotel but not value for money.  

Negatives:
-	Only 1 small elevator so ask for a low floor room if you don’t do stairs - sometimes we waited ages for the elevator especially in mornings when cleaners using it too and people checking out.   
-	If you aren’t as agile, ensure you check bed configuration – our bed (Room 606 I think) was in corner against wall, so I had to either climb over my partner or sit up and move forward to end of bed to get out. Our bedroom was probably about 12ft x 7ft and bathroom was about 5ft x 4ft….I think bigger rooms were available…but check.

title: Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location
text: This is a great hotel and much less expensive then hotels near Times Square.  Yet you can be right downtown with an easy 10 minute subway ride...and the station is within half a block.  Great neighborhood.  Great restaurants nearby.  Hotel block is adjacent to the most beautiful section of Central Park.  We had a king sized bed.  Free breakfasts were very good.  Wifi was fine.  TV worked great.  Highly recommend this hotel.  It'll be our number one choice on any future trips to New York

title: A delightful hotel in a wonderful area with incredibly nice service.
text: The breakfast is better than most continental breakfast, the rooms are clean but a little small, but that is New York. The people are super friendly. It is within walking distance of a lot of activity and close to the subway. Would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Klein, teuer aber  fantastische Umgebung. Central Park West.
text: Eines der wenigen Hochhäuser in einer alten gepflegten Wohngegend. Auf der einen Seite der Central Park, gegengesetzter Richtung ein urbanes Leben in all seinen Facetten, wie Restaurants, Geschäfte, Super Markt ect. Sehr gute U-Bahn (Metro)  Verbindung in direkter Umgebung. Freundliches Personal, saubere Zimmer. Negativ: Nur ein Fahtrstuhl für ca 80 Zimmer verteilt auf 12 Etagen und Nutzung auch durch das Personal.

title: Short Trip, Too Expensive, Nice Location, Nice Staff, Seriously a 2.5 Star Hotel
text: Small rooms, Too high of a price, Nice area, Nice staff, No early check-in, Great walking area, Wonderful restaurants near and about a 30 min walk to Times Square. 7 min walk to Central Park. I just thought that the place is too expensive for what it offers. Don't know if I would stay there again.

title: Not a bad hotel
