text: The hotel is nice quiet area we were disappointed with bow small our room was our first night we had a outside air conditioner coming on and off every for minutes we were moved to another room higher up the price of the stay vary each day we were charge from 170 to 270 for staying. The are polite and helpful very near central park if you like a long walk in the park this is a good place to stay the train station is just around the corner getting to times square it about ten minutes ride the subway is very haard to understand no air condition on the platform

title: hôtel très correcte !
text:
hôtel très bien situé, calme si on compare à l'effervescente de NY, 50 à 80 métrés de central park, proche de 2 stations de métro (l'hôtel se trouve au milieu des deux stations, toutes les deux nommées 72 street) qui offrent un maximum de ligne de métro pour rayonner dans NY, le manager très sympa, personnel de l’hôtel (accueil et ménage) très bien, bonne literie, 2 petites bouteilles d'eau étaient offertes par jour et par chambre (pratique l'été à NY), lors de la prise de la chambre à l'arrivée des frais de séjour, n'ont prévu et n'ont indiqué dans la réservation que j'ai payés sur place, m'ont été remboursés lors de notre départ après échange avec le manager sans aucune difficulté, service client au top !
en revanche, chambre et salle de bains petites (voir photos), clim bruyante et on la laissait la journée et on l’éteignait à notre retour dans la chambre, la salle du petit déjeuner petite et parfois il fallait attendre pour pouvoir être assis et un seul ascenseur pour tout l’hôtel. Nous avons été satisfait de cet hôtel et du personnel.

title: Very pleasant stay
text: Clean bedroom and bathroom, a bit small but Everything we needed was there. The hotel is located perfect between Central Park and Subway stations. We had a very good breakfast every day. We started early so we had no trouble finding a place to sit. It was nice to get a coffee or tea in the evening. The staff was always very helpfull.

title: Nice location. Small room
text:
The location is amazing. The room is so small there was almost impossible for three people to stay there. The breakfast was simple and there was no much options: coffee, waffles and some breads. 
I definitely don’t recommend.

title: Close to Central Park and subway station
text:
I've got no complaints. I'd go back for short stay. Room and bathroom was clean. It was a budget room, so it was very small. Enough for a couple of days. 

It was a weekend stay and it was quite. The street isn't noisy either.

I checked-in at night and the reception was all right. No pool, it's a small hotel and I haven't heard any children.

Lifts were fine. Breakfast is just OK in a small room, so it gets crowded quickly. 

Can't say much for housekeeping and I didn't use the AC.

It's very close to subway station and Central Park.

title: Smelly, dirty, gross
text: My room smelled like urine and was told that it was due to an ac unit filter. Unfortunately it was a holiday weekend, I got in to hotel very late at night and I was in town to help daughter move so I zero time to check into a different hotel. The housekeeping staff sprayed some sort of cleaner into the unit which made it smell like cheap lavender cleanser and urine. Even the suitcase rack was dirty. Absolutely the worst place I can remember staying.

title: Only location is perfect
text: This hotel is the best in terms of location. Rooms are not sparkling clean. AC attached to the window is very noisy. Room is small and AC right next to your side is affecting the sleep in a bad way. We stayed 2 days. Second day we didn't run the AC to fall into the sleep. Breakfast was okay but it could be better. Menu is very poor.

title: Descansar y seguir conociendo
text: El hotel está bien situado, en una zona residencial con buenas comunicaciones. Los desayunos están bien, aunque se repiten. Ofrecen café durante todo el día. El personal muy amable y dispuesto siempre. Las habitaciones varían de tamaño, algunas bastantes pequeñas, pero camas grandes y cómodas para descansar y seguir conociendo la ciudad.

title: Turismo
text: He viajado con mi esposa y ha pesar de algunas opiniones decidimos alojarnos en este hotel y la experiencia ha sido muy positiva,la habitación es de un tamaño muy normal,el desayuno está muy bién y el personal de recepción es de lo más amable,tanto como el servicio,nó hay nigún problema para expresarte en Español,yá que casi todos lo hablan y si no, te buscan a uno que lo hable,hay café caliente a todas horas y puedes comprar comida en la calle e irte al hotel,pudiendo usar el microondas a todas horas,está muy cerca de dos estaciones de metro y a media hora andando de Columbus Circle,en resumen que estuve muy contento durante toda mi estancia y lo recomiendo y si voy otra vez no tengo ninguna duda de volver a repetir.Gracias a todo el personal sin excepciones.

title: Efficiency hotel but clean and comfortable
text: This is a small hotel on a fairly quiet street with small rooms but clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated. and everything worked. The few amenities, including the breakfast, are very good.  It is convenient for going to midtown and uptown Manhattan and there are restaurants and drugstores within walking distance. The Pasha restaurant (Turkish) down the street was fantastic!

title: Hôtel bien situé mais chambre petite pour trois personnes
text:
Cet hôtel est idéalement situé dans le Upper West Side, à 100 mètres de Central Park.
Le vrai bémol se situe au niveau de la taille des chambres qui sont vraiment petites et, dans notre cas, peu adaptées pour trois personnes.
Pour tout dire, nous avons été un peu déçus relativement à ce que nous avions pu lire auparavant à propos de cet hôtel.

title: Nice place to stay.
text: Nice staff. Clean. Great breakfast. Reasonable price. The room was a little small. But it was nice with good cable and internet, and fine for me. The neighborhood was a block away from a nice part of Central Park West (near Strawberry Fields.) A few blocks to the West was great shopping, and lots of restaurants. Very good public transportation available.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Yes, the rooms are VERY small but you are in the city to tour not to hang out in your room.  The room was cozy and bed comfortable.  Great water pressure in the shower which is a plus.  Be prepared to wait for the elevator.  All that said, if you are looking for a location in the heart of the city, only steps away from Central Park then this is your place to stay.

title: Summer Visit
text: The location is excellent.  You are near great transportation, Central Park (strawberry fields) great shopping and iconic NYC locations.  The front desk clerk who checked us in was fantastic.  So nice and polite.  I just wish I had not taken forever to compose the review and could remember his name.  The supervisor (Keith) also phenomenal.  The room was super super small.  Everyone tries to say its NYC but I have stayed at other locations and never had a room so small.  My family wasn't bothered because we were not in room much but I found it difficult to get ready with no place to iron and what I felt like barely able to move.  If I decided to stay at location again it would probably be only due the staff.  Some of the best in the business.  When you are made to feel welcome you can overlook some critiques based on the excellent customer service.  I hope whomever supervises the staff realizes what gems they have.

title: For the location
text: The location was good, other than this the property is relatively old having only one elevator, according to info from other guest the bedrooms are decent at higher floors, the ones below fifth floor was too small, we had a city view room at 8th floor and it was quiet ok, bathroom was very big. But the remote controlled curtains were not working, wifi connecton was poor in the bedroom. Overall the place can be preferred because it’s so close to central park and other central locatons

title: Best kept secret upper west side
text:
We visit upper west side to visit family once a quarter. We have found this hidden gem which is cosy, clean, close to Central Park West.. 71st and Central Park West. 
Great location, clean, very friendly and attentive staff.

title: Small rooms, but they work.
text:
Great location by central park and right next to a citi bike rental rack. We got their small room. Too small for 3 people, but we made it work passing it off as "The newyork experiance"
As for the breakfast, it was good, but I would of loved it if they had some meat in there.

title: Comfortable and adequate hotel.
text:
The hotels location is excellent. Indeed being half a block from B train and Central Park and a block and a half from 7Ave and 123 train. 
NY was very hot at the time of my visit, so Aircon working in rooms - however this was noisy and clicky all night. Couldn't open the window blinds as there didn't seem to be a chain to do so. When rolled up by hand the views were excellent! 
Breakfast as expected.
My only gripe is the lack of environmental consideration, disposable plastic cutlery, plates etc. This in itself was a big downside. Although this does still seem the norm in the US, such a shame as this hotel could lead on green credentials.  In the same way there was no need to replace my towels daily! Why not use china and metal cutlery - washable and in the long run more financially viable! 
Room adequate, half bath in a large bathroom.
Would certainly stay here again.

title: It is the worst hotel i ever seen before
text: the wi-fi doesnt WORK the wi-fi is poor is doesnt connects it they told me that the room esa of two beds instead they gave us just one they don’t have a food place they just sell lays potatoes and that. Also the rooms are too small and the tv doesnt work well and it is  too old.The eleveitor is to old and too slow the sensor doesnt work too god. In conclusion this hotel was a bad spend of money it even has the primary things. In my opinion it was the worst hotel i ever seen before.

title: Local Excelente
text:
Hotel muito bom!
Próximo ao Central Park, próximo as estações de metro 72 (Azul e Vermelha), as quais você pode ir a Times Square ou a Downtown sem problemas!
Café da manhã completo!
Staff sensacional, sempre pronto para ajudar da melhor maneira possível. Destaque para o Keith da recepção, um excelente profissional!

title: Great service during power outage.
text:
Staff was great during trying circumstances created by the west side power outage. One staffer walked to the seventh floor to help us get in the room when I jammed the lock by putting the card in multiple times wrong. 
We have stayed there several times and staff has always been professional and friendly. The location is also fantastic, half a block from Central Park and within walking distance of dozens of stores and restaurants. We will be back again.

title: NYC Visit
text: Very nice hotel, staff was friendly and attentive, logistics to subway and Central Park and other features was great.  The room was very small.  But it's New York City -- it was a great price for a room adjacent to Central Park.

title: My favorite spot to stay in NYC
text: I have stayed a lot of places in the city.  This hotel certainly isn't the fanciest but certainly does the job.  I love that it is close to central park and far enough away from the busyness of Time Square.  I walk everywhere when I visit, this is the perfect spot.  I would recommend this hotel to someone for all visits.  It doesn't have room service, but I can have my food delivered directly to my room without the high cost of room service.  Some of the rooms are small, but it is the city and how much time are you spending in your room???  I stayed for 2 weeks in a double room, which I'm pretty sure is there smallest and it worked out fine.  If you need more space opt for the King, there is a desk in that one.

title: Conference tag along long weekend
text: I tagged along on a trip from Illinois to NYC with my spouse for a conference she had at Columbia.  I wanted to have lots of close options of things to do but also be close enough to Columbia for her.  This hotel met that need as I was able to walk to the NY Historical Society, Central Park, and the Natural History Museum and it was close to the subway.  This however is the SMALLEST hotel room we have ever stayed in.  We laughed when we opened the door but were prepared since the price was so reasonable and the location is so good.  Besides it being so small and smelling musty I thought it was fine.  It was clean and contemporary.  I’m amazed at how efficiently they utilize space in these tiny rooms.  I must say it was remarkably quiet and the staff was nice.  The neighborhood was great and felt safe.  I would go back but I’m glad we only had carry one because I have no idea how you would move around in the room with full size luggage.

title: Room
text:
Small rooms meet better ventilation— stuffy room  better I hope for next stay 
Please advise thanks
Look forward to better air quality 
Room was very small 
Breakfast was fine - with coffee brewing fir breakfast - nice treat.

title: New York trip June 2019
text:
Lovely simple hotel that caters for what you need. Nothing fancy here but staff always friendly and helpful.
Great location away from the busy times square area and just couple mins walk into central park. Breakfast is a simple self service with a few hot items along with generally continental style. Free coffee available 24hrs a day and a free bottle of water each day on your way out for the day which is a nice touch. If your not looking for a fancy hotel but nice clean friendly and simple in a good location then this ticks all the boxes

title: Great place
text:
So let me start by saying that I nearly cancelled my booking after reading all the bad reviews. Am really glad I didn’t ! The room was great ! For what we paid it was perfect - it wasn’t five star but I didn’t pay 5 star prices ! It was clean and tidy. The bedding was clean and the furnishings were in good state !  The maid did a great job on the room every day ! The staff were helpful and answered  all our questions! It was so conveniently place , four blocks to the subway and then 20 mins to time square to there . The breakfast was ok ! It was food and filled us up for the start of a busy day in New York! My only complaint .... and it really is a small one .... the breakfast guy needs to smile more! He looked like he hated his job !!

All I will say is I don’t know what the moaners were expecting it was a great place for the price !! If you want  5 star treatment pay 5 star Prices - this was a great place to stay !!

title: Worst hotel ever. Filthy
text: The location was the only good thing. The lobby reeked of smoke, and it was complete chaos. Bags everywhere (that I assume guest thought were being “stored”. We stayed half an hour and left. Promptly booked another hotel. I’ll probably eat $800 for the 3 days, and I don’t even care. My wife refused to lie on the bed. Room looked like it hadn’t been vacuumed ever, dead roaches in elevator. Completely disgusting. Wyndham should be embarrassed to own it, and hotels.con should be ashamed to list it, with the “glamour shots” that make this mess seem inhabitable. The location is the only thing not misrepresented.

title: First visit to New York
text: front desk clerk was amazing .. breakfast left you unsatisfied, hot food was cold and pastries were stale.  check in isn't till 3 please don't arrive early (front desk was able to keep my bags) .. with all that said because of front desk clerk i would stay again

title: In the middle of everything
text: This hotel was great.  I was in NYC for a Teacher's institute at Columbia U.   The hotel was in a more residential part, but still close to everything that we wanted to do.  Keith was amazing and so helpful.

title: Excellent hotel! Perfect location!
text: This is a very nice, clean, updated hotel only 2 blocks from Central Park. It is on a nice quiet street. The front desk staff was welcoming and very helpful. Breakfast daily was always great. We plan on staying here every visit to NYC.

title: Small, Small, Small
text:
Very small even by NYC standards. Could barely walk around bed. No chair or desk, too small. Two of us had to coordinate if either one wanted to move. Bathroom so small when sitting on toilet I hit into the sink and I'm only 5' tall. No place to put most toiletries in the bathroom. Dresser drawers kept sliding open into what little space there was between the bed and the dresser. Smelled musty and the air conditioning cycled LOUDLY all night. Like staying in a dark, low ceilinged closet.

Staff was nice; bed comfortable; breakfast okay, location was GREAT, but not sure I'd recommend it.

title: Great location, helpful staff
text: Very convenient Upper West Side location, across Central park, subway stop just around the corner. Many local restaurants and shops. The rooms are small, breakfast is basic, but overall it was pleasant stay.

title: Keith is the best!
text: Keith, the front desk person was the best! As soon as I walked in the door he greeted me with a hello and a big smile. The whole time we spoke we was so caring and helpful. I’ve never had better customer service in my life. No joke! This guy made me week!

title: Lovely time in New York
text:
A nice simple hotel on the upper west in a very calm neighbourhood. It was nice to come home to this quiet area after spending the day downtown.
The rooms are very small but this was expected but it worked. Very kind people working in the hotel, especially Keith who is a fantastic person who help You with a big smile.
Rooms are pretty clean and the breakjas which were included held better quality than expected.

If You are looking for a simple hotel in a calm area close to central park (one block), this is for You.

title: Denunciable. Sinverguenzas malas personas.
text:
La experiencia que tuvimos con este hotel fue tan horrible que dudo que este escrito muestre todo lo que pasamos. Viajábamos un grupo de amigos en  marzo, uno de ellos discapacitado en silla de ruedas. Este hotel aparace en booking como hotel adaptado. Llegamos de noche, realizamos el check in y cuando  subimos a las habitaciones eran horriblemente pequeñas, pero lo peor es que la habitación supuestamente adaptada para mi amigo no lo era. No cabía por la puerta para acceder al baño. Bajamos a recepción y nos dicen que le cambiarán al día siguiente a una habitación más amplia. Cómo???????? Y qué pretenden, qué estuviera toda la noche sin acudir al baño. Pero lo más increíble es que apareció una tal María, latina, que supuestamente se iba a comunicar mejor con nosotros y nos iba a facilitar algo el asunto y fue intolerable la actitud de esta señorita, Maleducada, intransigente y encima nada empática se enfadó con nosotros con la situación que estábamos viviendo. Llamamos a Booking que en seguida nos buscó otro alojamiento muchísimo mejor en la Quinta Avenida. Y esta tal María, puso "no show" para que no pudiéramos poner ninguna crítica en bóoking. Pero su actitud fue tan despeciable que le pedimos que nos llamara un taxi y se negó, que nos tuvo esperando con aire acondicionado en marzo y se negó a quitarlo cuando le dijimos que estábamos helados y lo más increíble pretendía echarnos fuera de noche porque quería cerrar las puertas a las doce de la noche.
Ha sido la peor experiencia que he tenido en mi vida. Nunca había vivido algo así.
Espero que nadie acuda a este sitio de malas personas.

title: Buena ubicacion
text: Habitaciones muy pequeñas el armario solo tenia una puerta y esa puerta era de tamaño la mitad de un armario normal . No cabe nada en el armario. Solo había un ascensor donde ese era también el uso del personal de hotel . La sala para el desayunar era demasiado pequeña teníamos q esperar a q otros terminaran para desayunar. Y según el turno se recepción te podían ayudar a un problema o no porque todos no hablaban español

title: Perfect for solo travel
text: Apparently this is a 2 star hotel but I found it 5 stars in alot of ways. The rooms are small yes but they make the most of it. Comfy bed. Big screen tv. Clean bathroom. Chocolates left on pillows each morning. Housekeeping was on point. Very clean hotel, clean sheets, clean everything. Great staff. My tv wasn't working, they sent someone up straight away to fix it. Free breakfast and amazing location. You get 2 free water bottles every day as well! I loved my stay here. Nothing bad to report! Wish I stayed longer!

title: Generally get what you pay for
text:
It's a budget hotel in Manhattan, so I don't expect much.

But
-WIFI signal was so weak in the room that it was useless
-I found an ant in the bathroom and tiny red insect in the bed

Great location though.  And generally quiet

title: vacanza come da recensioni
text: siamo stati ospiti dal 4 al 15 aprile, abbiamo riscontrato i problemi e i pregi delle precedenti recensioni, mi permetto di aggiungere un fatto molto sgradevole,al nostro arrivo ci siamo trovati sul conto circa 200 dollari in più del contratto fatto con Booking ovviamente la cosa ci ha molto infastidito perchè la scusa è stata tasse varie ...una volta a casa abbiamo contattato Booking e loro dopo aver presentato il contratto e quello che invece effettivamente ci hanno fatto pagare ha provveduto e contattare l'Hotel che nel giro di pochi giorni ci ha restituito i soldi,GRAZIE DI CUORE ALLA PROFESSIONALITA' di Booking

title: Nice Neighborhood, yucku building
text: Most people are coming to NYC to explore the city and not spend much time in their hotel rooms, thank god because this room is a shoe box and the building itself is extremely old and kinda gross. However, it's in a fabulous neighborhood and close to Columbus Circle and other restaurants etc. It's OK and I am leaving it at that!

title: Room for Improvement
text: Stayed one night to participate in Carry The Load Relay Walk. Room very tiny.Made for small people especially the bathroom. The staff at the reception desk were the highlight- very helpful and accommodating. Not service dog friendly. Was told we could not enter the dining room for breakfast because we had a dog. When we said he was a service dog, the answer was the same. This is the 2nd consecutive La Quinta (in Elmsford) who have this policy. Very disappointing.

title: Pleasant stay
text: The place was good for us because of its proximity to Lincoln Center which is about 6 blocks away. We could walk there and avoid taking a taxi or subway.  The rooms are NYC sized but adequate.  It's close to Central Park and a Subway stop.  The AC is noisy and was turned off so we could sleep.  Probably not possible in the summer.  There is only one elevator so many people were taking the stairs.  Breakfast food was adequate but the waffle maker wasn't working.  The breakfast lady Erica was really great--super helpful and friendly.    We met Keith, who is mentioned in many reviews and he was very helpful.  I would stay there again.

title: Bien, mais moins bien que la description.
text:
Nous y sommes allés à 2, en novembre 2018.

3e visite de NY pour moi, première dans cet hôtel.

Les + : 
- Hotel très bien situé !! Se trouve à côté de central park, jolie rue, à proximité de 2 sortes de métro (toujours super pour retourner à l’hotel directement et au + vite)
- Personnel de la réception aimable, dames d’entretiens super. 
- La propreté y est meme si elle n’est pas parfaite (je dirai 6/10) 
- Lit très très très confortable, et je pense que c’est ce qui est le plus important... (10/10!!!)
- Bagagerie surveillée et vérifiée à l’aide de ticket 

Les - :
- chambre très, très, très, très petite... Vraiment différente des photos proposées (impossible de poser une valise au sol pour l’ouvrir, obligé de la mettre sur le lit et la refermer pour essayer de gagner de la place...)
- sale de bain minuscule, il est en effet probablement possible d’être aux toilettes, de se laver les dents à l’évier, et de se laver les pieds dans la douche en même temps... 😂
- Un seul et petit ascenseur pour, si je me souviens bien, 12 étages... Ascenseur que nous partageons avec les dames d’entretient...  Beaucoup d’attente...
- comme beaucoup d’endroit à NY, simple vitrage = bruyant et froid, donc chauffage à fond et boules dans les oreilles... 

Déçue les premières heures de la taille de la chambre, mais tellement bien situé et tellement la literie était confortable, j’y retournerai bien si les prix sont intéressants!

title: Reunion
text: Thanks to the staff at LaQuinta at the upper west location. They were extremely helpful and friendly. The location is gorgeous...Central Park is a 2 minute walk! I would definitely recommend.  The best time ever in the Big Apple!

title: Sehr Klein
text:
Das Hotel  liegt sehr nahe dem Cental Park!!!! der wirklich toll ist.
Die Zimmer im Hotel sind wirklich sehr winzig, aber das Bett ist sehr gut und es ist auch sehr sauber dort.
Das Frühstück ist völlig ok allerdings der Frühstücksraum ist schon sehr winzig für die vielen Zimmern viel zu klein.
Das Personal ist sehr bemüht und freundlich und eine U Bahn befindet sich in unmittelbarer Nähe. Aber das Preisleistungsverhätniss ist durchaus ok, wen man bedenkt das New York eine der teuersten Städte ist.Für Gäste mit wenig Gebäck und solche die das Zimmer nur zum schlafen nutzen völlig Ok

title: Don’t ever stay in 1205 or 905
text: All the floors have the same rooms and the rooms that end in 05 are by the stairway and are so small they should be utility closets. The closet is so small the hangers poke holes in the door. The bathroom is so small you can reach the handle to turn on the shower from the toilet.

title: microscopic, inadequate hotel in good location
text: Location is the best part of this hotel--neighborhood is quiet and close to Metro.  Rooms and elevator are too small. Breakfast  foods available are inadequate for number of guests as is dining space.  Front desk staff could be more polite, welcoming and friendly. Water and other items in cooler should be replenished more frequently. Even the coffee cups were small!

title: Adequate lodging in great location
text: Clean but very small hotel located in walking distance to Central Park and museums. Staff we're helpful and accommodating. Breakfast was blah and the breakfast was cramped and inadequate. Lovely neighborhood but again tight quarters all the way around.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: This was perfect for my overnight stay in NYC. Located on the Upper West Side near Strawberry Fields in Central Park, the location was exactly where I needed it to be and in the price range I needed it to be at. Hotel was clean, staff was super nice and friendly. The gentleman at the front desk tried to accommodate the early check-ins. If not they are more than willing to take your luggage while you wait for your room. My room itself was small of course (this is NYC after all) but it was clean. The elevator might be an issue as there is just one, and I waited for over 5 minutes trying to come down with my suit case to check out, but I had time. I was a little disappointed in the breakfast. I went down on a Friday at 915am to get me something small and there was absolutely nothing left but coffee. When asked if they would be refilling, all I received was no from the woman that was working in the kitchen area. I ended up walking to Starbucks a few blocks up. Over all I was pleasantly surprised with my stay. The reviews weren't that great when I read them prior to me booking this, but this was totally worth the price. Maybe I just got lucky and had a great room, IDK. I left happy!

title: NYC Vacation
text: Excellent location only blocks away from Central Park ! Small , clean hotel in a neighborhood setting close to quaint restaurants and bars ! This hotels BIGGEST perk is Keith at the front desk. Keith always went above and behind to answer our questions and always greeted us with a smile ! Keith is definitely a valuable asset to this hotel! Hold on to him Wyndham !!

title: A hidden gem!
text: Close enough to the Broadway shows et al but far enough to enjoy a quiet neighborhood. A 5 minute walk to Central Park and the Tavern on the Green.  True the rooms are compact but they are clean and management seems to have worked hard to best meet the travelers needs.  The staff are all great but Keith at the front desk was particularly helpful and great to deal with.  Breakfast was nicely done. Would definitely stay there again!

title: Wyndham takeover is a nightmare
text: The rooms are small but the hotel is nice and in a great location. However, promises made when the reservation was made, through La Quinta, were not kept by Wyndham. The staff did not seem well trained on the new rules or reservation system.

title: Comfortable Stay
text:
I and my husband had an amazing stay at this hotel. 
As per few reviews the rooms are small, true, but trust me it has just the right amount of space. There is space to keep your luggage(2 medium sized bags) and enough drawers for all your belongings. 
The bathrooms are clean and well maintained.
Breakfast had a variety of options including cereals, fruits, waffles, muffins, donuts, coffee and juice.
Staff is very friendly and check in and check out was a breeze.
The USP of this place is the location; it is closer to sight seeing places as well as many options for food starting from street style to bakery and fine dine restaurants.
This place is perfect for a short stay!

title: Vision Expo 2019
text: The selection of this location was in part to membership with Returns as currently Elite as been staying at La quintas since the 1980's .this location was terrific example of La Quinta with no surprises

title: Plutôt bien
text:
Nous y sommes resté 4 nuits: 

Les + : hôtel très bien situé dans un beau quartier, central Park à côté, bouche de métro à côté également. Le lit est bon, et le personnel adorable! Chambre toujours très propre!

Les - : chambre petite, la première nuit était horrible car le chauffage à fond et la climatisation à fond et ça faisait un bruit d’enfer! On a réussi le lendemain à trouver comment éteindre le chauffage et comment éteindre la clim, nous avons ensuite passer de bonnes nuits! La salle de bain est minuscule, et le problème c’est les places au petit déjeuné, la salle est minuscule donc il faut attendre que les autres finissent de manger...

Conclusion: nous sommes vraiment content de notre séjour malgré quelques petites imperfections qui sont légère, on était content après beaucoup de marche de retrouver un bon lit et une bonne douche (avec toujours de l’eau chaude!) je recommande :)

title: Location, Excellent
text:
Having used this hotel group when we were in Chicago it was easy to choose this one in NYC
Walking distance to Central Park and the subway, what more could you ask for.
Jackie was the first person we met in reception and I have to say her warm friendly welcoming was much appreciated after the long train trip. She was more than helpful with regards to all our questions re transport, restraunts etc as were the other staff we came in contact with.
Though extremely small the room was very clean and the bed comfortable. Bathroom exceptionally clean. Fresh linen daily
All in all a peaceful, restful place to stay

title: Grata experiencia
text:
Cuando reservamos nuestra estadia en Las Quintas & Suites Central Park, sabiamos que eran habitaciones pequeñas, sin embargo jamas pensamos que fueran tan pequeñas, fue una sorpresa, sin embargo debo de decir que el lugar es muy limpio, las camas muy comodas y el staff de limpieza y de la recepción muy amable, igualmente la gente que atiende en el desayinador es amable y dispuestos a servirte.
El desayuno es básico pero suficiente: frutas, cereal, jugos, huevos y buen café. Ahora lo extraordinario de este lugar sin duda alguna es la ubicación , se encuentra a 5 minutos caminando del central park en su puerta de acceso principal( donde se encuentra el memorial a John Lennon) donde lo puede escuchar música. Los museos son cercanos el Net se encuentra a 15min caminando a través de central park y el americano natural igual de cerca. Entre otros museos. Time square se encuentra a 40min Caminando, podrías tomar un taxi y hacer 10 min dependiendo del tráfico, particularmente recomiendo caminar ? El recorrido a pie es muy interesante pasando por Broadway y otros sitios de interés. 
Muy cerca del hotel hay muchos restaurantes de distintos estilos precios etc.
La Quinta & Suites se encuentra junto al edificio Marquiz y muy cerca del Dakota.
Recomiendo bajar a desayunar antes de las 8am ya que entre 8.30 y 10am el elevador que es solo uno se encuentra saturado y podrías tardar más esperandolo que cruzando a central park.
Traten de solicitar habitaciones con vista a la 71st estas habitaclones tiene cama Queen size y son algunos cm más grandes que el promedio.
En general recomiendo este hotel por todas las ventajas que su ubicación y servicio.

title: Stay away-ROACHES, dirty rooms, well-worn, beat-up  furniture
text: beat up furniture and paint. Old, lumpy. mattresses and pillows. Any complaints are ignored and no action taken. Management does not care and refuses to do anything about this dump! Prices are crazy for this one star, at best, DUMP!!

title: Location, location, location!
text: You simply cannot beat this location: right next to Central Park and within minutes of the subway. The rooms are a bit small and use window units, but we expected this in NYC. We were able to secure a refrigerator in the room for $10 extra a day. Each person at the front desk was so helpful and friendly. And the breakfast was a bonus. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Ideal!
text: Stayed here mid February this year and I cannot believe how perfect it was! Extremely close to Central Park and a subway station, in a nice area and the staff were lovely. The rooms were small but it wasn’t an issue, the beds were extremely comfortable and the shower was powerful! Cleaners came daily and changed bedding and towels and the breakfast was great! Staff were very friendly and couldn’t help you enough! I asked to put some medication in a fridge and they brought one to my room within 10 minutes! Fully recommend and wouldn’t bother staying anywhere else if I return! Thanks!

title: Uma farsa!
text:
Mais uma vez a Booking.com me enganou.
Nunca mais faço reserva por este canal.
O hotel é sujo cama suja buraco na porta e os quartos são bem pequenos e não são como os da foto.
Horrível e a booking sempre enrola e nunca devolve o seu dinheiro.

title: Close to metro, comfortable beds, but very basic and crowded breakfast area!
text: The location was good if you want to be close to a metro and quite central. The hotel was easy to find in a nice and calm area. Yes, the rooms are very small  but for us it was ok. We had a king size bedroom and that was very nice. Not much extra space, but sufficient for two people. Breakfast was included, but could need an upgrade both in terms of food and space.

title: A curate’s egg, Keith is our hero!
text:
We stayed at La Quinta in early February. On our first night we were allocated a small room on the 2nd floor. It was not great but we were determined to make the most of it. 
Next morning I made a couple of requests at the front desk, from Keith.
Keith asked if we would like relocated and he arranged for us to be given a corner room on the 14th Floor, best room in the hotel, in my opinion, we could lie in bed and see Central Park.
We loved the location of the hotel, in a street of brownstone houses. Breakfast was ok if rather crowded, but hey you’re in New York, go out for breakfast and discover the many bakeries and diners within walking distance.
Following our move to a better room, we had a super time. The street is remarkably quiet at night and transport links are terrific. 
Thanks again Keith you transformed our holiday, a great credit to the business.

title: Buena opción.
text:
Destacamos de este hotel su ubicación, limpieza, cama cómoda, ducha caliente, buen calentador en la habitación, desayuno generoso, buen café, todos los días arreglan y limpian la habitación, hay recepción 24 horas, no se permite fumar dentro del hotel. 
Para tener en cuenta: Son pequeñas las habitaciones (al menos en la que nos han asignado), el salón del desayuno es pequeño (pero HAY DESAYUNO INCLUIDO!!!), hay un solo elevador para los 14 pisos de habitaciones q tiene. 
En general, por relación calidad precio, lo recomendamos.

title: Excellent price performance ratio
text: We stayed for one week in February and were delighted with the accommodation and service at this budget hotel. The rooms are not big,  as is common for most hotels in New York but they are very well appointed clean and comfortable. The price included breakfast and desks staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Above all, the location is fantastic,  next to Central Park and within walking distance of the bustling  upper west side. I would recommend this with confidence if you looking for basic comfort at a very good price

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Hôtel très bien situé pour nous, trés proche de Central Park, des lignes de métro qui déservent très bien les lieux les plus fréquentés, des restaurants/épiceries ouverts jusque tard voir 24h/24h. 
Le quartier est sûr et agréable. Le personnel de l'hôtel est très agréable et sympathique. Le petit déjeuner proposé est très correct et bon, la salle est TRES mais arrivé tôt permet d'éviter les inconvénients. 
La chambres est EXTREMEMENT PETITE, mais nous partons tôt le matin et on rentre tard le soir juste pour dormir (literie correct). La salle de bain/wc et minuscule. La chambre est faite tous les jours et les serviettes sont changés.
Néanmoins si vous êtes la pour une bonne douche et bien dormir le soir alors cet hôtel est fait pour vous.
Je recommande.

title: Great location, good breakfast, good value. Room was tiny, lots of hallway noise, room had a temperature control issue
text: Cannot beat the value for the location. Walkable to everything and near a subway stop. Great overall experience but did have trouble with temperature control in room and hallway noise. Very small. Would recommend and stay there again.

title: Pros and cons
text:
Visited here last week.  

Pros - great location, easy to walk to everything (if you like  walking!) alternatively there is a subway station a block away.
Staff were very friendly and always had a smile.
Room cleaned daily and had a safe and a coffee machine which was replenished daily. Hairdryer and iron were also in the room along with toiletries.
Breakfast included and tbh it was better than we expected. Various breads, bagels, muffins and pastries. Usually eggs and sausages. Cereals and a waffle iron for you to make your own (though it seemed to have a mind of its own each time I tried).

Cons 
Knew the room would be small but didn’t realise how small - don’t bring the cat as you won’t be able to swing it!
It was also far too hot despite turning the radiator off.

The breakfast room was far too small to accommodate the volume of guests and if you didn’t go down early you could miss out on items. The one issue we did have one morning was the hot items were still frozen. Once reported it was rectified.

The lift was a little small and slow at times.

However our stay was good and tbh you’re not in the room other than to sleep so would recommend 😁

title: Very good value hotel in great spot 2 minutes walk from Central Park
text: This was a great location.  The rooms were small but satisfactory.  Breakfast was included in the price and although this was fairly basic, it was enough to set you up for the day.  The only criticism  I would offer is that the dining room is too small for the number of guests so it could get very congested and you would have to wait around to get a table.

title: Good and Bad Points
text:
Firstly, the positives:
- Great location. A stones throw to Central Park, and a short subway ride to all of Manhattan
- Friendly staff
- Rooms cleaned thoroughly every day
- Good powerful air conditioning
- Free coffee and tea 24/7
- Comfortable bed

Secondly, the negatives:
- The basic double room is smaller than you expect. We could not get two suitcases in the room without having to step over them every day, and spent the entire week tripping over each other. We ended up with one suitcase living in the bathroom.
- The bath tub is approximately four foot long. Fine for a stand up shower, but impossible for anyone other than a child to lie down in
- The bathroom sink, toilet, shower head, shower controls and towel hook were all loose and wobbly, and some were almost hanging off the wall
- The windows were almost opaque with dirt and grime
- The breakfast was limited and very difficult to eat in the restaurant. The restaurant has around 30 seats and the hotel has 14 floors worth of guests. 

Ultimately, as if often the case, you get what you pay for. But my god, pay for the upgraded room. We booked the basic room after seeing the photos on Trip Advisor. To our surprise, the photos on Trip Advisor do not accurately represent the room size of the basic double room at all. Thankfully, we spent most of our days out and about exploring.

NB: Excuse the untidiness of the photos, we were in the process of packing to leave! I took them just to show the size of the room

title: Very good location, friendly staff, clean and nice breakfast. Breakfast room should be bigger.
text: Very good location, just 1 minute from Central Park, Dakota house is the opposite street and 2 minutes from Natural Science Museum, all walking distance; friendly staff, clean and nice breakfast. Breakfast room should be bigger.

title: Amazing place very close to Central Park and the subway
text: Loved this place, room was fine for me as i was on my own even though others said they are a bit small. The breakfast was great everyday had a selection to get you started for the day ahead. Rooms cleaned and prepared everyday and they always did a great job. Kieth at the desk was amazing and incredibly helpful. Really close to the subway which is a few minutes walk around the corner. for the price this place is amazing and would highly recommend it.

title: Perfect location, friendly service
text:
The hotel is right next to the Central Park and you can get to the time square very fast and easily by foot or subway.
Room service is very good and cleans every day. 
The cheapest room category means really small, but one grade up the room was very nice. 
Breakfast is ok and has very good bagels and waffels.
The service at the reception ist outstanding and really friendly and helpful.

title: King Corner Room
text: I can recommend this room type as it was two of us that stayed here and I can’t imagine any smaller accommodations without ppl walking on top of each other.  Hence, rooms are very compact.  Location is great, on a quiet street, walking distance to many restaurants and activities not to mention, Central Park is down the street.  Please be aware, if you book via the 1-800 #, ensure all logistics are accurate, take agent’s name/date and make sure you receive an email confirmation of details (especially, if you revise reservations).  Needless to say, I had an issue which I’m handling separately; although, the Customer Care Agent did their best to accommodate to fix the error of the 1-800 agent, this issue still was not resolved to my satisfaction.

title: Recomendable
text: Excelente ubicacion en manhattan cerca del metro , las habitaciones son pequeñas , el desayuno es lo que mas destaco del hotel , muy completo , pero a veces se llena y hay que esperar para sentarse .-

title: Nice, friendly hotel
text: A block from Central Park.  Nice, quiet, safe street.  We were able to park for free on the street.  There were several places to eat right on that block.  We did use Uber to get to Little Italy and Times Square.  The bed was super comfy! The free breakfast was just ok.  Keith at the front desk was always welcoming and helpful.

title: Pesima atencion
text: Las habitaciones son muy pequeñas y el baño minusculo, nos robaron 100$ de la habitacion y nadie movio un dedo para ponerle solucion al incidente, es decir, nos hemos vuelto sin solucion y sin dinero.

title: Great location/Great price
text: This is a small hotel on the Upper West Side, a block from Central Park and near subways and buses. It is within walking distance of the Museum of Natural History, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Neue Gallery, Guggenheim Museum, New York Historical Society. Staff is very friendly and rooms are clean. Breakfast is basic but there is something for everyone. Recommended!

title: Boa localização com bom custo
text: Boa localização.Próximo ao metro que facilitou nossos passeios a estatua da Liberdade e ao Brooklin e conseguimos fazer muitos deles a pé, como o Museo de Historia Natural e ao Museu Metropolitano de Arte.

title: Small, but great deal
text: Small but efficient room. Great location near Central Park. Great price. Breakfast was ok. Very helpful and friendly staff. Lobby and room couldn't been cleaned, but still was a great stay for my husband and daughter.

title: Great for 1-2 people!
text: The hotel is located in one of the safest, prettiest parts of the city and just a couple metro stops away from many interesting attractions. The place is relatively small and the rooms obviously are tiny too, so I wouldn't bring more than two people unless I really wanted to prioritize value over having some personal space; but the value certainly is good. Breakfast was great, fresh and varied. Staff was nice and the area was nice to explore, right next to Central Park.

title: Excellent service, clean room, and amazing view
text: We stayed here for such a short time, but truthfully, it was absolutely what we needed. The hotel is conveniently located right across from Central Park and down a little side street. You are right down the street from multiple subway stations, infinite food, and not far from a lot of the touristy things you want to go see in Manhattan. The hotel itself was excellent. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The view was spectacular, the towels were always fresh, and the breakfast was (as always) on point. But mostly, the service made this stay phenomenal. Our front desk managers were always friendly and offering up advice on anything New York. Keith was by far the best. On our last day, we got a bit lost and it started pouring. We made it back to the hotel 10 minutes before check out and absolutely soaking wet. Keith sent us back to our room with an extra hair dryer to help dry out our shoes and clothes and let us check out late so we didn't have to sit in the airport miserable and wet all day. He went above and beyond and really made our stay fantastic. I have another trip to Manhattan in a few months and you better believe I will absolutely stay here again.

title: wifes birthday
text: great budget hotel, ideally situated for the main roads, central park and easy walking distance to times square broadway , theatre district, subway at the end of the road too. probably the cheapest hotel around this exclusive area,,,,,if I had to moan a little, I would say the restaurant in the mornings was a little cramped.

title: It's small but not that bad
text: I stayed in a small bedroom with my girlfriend and it wasn't that bad for us, we stayed for a full week and by the end of it, I was used to the small space in the bedroom and the shower. The only thing I had a problem was the toillet. I'm a tall guy, and my knees hit the pipes below the sink. The rest of the hotel is nice, everything seems clean, people are nice as well. No complaint. Breakfast is 5/10, not really that much, and the hours are not convinient. Coffee 24/7, definetely a plus!

title: Great value hotel in the upper west side
text: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. It has a great location in the upper west side, right next to Central Park. Very nice neighberhoos and subway stations nearby. Comfortable and clean rooms at a great price.

title: Smallest room ever!
text: This was the smallest room I've ever stayed in, worldwide. The hallways were barely wide enough to walk through. I've stayed in rooms where I've had to put my luggage on a balcony...but this room didn't even have a balcony. The room description was misleading in what it omitted. I also expect La Quinta rooms to have a desk so I can get some work done while I'm traveling. This room had not even an area for a desk. I'll surely check elsewhere before staying at LQ the next time I'm in The City.   The location was good though...close to Columbus Ave. at 71st Street. There are lots of good restaurants in the area. Good shopping in the area too!

title: Small, clean and central
text:
I knew I was in for a unique experience when I entered the elevator and it holds no more than four people!  The double room was small and fit for one person.  The view was of the back of the Majestic Hotel.  Hotel is small and clean but centrally located and has friendly desk staff.  
I had an emergency (nosebleed at 4:30 in the morning) and the front desk person brought me some ice.  Keith and Linwood are the best!

title: SO VERY PLEASED! CAN’T WAIT TO RETURN!
text:
I absolutely loved staying here!!!! It was only one night but we’ll be back for sure!
Here are details about parking, the room & hotel from a first time guest...

I wasn’t sure what to expect, & was a bit anxious, never having experienced a Manhattan hotel before. Plus, worries about parking & the hassle of loading/unloading on the busy streets of NYC crossed my mind a lot too since I was arriving in my own car. But, it all went so smoothly! 

Now, for the sake of quick reference for other Trip Advisor review readers, here goes:

Accommodations:
If you’ve never stayed in NYC before, be prepared for SMALL! One small elevator for a 14 story building. If you can think “cruise ship sized hallways & rooms”, you’ll be in the right mindset. BUT! None of this presented a problem, it’s just something to be prepared for.

We (adult daughter & I) had a corner king room on the 6th floor & it was AMAZING! Super clean, updated room with plenty of space for two people! Not to mention an extra comfy bed, a cute view out to the back from a couple of the windows (others faced the neighboring homes, so we just kept the blinds closed), refreshing shower, huge TV, & in-room coffee maker. And again, super clean everything!

Parking & Amenities:

Unloading-Though there is no designated spot outside the hotel to stop while you unload or go to check-in, 71st is a quiet, fairly narrow, residential street, with open gaps (errr, fire hydrant/no parking areas) where you can pull to the side momentarily near the hotel. Just make sure someone stays behind to move the car if necessary while you’re briefly inside.

Parking-One block up on 72nd between Central Park West and Columbus Ave is Rapid Parking lot. If you get your parking ticket stamped at the hotel front desk at check-out, the total cost is $38 for 24 Hours of parking (as of January 2019). That’s a steal in NYC! 

Other Amenities: Complimentary breakfast from 7am-10am (didn’t get to try it though), a mini convenience store in the lobby, computers in the lobby

Last but not least, Maria at the front desk overnight was so friendly & helpful! She made me feel at home, & not like “just another guest passing through”, by taking the time to talk with me a little when I went downstairs in the middle of the night. Her friendliness was the icing on the cake! 

I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Good value for money
text: This is a bare bones hotel but worth the money in NYC. I have stayed here before and will stay again if I need to book a hotel in New York that is close to midtown on short notice for a decent price. The rooms are clean though very small for most who might not be used to crammed spaces, as I lived in NYC in the past, this wasn’t a problem for me.

title: Don't stay here
text: The room displayed in the ad is not the room I was given. Ridiculously small room. Couldn't open dresser as it was too close to the bed. Barely enough room to get dressed. Old bathroom with walls painted over and over numerous times. Dirt in corners. Windows blackened out. Broken shower handle. A real nightmare!

title: Super small rooms, but well maintained
text:
My coworker and I stayed at this hotel for one night.  It was a room with a twin and full bed (Room 504).  One thing you have to remember is that you will pay for space in NY.  The bathroom was tiny, you could sit on the toilet, wash your hands in the sink and shower your feet!

All in all a decent room, was a clean hotel and friendly staff.

title: Great location!
text: If you wanna be close to central park and away from the crowds of times square this is the place! Easy access to subway will take you anywhere in the city. Walking distance to Columbus Avenue and many fine restaurants.

title: Disappointed
text: let me start with mentioning that I'm an Elite Member we choose this hotel to spend out last night in NYC during our 8 days east coast trip , we used point to make the reservation , and we select the Central Park View with corner windows .check in : was super fast and easy the staff was nice and helpful and we do appreciate that .Room : that was our 1st problem , is the room is not what we promised instead of Central Park View we got 6 floor next building view. !! I totally understand we used point for the reservation put that is not an excuse to lower lever of service .the air condition noise is unbearable and we had hard time to sleep .lastly we asked the front desk if we can have a microwave inside the room and they said yes but did't show up . overall having 3 issue for 1 night stay is too much and I do wish hotel did better because it one of our favorite  .

title: Excellent Staff
text:
We felt fortunate to book our room just one day before the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. We needed two beds but the only room available had only a double bed so I took our twin size inflatable air mattress.  There was not an area on the floor wide enough to accommodate the width of the air mattress but we made do for one night. The next day, after the Macy's Parade was over, they were able to give us a room with two beds so we were much more comfortable.
The location of the property and the excellent staff are the redeeming features of this hotel. Fabien,at the front desk, made our after dark check-in easy. He had extra Decaf coffee and the extra linens for our air mattress delivered to our room by the time we returned from seeing the tethered balloons. The balloons were just a few blocks from the hotel so there was no need to take the subway. 
During the day, Keith has the keys to the kingdom (i.e. the authority and trust of the owner, whom we met). Keith keeps everyone and everything running smoothly. Because this was the second coldest Macy's Parade on record and we'd gone out on the street at 5:00 a.m. we took the bedspread with us. Upon returning from the parade, I confessed to Keith that we had soiled the white comforter from our room and asked whether there was a guest laundry available so I could wash it. Keith told me to just give it to housekeeping and dismissed it as unnecessary when I offered to pay for the bedspread. When I saw a housekeeper pushing the laundry cart, I told him of Keith's instructions and also our room number so they could charge me if necessary, but he too dismissed it as though it was no big deal.  I supposed they are used to this as they are the closest hotel to the parade route. We only had to walk one block, really only half a block, before finding a place on Central Park West. 
On our last trip to New York in 2016, we stayed on the other side of Central Park. It is busier and noisier, and quite a bit more spacious and expensive. You pay to be nearer 5th Ave. and all the action This hotel is just one block and then right across the street from Strawberry Fields in Central Park(John Lennon). We walked through the park and saw the Sheep Meadow, the ice skating on the Pond, and then down 5th Ave all the way to Rockefeller Center admiring the Holiday window displays. The next day we also walked to the American Museum of Natural History ( famous from Night at the Museum movie) so this location is perfect if taking the subway makes you nervous like it does us.

title: 部屋は快適
text: フロントは狭く、日本のビジネスホテルのような感じ。でも、部屋は結構広く快適でした。セントラルパークに近く、ジョンレノンが射殺されたダコタハウスのすぐ近くなので観光には良いホテルだと思います。タイムズスクエアまでも徒歩で40分位だと思います。

title: Nice, quiet... and really small
text: Let's start by the negative point : the room for three was really small （no more than 10 square meters）and we stayed there a week with the baggages for three weeks ! The breakfast was quite good （just quite good because it was really american so not really healthy ）and it was a pleasure to have waffles with mapple syrup every morning. The staff was really welcoming, the hotel was really clean and very quiet （a chance because it's quite rare in the city center of the big apple ）! And now the must : the location ! At just one hundred meters from central park, from the dakota hotel, from to subway stations ! By the subway （20 ＄ per person and per week）Time Square is at just 12 minutes, and everything is approximately at less than 30 minutes ! To make it short : we had a really nice and quiet stay in the heart of the big apple, perfect to enjiy this wonderful week !

title: Un ottimo albergo a New York
text:
Posizione: a chi piace stare fuori dal casino di Times Square e in un quartiere delizioso come il West side lo straconsiglio. A due passi da Central Park e dal Museo di Storia Naturale.
Comodo per la metro (due stazioni vicine) per arrivare ovunque (da midtown a lower Manhattan).
Io avevo una camera angolare al costo di pochi dollari in più della normale: veramente spaziosa con un letto comodissimo e due piccole cabine armadio per riporre vestiti e valigie. Bagno sempre pulito e asciugamani cambiati spesso.
È uno dei pochi con la colazione compresa: dolci e salati, caffè e bevande. Più la macchina per fare i waffle! Assortimento vasto comunque senza la rottura di dover cercare un bar dove mangereste le stesse cose. Gli unici appunti: l’ascensore (uno) che a volte provoca attese più la sala della colazione veramente piccola.
Visto il prezzo si può soprassedere su queste pecche. Se trovate offerte competitive tenetelo in considerazione.

title: Boa opção em NY
text: Hotel pequeno muito bem localizado. A duas quadras da estação do metro 72st, linha 1 que corta Manhattan. Próximo de restaurantes e lojas e a meia quadra do central park. É possível ir a pé ao museu de história natural e Metropolitan. O café da manha ajuda muito. É simples. Tem café americano, leite, suco de laranja tudo de maquina. Alguns paes, waffle, geleia, manteiga, cream cheese. Talheres e prato descartáveis. A maquina de café e chá pode ser usada o dia todo. O quarto Corner King Room é bem confortável. Cama grande, 2 armarios, tv e mesa para trabalho. Limpeza diária. calefação. Só tem 1 elevador que é usado tanto pelos hóspedes como para serviço. Chegamos as 12:30 e quarto ja nos foi liberado, mesmo sendo o checki-in apenas as 15h.

title: Residential Upper West Side
text:
Tiny rooms, decent beds, convenient to Lincoln Center area, close to restaurants, on a quiet residential street between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue.
My visit was in mid November but it could get rather crazy right before the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade which does quite bit of it set up in this neighborhood.

title: One (important) detail.
text:
We spent 6 nights at 12th floor this October.
It was written already in some reviews about "minuscule" rooms. I would like to clarify a little bit. We booked a room with a "double" bed. Got the room of approx. 9 (nine) square meters. It means, for example, there is no chair in the room - because there is no place to put a chair there.  It means also that when one opens a suitcase on a stand (which is provided!) it is impossible to go to the bathroom - there is no way to pass the suitcase.
 I guess for rooms queen and king size beds conditions may be more space is designed. For 6 nights  - booking "double" was for sure the wrong choice. 
All other things: cleanliness, a trained staff at the reception - are correct. 
By the way: the rooms on our floor were cleaned at 2:30- 3:30 PM - this is important to know (for tourists)

title: L'Hotel si trova in una posizione moto interessante vicino Central Park e la metropolitana
text: La camera ha un letto comodissimo ma la stanza è estremamente piccola così come anche il bagno. La colazione, compresa nel prezzo, è scarsa tipo fast food. L'Hotel si trova in un palazzo di tredici piani vicinissimo a Central Park. Il personale è accogliente ma tutto risente degli spazi risicati.

title: An interesting hotel!  Brilliant location and a decent breakfast!
text: As another reviewer has said, 'temper your expectations and you'll be fine'!  On the plus side, the rooms are clean and they are equipped with a tea / coffee maker.  As against that, the rooms are exceedingly small, and if you had a cat, there would be little space in which to swing it!  We had booked a corner King room some weeks back and were astonished to find that when we arrived, our room had been re-assigned, notwithstanding that we had received a confirmation reminder the previous day. Apparently there was some difficulty with our credit card number and, rather than await our arrival later that day, they emailed us while we were airborne for NYC, and then released our room!  They had one room left when we arrived - with two single beds!  We were staying for three nights and they made no effort to rectify the situation.  That aside, the breakfast was fine and the location was perfect for Central Park etc.

title: An interesting hotel!  Brilliant location and a decent breakfast!
text: As another reviewer has put it, 'temper your expectations and you'll be fine'!  The rooms are decidedly small and there is no space to walk around.  On the plus side, the rooms were clean and came with a tea /coffee maker which is always a plus.  On the down side, notwithstanding that we had received confirmation of our booking just the previous day, the hotel had already booked our room again to another couple when we arrived, due to an apparent mix up with our credit card details.  They had emailed us for clarification while we were in the air to NYC!  Luckily they had one room remaining which they gave us - with two single beds rather than a King!  So, adequate perhaps, but zero frills, I'm afraid!

title: Location is amazing
text: The purpose of our trip was to see New York.  We had no intention of spending any time in the room except to sleep at night.  Our room had a king size but with the most amazing mattress.  We slept great every night.   The breakfast buffet in the morning had everything we wanted or needed.  The staff in the breakfast room kept the room spotlessly clean and well stocked.  The front desk staff, Keith and Fabian, were amazing.  If we had a question, they had an answer.  We had Metro passes and when we were unsure of a route they were there to help.  But the best thing about this hotel is the location.  A few minute walk to Central Park, 10 blocks to the Museum of Natural History.  Want to go downtown, uptown you can walk or catch the number 1,2,3 or A or C train.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Temper Your Expectations and You’ll Be Fine
text: The hotel is narrow and tired. The rooms small and the heating noisy but the location is great as is the price. We stayed here overnight recently for an event at Lincoln Center. Perfectly located, you’re half a block from the park and easy walking distance to everything the upper west side has to offer. All for around $300 per day. After a night on the town it can be a bit of a let down to return to the hotel but if you’re looking for a good value, this is the place. If parking you’re car, arrange with hotel for almost 1/2 price!

title: Location, LOCATION!!
text: This was the smallest room I've ever stayed at, however there are other amenities that make up for it. Small room but efficient...has all you need with comfortable bed and good water pressure in bathroom. The location is great with Central Park West at one end & Columbus Ave on the other-with all the shops & restaurants as you walk. Train station one block away to take you where ever you wish to go!  The breakfast is perfect for La Quinta with "real" Sausages!  Front Desk assistants were welcoming. Yes I will stay again!

title: Correcto sólo para pasar la noche
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado pero tiene habitaciones pequeñas y de aspecto envejecido. Parece limpio y con un desayuno aceptable. Es para estadías cortas porque resulta incómodo por el tamaño y el ruido de la calle aunque se encuentra en una zona de facil acceso a todo

title: Hotel Simples
text: Hotel bastante simples com café da manhã também simples incluído na diária. Quarto pequeno porém com camas confortáveis. Ideal para que não que passar o dia no hotel e somente dormir. Localizado a 1 quadra do Central Park e a duas quadras da estação de metro.

title: Well Listen!!!
text: The rooms are very small.  It is a tight squeeze for 2 people but the Hotel location is wonderful.  The front desk and other hotel workers are very nice.  The Hotel and  room was clean.  The bed was comfortable. Phone, TV, heat, air conditioner, hot water work fine.  The small bathroom is a walk in and back out but it works.  The contential breakfast is good.  The room rates are reasonable but prices/taxes go up on weekends.  The elevator is slow but it works.  Even though the rooms are small ( the bed will take up most of the room ) this hotel gets booked alot.  If you need space, If you are a big person or over six feet, do not stay here, it will be uncomfortable to move around in the space provided.  That said If you just need a place to sleep and will not spend time in your room then go ahead and book it.  If I need to I will stay again.  THIS LaQUINTA DOES NOT ACCEPT PETS ( only service dogs or emotional support dogs)  They must be small.

title: Pésimo hotel - the worst
text:
Las habitaciones son extremadamente pequeñas y ruidosas y no son acogedoras.
El desayuno es muy malo
La cama no es doble, como lo decía en la oferta. La habitación y la cama son demasiado pequeñas para dos personas.
El aire acondicionado de las demás habitaciones se oye en la habitación en la que uno está hospedado. La ventilación de la habitación es mínima y esto hace que no sea confortable la estadía.
Es demasiado caro para lo que ofrece.
No lo recomendaría a nadie. Estas habitaciones producen claustrofobia.

title: A rare find in NYC
text: Excellent location on the Upper West Side in a very nice neighborhood with a number of really nice cafes, bars and restaurants all within walking distance. We stayed in a queen room on the 11th floor and it was perfectly adequate with no issues encountered during our stay. The free breakfast had a varied selection, though it did get crowded at peak times. The same goes for the elevator, though we never had to wait for longer than a few minutes.

title: PIOR ESCOLHA EM TODOS OS SENTIDOS
text: rerervamos um apt triplo no hotel. Assim que entramos no quarto, vimos que não tinha a mínima condição de ficarem 3 pessoas naquele apt. Era quase um corredor. A cama de casal encostada na parede, ou seja, só dava para sair pulando por cima da outra pessoa. Não cabiam sequer as malas abertas no pouco espaço vago que tinha. Chegamos a pedir para retirarem a tv do quarto para termos ao menos o espaço de cima da mesa, mas eles se negaram. Além disso, o apt estava sujo e as roupas de cama amassadas.O banheiro é mínimo e havia um buraco na janela (vidro quebrado). Sensação de claustrofobia total. Tivemos que mudar de htl no dia seguinte. Cafe da manhã servido em ´pratos de papelão.

title: Tur til New York kan anbefales. Og ta en tur ned til WTO senteret. Ta en tur opp i det ene tårnet. En oppleves.
text:
Dyrt, og små rom.Mye støy fra aircondition. Alltid over fult i matsal til frokost.
Styr unna.
Det positive er beliggenheten, nær Central Park. Nærhet til undergrunnsbanen (subway) Mange bra spisesteder i området.
Men La Quinta Inn & Suites er for dyrt og kan ikke anbefale det til andre.

title: Hidden Gem on Upper West Side
text: This hotel is in a terrific location on the upper west side-just a couple blocks from Central Park, Bethesda Fountain and Strawberry Fields.  The B/C line is two blocks away making getting around super convenient.  by NYC standards the room is a fair size.  We had a very large bathroom as well.In room coffee and breakfast included are a additional perk.

title: Miniscule room but so tempting to stay again
text: I am really torn about encouraging people to choose this hotel because of the tiny room (we had two people in a room for three, but even then it was a squeeze). However, if you can get beyond that there are so many good features. Our room was meticulously clean, the bed was really comfortable with enough pillows and nice bedding, and the tiny bathroom had a good shower. There were plenty of reasonably sized towels, a wardrobe and reasonable lighting . Only reasonable because unless you have a back lit kindle reading in bed with one bedside lamp and table is a real burden. On the other hand, it was good enough for everything else. Breakfast was similar to any breakfast available at this level of hotel, bread for toasting, muffins, fresh fruit, waffles, cereals and beverages. The breakfast space is limited but people are willing to share tables etc.  The staff were efficient and friendly. Most important, the location is terrific. What could be nicer than a walk across Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and other galleries in close proximity? There were three restaurants within a short walk, a convenience store and other eating places in the next block.

title: when it was good it was very very good but WHEN IT WAS BAD IT WAS HORRID!!! huge disappointment
text:
I must say that as a repeat guest the staff, Keith, Linwood maids and maintenance people are DELIGHFUL   Of course I realize one cannot always get a perfect room but your bottom of the line rooms are terrible  and why I got the short straw is a mystery  why join a rewards program, why be a repeat customer  why try to establish  a positive relationship with the personnel (charming employees – But especially why bother to choose in advance and pay for the BEST ROOM IN THE HOTEL only to end up on the bottom of the barrel….. For my second visit to the La Quinta Central Park in just over two weeks paid TOP PRICE. for three nights in  a "King size Corner Room" the room I ended up in looked like been a recently emptied supply room 

Terrible terrible Upon opening the door of room 502 we saw a  sleeping alcove mostly filled by ‘yes’ a king size bed, three windows, two too filthy to see through and one hidden by a column. A smelly air conditioner blowing directly onto our midsections and at a right angle to the windowed wall  a blank wall with a large flat screen tv
Really no fair and for me very sad 

of course the La Quinta Central Park will not be hurt by a bad review (if it ever gets mentioned) I am sure they will have DROVES and DROVES of tourists  But I am a new Yorker born and bred –I am sure the  pool of satisfied and not too satisfied tourists will not dry up and  silly of me not only to look for a hotel but to seek a new nest in New York City.

title: Snug, but otherwise fine
text:
The La Quinta Inn & Suites New York City Central Park is not flashy, but it will provide a nice stay in a unique location.  When you think of Manhattan hotels, it is easy to picture monstrous high rises near Times Square.  The La Quinta kind of takes you away from the hustle and bustle, while still providing the full New York experience.

The hotel is really quite easy to overlook.  It is tucked neatly into a Brownstone residential neighborhood.  While only about a 2 minute walk from Central Park, it is isolated away from the bulk of the traffic and the noise nearby.  The closest Subway station is also only a couple of minutes away (although it was under renovations and closed during our visit).  The next closest location is about a 10 minute walk.

The lobby and the rooms are small.  However, the hotel does offer a comfortable feel and is modern.  The rooms are well-appointed.  

Eateries are close by, and the amazingness of Times Square is about a 20 minute walk.  The area feels incredibly safe.

While it would not be recommended to visit this La Quinta with more than two people per room (on account of their size), for a couples weekend or if flying solo this really is a nice place to stay.  A no-frills, free breakfast is a great way to start your day.

title: Equipe muito amavel
text: Precisei reservar um hotel de forma urgente em NYC e tive muita sorte essa opção! Os funcionários sao extremamente educados e preparados, sempre amáveis e prontos pra ajudar! O quarto é super pequeno, mas a limpeza cautelosa e a excelente localização compensam. Recomendo o hotel e pretendo voltar em breve.

title: Need better bed
text: Customer needs to be made aware of how small the rooms are and that parking is nonexistent and they will have to pay for parking, and it is costly. This was the first Time I stayed at a La Quinta and did not get a good nights sleep due to the bed. Customer also needs to To be made aware that the bathtub is so small you can only shower and it. And there literally is no room to put any kind of toiletries or dill plant make up or do you hair in the bathroom.

title: Updated, Clean, Friendly Staff and Close to Central Park
text: We stayed for 3 nights in a corner king room.  The bed was super comfy and although the room is on the small side, good windows and light, it fit our needs perfectly and the price was right.  Only 92 rooms and it books quickly since it is so close to Central Park.  KEITH, the receptionist is AMAZING!  He gave us great tips and ordered a car service for us (the hotel has an arrangement with an independent driver) to take us back to the airport.  We paid the same price as we did for a taxi in from the airport and the driver and his van were a lot nicer. The  maid service (Babita and Lorenza were so nice and accommodating in giving us extra towels.  The 1,2,3 subway was a few blocks away and the A, B, C, D was right around the corner.  We love this part of town and we were not disappointed.  We would stay here again.

title: NYC Visit
text: The location is excellent and it has a neighborhood feel. There are numerus restaurants in the immediate area along with easy access to the 1,2,3 subway lines. Of course, the best thing is it is so close the Central Park a true haven in NYC.

title: Za tak wygórowaną cenę nie można dać wyższej oceny!!!
text: Niewątpliwe zalety: 1) położenie - mniej więcej centrum Mahattanu, 2)  profesjonalna, miła i uczynna obsługa, 3) bezpłatny internet, 4) ciepłe napoje łącznie z czekoladą przez 24 h. Wady, a przynajmniej uciążliwości: 1) Pokoje (choć mają wygodne łóżka, to w spaniu przeszkadzają nieszczelne drzwi wejściowe, co powoduje, że hałas dostaję się do wewnątrz); 2) śniadania (bardzo ubogie i poza owocami i jajkami na twardo niesmaczne, kawa fatalna); 3) Łazienka - prysznic wystający ze ściany (żeby umyć się bez zmoczenia włosów trzeba założyć czepek kąpielowy); 4) cena - 336,28$ za dobę, tj. 1244,24 zł za 2-osobowy pokój za dobę! 5) stare klekoczące windy; 6) ponure widoki z okna!

title: Amazing value in an excellent location
text: I stayed here for 6 nights and was very happy with my choice. It’s a budget hotel so rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was quite basic but absolutely fine. The location is excellent- I was able to walk across Central Park to the Met and the Guggenheim. It’s a very short walk to the subway, shops, cafes, restaurants and a laundromat. Keith on the front desk was very helpful too. It was a bargain based on its location and nearby amenities. Would definitely stay again.

title: Great Location!
text: Wasn't sure what I was going to get for the rate but I got an excellent room/ bathroom. Friendly staff and I was a stone's throw to restaurants, Central Park, and museums.  Breakfast included. Coffee was also excellent. The rate for the room is not to be believed!  A total bargain.

title: Great location, paper thin walls
text: The rooms are tiny, and I know is a NYC standard, but this room was so small, that only one night stand next to the bed fits, if one person sits on the desk, the other person can not get through. Location is excellent, loved being so close to Central Park, and would be able to overlook the room size IF you were able to sleep: but we could hear every single time one person flushed the toilet, or water running from the shower..... It was a long night, glad is only one night.

title: Offensively overpriced
text: First of all paying more then 500 usd for the room I stayed is almost offensive. There was just space enough for the bed.. The room was humid dark and with a tiny window from where you can just see.. bricks. Poor and noisy air conditioning. And then.. I had long discussions with the staff because they made a mistake charging with my credit card and caused me a lot of troubles. One of the staff at the moment of the check out apologized ("sorry we charged the wrong credit card") .. When I called back to ask for clarifications why the amount was doubled (I offered proofs of it) .. They blamed the bank and denied any mistake from them. Unacceptable. Especially when you pay a lot of money for quite an embarassing hotel room.

title: One elevator and substandard air conditioning
text: First, the rooms are tiny. I am glad I was by myself, since there was not enough room for more people in the room. The air conditioning unit was missing parts, so it did not operate completely or efficiently. There was only one elevator in the hotel. I waited 15 minutes to get an elevator downstairs on my last day with luggage due to this. I will not come back here again.

title: BUENA ATENCIÓN Y UBICACIÓN BIEN CÉNTRICA. RECOMENDABLE!!!
text: El hotel es antiguo y lo están remodelando para que resulte más confortable. La ubicación es bien céntrica, cercana a una estación del Metro. La habitación era pequeña pero aseada y limpia. El desayuno,  Aceptable y no muy variado. Es un hotel BÁSICO, sin grandes pretensiones pero con una ubicación muy buena

title: Lovely stay at La Quinta Central Park NYC
text: Very close to Central Park, the hotel was extremely quiet and cosy. Quality of the sleep was excellent due to the bed and the quietness of the hotel and its neighborhood.  The location was very convenient for visiting. The staff was very nice and helpful - though we arrived pretty late, they kept the room for us. We had a wonderful stay. The breakfast had a variety of meal, very good.

title: Excellent Location
text: The location of this hotel at 71st and CPW is fabulous. Great neighborhood and near to the Frick Collection and AMNH. We had a queen bed room - it is small - but fine for 2 people. The room was immaculate, the bathroom too. I did not have breakfast but my husband said that the food choice was fairly good. The breakfast room gets a little tight so go early. I will definitely stay at this property again.

title: Location, Location, Location and Keith
