text: This is a nice hotel just off Central Park West.  Keith at the front desk will treat you like family and provide any assistance to make your stay memorable.  We love the neighborhood, access to Central Park, transportation, and nearby restaurants. The rooms are small, clean and efficient. Breakfast is included.

title: Du bon et du moins bon
text:
Notre chambre (703) tenait plus du placard que de la chambre, vraiment très petite et sans aucune vue. Heureusement la literie est bonne et tout est propre et très calme. Le personnel est sympa est serviable. Le petit déjeuner n'est pas recherché.
Bon emplacement contre Central Park sud.

title: Phonemanal
text: This hotel and all it staff is beyond AMAZING.  We will be booking soon to return to ENJOY more of New York City. The only concern I have is we would love to check in before 3pm due to traveling hours before arriving to the hotel.  We would love to be able to check in earlier rather than later.  OTHERWISE everything is SUPER GOOD.  Thank You for being beyond Superb.

title: Above expectations
text: For the price that I paid and the location the hotel was. The cleanliness and courtesy of two of the front desk employees went beyond my expectations. The morning shift guy was useless, I was on the 7th floor in the tiny hallway for 20 minutes waiting for the elevator. I had my son in the stroller no ac and the heat was killing us, only way out was that elevator that no one was willing to give up for a mom with a crying stressed kid.

title: Avoid the triple rooms
text:
Just back from staying here with my mum for 5 days. 
The triple rooms are terribly designed:
- they are tiny
- they are next to the elevator shaft so you will hear beeping and mechanical sounds all night
- the air con unit is literally at the foot of the single bed blowing cold air right into the guests face when used.
- the breakfast is closer to a hostel than a hotel and the dining room can be so overcrowded you can’t get a seat.

On the plus side, if you don’t care about the above, it is clean and in a lovely neighbourhood, but I was expecting a better nights sleep considering the cost of a room here. I would’nt stay here again or recommend to friends.

title: Nice hotel at central park
text: Nice hotel at central park. Nice staff. Good rooms. The breakfastroom was very small, and we waited to be seated. The food at breakfast was not very good either, and the allways ran out of something (butter, cheese etc.). Nice with the bagage storage on the last day. Well-working Aircondition. Perfect located - 20 minutes walk to Times Square. Subway close by as well.

title: Small rooms but serious plumbing issue
text: We have stayed here before without issues but this stay was marred by very poor service in addressing a serious plumbing issue.  Toilet blocked in room and was not repaired after 2 service calls causing the issue to recur 3 times.  Very unpleasant and disappointing.

title: Credit Card used by Hotel after free cancellation
text: I had done booking of this hotel from booking.com. However I cancelled my booking before 23 days of the stay, under free cancellation. Even after that Hotel has used my Credit card and charged me 200 USD (don't know for what). This is really sad and I hope that this gets resolved by the hotel/ booking.com.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
Es un hotel pequeño, con habitaciones pequeñas pero muy bien equipadas, el servicio y la limpieza son muy buenas, el desayuno es bueno, tal vez para mi gusto le falta algo de proteínas y con esto me refiero a salchichas, bacon como ítems fijos todos los días, pero para los que no necesitan de esto el desayuno esta muy bien y completo. 
Ya hemos estados alojados allí en otra oportunidad y volvimos, sobre todo porque nos gusta la ubicación a una cuadra del Central Park y  con varias estaciones de subte cercanas, sumando que estas en un barrio que cuenta con muy buena gastronomía, comercios , laundry y por sobre todo muy tranquilo. su precio por 6 noches una pareja USD 1470 final

title: Méfiance !
text:
Suis arrivé un 14 aout à 23h30 en ayant prévenu de mon heure tardive d'arrivée. 
J'avais réservé sur Booking ( et tous les papiers en mains + l'application qui confirmait). 
Réponse : on ne vous a pas sur nos fichiers, et nous n' avons plus de chambre ( ce qui n'est pas un hasard car je suis à peu près sûr qu'ils ont fait un beau surbooking !) 
>>> demerdez vous ! 
Minuit à NY avec 2 gosses . ..
Cauchemar. 
J'ai suffisamment râlé pour que la réceptionniste daigne me trouver un hôtel miteux à 10 rues de là, séparé de mes enfants dans des chambres minuscules et d'une autre époque. 

Bizarrement l'hôtel a payé notre taxi pour aller dans le trou à rats , aller retour, ce qui me confirme bien qu'il se sentaient un peu fautifs (le mot est faible). 

Bref le lendemain retour à La Quinta car pour les 5 nuits suivantes ils se sont débrouillés : sauf que chambre minuscule, j'ai dormi dans un lit pliant, on se marchait dessus. 

Clim inutilisable la nuit car couinements 80 décibels... Chaleur ++ 

Salle de petit dej quasi inutilisable, c'est la guerre car trop petite, sauf si vous aimez manger debout (une fois sur deux nous sommes allés déjeuner à l’extérieur). 
Ascenseur : un seul pour 14 étages... Si vous êtes en bas tout va bien, sinon courage. 

Par contre très bien situé quartier à la fois calme et sympa, métro à deux pas, central park à 200m, ça c'est très bien. 
Un autre bon point la qualité de la literie (pas le lit pliant, hein) : top. 
Salle de bains standard propre . 

WIFI gratuite qui fonctionne bien (en tout cas au 5e )

title: Great location but that's generally where the positives end.
text: We stay in NYC at least several times a year as our son is in college in the Upper West Side. Starting with the positives, the W 71st St location is fantastic, a quiet street near Central Park. If you ask, the hotel will validate parking for a garage one block over. However, that's generally where the positives end. Indifferent front-desk employee at check-in. Instead of the queen that we reserved through a 3rd party booking site, we were assigned to a double and a single without anyone bothering to tell us. One small elevator for 14 floors = long wait times. L-shaped room with a single next to the door and a double around the corner, literally behind the elevator shaft. The  double bed occupant can hear muffled mechanical sounds through the night. The window A/C unit is literally at the foot of the single bed so that it blows directly on the person sleeping on the single, and the cooled air doesn't effectively reach around the corner to the double. Room was small and dark with inadequate space for open luggage. I had to put my carry-on on the bed. Bathroom so tiny that only one person could stand in it. No tub, shower only. Hook to hold clothing missing on door, and shelf above sink too narrow for a normal sized toiletry bag, so you would have to use toilet seat as a storage area or go outside of the bathroom to use the desk. No plug-ins on top of desk for chargers, only on the nightstand next to the double (no room for a nightstand next to single). I had to crawl under the desk to plug in my laptop. Average hotel breakfast (included breakfast is rare in NYC) but the dining room is insufficient for the number of people that it needs to accommodate. It was standing-room only depending upon the time of arrival. The rep in the morning (Keith) is VERY nice and was apologetic. They did discount the rate by a small amount (@ 5%). In NYC if you are looking for budget accommodations, small rooms are to be expected. However the experience was so uncomfortable that in the future we'll trade the UWS location for other options in midtown where more efficiently designed spaces can be found in the same price range.

title: délabré et bruyant
text:
2 nuits dans le cadre d'un circuit et très déçue !
Plafond salle de bains rouillé et tombant
climatisation en panne
sur bord de route mal isolé et bruits de camions la nuit donc difficile de dormir
petit déjeuner groupe mélangé avec les hommes d'affaires et les particuliers donc très mal organisé et long (30 mn d'attente)
contenu petit déjeuner sommaire
serviettes de toilettes déchirées ou de propreté douteuse
environnement pas très fun et loin de new York

title: Great location!!
text: Great location!!! Nice and quiet street right near the park. Walking distance to great restaurants. Subway around the corner. Hotel staff was very nice. Great breakfast in the morning. Very clean and family friendly.

title: Great location.  Helpful staff.  Small rooms.  Single slow elevator.  Decent breakfast, but breakfast room crowded.
text: The staff is friendly and helpful, especially Keith.  Rooms are small even the king room we had this time.  Prior visit we had a queen room which was not much bigger than the bed.  Hotel is in a great UWS neighbohood on quiet 71st Street.  Breakfast is typical hotel complimentary fare, but stays well stocked.  The breakfast room is small crowded and has no windows.  Rates are modest in comparidon to nearby hotels.  Would stay again.

title: ABUSIVE PRICE AND VERY MEDIOCRE SERVICE FOR EXTENSION
text: I have my grandmother in a disable room. Front desk offer very mediocre and abusive service and rates. We were there already for a week, the room was awful small for a disable. Bathroom awful odor.  Second time the prices were abusive different per day, we tried to extend the time, it was OK, later they say was reserved when already we have requested and then we had to change room smaller and more money. Ridiculous!!! Abusive!!!

title: Desepcionado
text: Habitaciones muy pequeñas y mal servicio electrico por el precio que se pago. Por favor especifiquen esos detalles cuando alguien esta buscando hacer una reservacion. A mi me dijeron que no podian hacer nada por los problemas que tuve y me llevo una mala impresion de ese hotel y sin ningun motivo para regresar a hospedarme ahi.

title: NIGHT AT QUINTIA  HOTEL CENTRAL PARK NEW YORK
text: DECEPTION : A night reserved for three people, very small room, clean, bedding nickel. a double bed plus a single bed, no separate bed and in addition air conditioner installed directly at the foot of the bed very noisy and cold directly on the body. Window windows very dirty, no daylight in the room ...

title: Central suites 32 ramblas catalunya
text: We stayed in the apartment central suites 2 bed apartment, we thought it was home from home you had everything you needed shampoo body wash,toothbrushes etc,orange juice milk and a mini bar very good prices, bed very comfortable  and shower,air con which is important and has a balcony,would recommend these apartments,very good location and nice restaurant and supermarkets also good for metro

title: Ideal spot.
text: Ideal for families on vacation. Staff is attentive. Rooms are clean and bathrooms are OK. Location is close to restaurants and Central Park. Computers in lobby are useful. Check in/out was quick and accurate.

title: Vecera v NYC Šturovo
text: Objednane burgre boli  podavane na stylovom paletovom podnose,chutovo to bolo perfektne a vyborne sme si pochutili.Capovane pivko uz bolo bonus.Vecerali sme priamo v tepne mesta za horuceho vecera ,hodnotime velmi pozitivne.

title: Passabile
text: Hotel situato a 2 passi da central park e dalla metro, non dettagli trascurabili. Problemi invece per la grandezza della camera, che è davvero piccola, in 2 con un mio amico non siamo riusciti ad aprire le valigie se non sopra il letto. Colazione buona, anche se la sala era molto piccola, in una settimana un paio di volte sono stato costretto a rimanere in piedi, comunque sia, tutti difetti trascurabili durante il soggiorno nella grande mela.

title: Stay like you are living in NYC
text: My daughter and I came to New York City to play. This property is located in a perfect Central Park West neighborhood that is walking distance to the subway, Lincoln Center, museums, dance and art studios, Hell's kitchen, and convenient neighborhood  shops.  Additionally, a daily complimentary breakfast was ready to give us energy for our long, fun days.....of course, Central Park is just a few steps away. Time Square, the Broadway theaters, China town, Greenwich  Village, and Madison Square Garden was a simple and short subway ride.

title: Para dormir y ducharte
text: Las habitaciones doble son muy pequeñas y el baño es básico. El desayuno es... bollería congelada, hamburguesas y huevos cocidos. La fruta no tenía buena pinta cuando había. El café y el zumo... muy americano. Pero la atención del personal muy buena!!!

title: Birthday weekend
text:
This hotel is located in a perfect location in Morea town. The staff are friendly and very accommodating! Christine checked us in and helped us access our discount card in line so we got the discounted date for our stay.
Sadly, their rooftop was closed for renovations.
Will have to return when the renovations are complete .

title: LaQuinta Review
text: The hotel was located in a really great spot kind of hidden in the middle of an off street lined with beautiful brownstones. Upper west side park entrance was within a 15 minute walk. Trader Joe's around the corner, plenty of restaurants within walking distance.  The desk manager "Keith" was absolutely fantastic, He went above and beyond to make out stay really great.  The breakfast was not very good at all,  cereal was stale, eggs were still somewhat frozen,  hash potaoes were not cooked completely but I felt so bad for the 1 staff member trying to handle the tiny dining area AND food by her self.   Bed pillows too small, like a 1/2 pillow size or couch size pillow. Bed was comfy though

title: Small and cramped..Great Staff and location
text: Very tiny rooms and very cramped. The Hotel listed our room as suitable for 3 people. I think 1, or 2 people at the most. The staff was wonderful! They were very helpful and accommodating. They kept our bags while we went site seeing.

title: New York rookies
text: Dated and tiny suites need more attention. Location was very good and the staff were very friendly and helpful . AC unit needs to be relocated it is right at the foot of one bed and blows directly onto the occupant .

title: Summer Vacation with kids
text:
I stayed here with my two sons for 4 nights. Overall a good experience. The biggest positive is the location...it is just a great location. Next to Central Park and not too far from the subway and museums. Next positive is the price...in relation to the other options. 

It’s tiny, cramped, very busy, and not much in amenities but still a good experience. We drove here as part of our east coast vacation and parking was nearby and convenient. Hotel validation saved something like 35 to 40 %.  

Again...overall good stay and I would do it again.

title: Good
text: Ottimo in tutto ogni volta che vengo qui è sempre una sorpresa piacevole ..consiglio a tutti..il migliore in assoluto a new york city..a natale ci torneró e spero di avere altre sorprese positive..la quinta inn & suites di new york city è come fosse casa

title: Enjoy Central Park
text: Hotel is place next to Central Park in an awesome location inside a very calm street. Staff is very warm. I really enjoyed my stay. Breakfast was really varied, I loved those self-made waffles! To be recommended

title: Substandard La Quinta Inn
text: Reminded me of a hostel w/ private bathroom.  Cramped room, inadequate elevator for narrow several storeys.  Location is good to Central Pk. subway.  Nothing else to say.  Pizza place, Trader Joe's, Dakota.

title: Bonita zona y limpio. Mejoraría el desayuno
text:
El hotel es limpio, está en una bonita y tranquila zona, la cama es cómoda, la señal de wifi buena. 
El desayuno poco variado. Los bollería no es buena. Las habitaciones pequeñas, la bañera pequeña pero limpia. la atención del personal normal. 
En general es un hotel para ir y estar el día visitando New York. Repetiría

title: Great location
text: LaQuinta NYC Central Park is in a great location, near Central Park and many museums. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean. The breakfast is hardy with many different offerings. The rooms are a bit small, but only entirely manageable.

title: Bello!!
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per 9 notti e seppure la stanza non sia grandissima la nostra permanenza è stata ottima e ci tornerei di certo  . Impossibile non sottolineare come la stanza fosse sempre molto pulita , letto comodissimo e personale gentilissimo .inoltre si trova di fianco a Central Park in una posizione abbastanza  comoda per visitare New York .

title: Miserable
text:
The air conditioner does not work at all even enough to cool this microscopic room. Pillows are lumpy, sheets are rough.  Paid extra for queen size bed. Their queen is barely a full. Paper thin walls, hear my neighbors 2 doors down! 

Normally I love La Quinta. In Manhattan, I just hope I can sleep.  There are lots of places for this price that are better quality in Manhattan. Come on La Quinta, you can do better.

title: Location location location
text: Stayed at this hotel based off of price and location expected a small room, so no surprises. What we did not expect was a very kind and considerate individual named Keith, working the front desk. He was a font of knowledge about activities and dining options gregarious and friendly made us feel at home. The individuals in charge of housekeeping were also very efficient and customer oriented in particular a young lady named Guadalupe who assisted us in a messy situation. The people made the difference for us it was a great stay.

title: Undelivered Room and Overcharged Price
text: As a husband who was taking his PREGNANT wife out for her 30th birthday, I specifically paid for and needed a king bed.  I was not notified in advance, nor was I notified when we dropped our bags off and tried to check in early.  I was told when we can back to check in, at which point, it was too late to book another hotel that could satisfy the simple request of providing a king bed.    This hotel discounted me $25 dollars to the current rate for a full bed, but upon checkout I was not discounted and was charged for the king bed. I had to check the bill and notify the staff that while they're good at underdelivering on the room, they still billed me for the king bed that I did not receive.  Overall very, very disappointing.  I will not be coming back to this hotel and will avoid La Quinta Inn's in general.

title: Very Good Option for Upper West Side Manhattan
text: This hotel was exactly as advertised and extremely convenient for access to the Upper West Side of Manhattan and to Central Park. The rooms are small but comfortable and the breakfast is the same as all other hotels at this price range. Overall it was a very reasonable, clean and convenient hotel.

title: Our disapointing hotel stay.
text:
The room was very small containing only a queen size bed & dresser. We had to open the suitcase on the bed as there wasn't enough room on the floor. It didn't fit into the tiny closet so we had to store it vertically in a corner. The room was so small that a chair or small table would not fit into it.
The bathroom had a pedestal sink but no countertop or cabinet for our things. 
The hotel has 14 floors, but only one elevator (in total) and was out of service for 6 days of our stay!
There were no laundry machines for guests - had to go outside to a commercial laundry.
We liked the location and the hotel provided a hot, varied breakfast for guests that was included in the cost of the room.

title: great hotel for the price
text: The room and bathroom were both very clean. Could not beat the location and the car service that was available was very helpful.  The breakfast could use some upgrading but for free it was just fine. The air conditioning works great.

title: Esta bien pero habitaciones súper pequeñas.
text: El hotel es confortable, limpio, la atencion es buena. Pero la habitación es super pequeña. El desayuno esta bien. En líneas generales, es aceptable pero no vale lo que sale. Por esa plata conviene un mejor lugar.

title: Great stay
text: Had a great stay in a great location, just around the block from yhe Dakota and Strawberry Fields memorial. Also recommend the Turkish restaurant across the street. Seems to be a recently converted building.

title: Great stay!
text: I had a delightful stay at La Quinta New York City Central Park. The staff was excellent! Great customer service! Great location. NYC MTA Subway and buses were around the corner from the hotel. "No hassle" speedy check-in. Great breakfast.

title: Pas sérieux !
text:
Nous avons séjourné à la quinta il y a 2 semaines. L’hôtel est vraiment bien situé et plutôt correct . Le seul problème que nous avons rencontré c’est l’ascenseur . En effet nous sommes arrivés le dimanche soir à minuit et là on nous annonce que l’ascenseur ne fonctionne pas ...  bon ... sauf que nous sommes au 14eme étage ! 
La personne a l’accueil nous propose une autre chambre, mais plus petite avec des lits jumeaux . Nous préférons garder notre chambre ( la plus grande de l’hôtel, donc la
Plus chère , et surtout un lit long size, mon mari mesure 2 mètres ... ) . La personne de l’accueil nous dit que de toute façon l’ascenseur sera réparé demain ...  il ne nous propose pas d’aide pour monter nos bagages . Après 10 h de voyage c’est un peu rude ! Mais c’est pas grave nous sommes heureux d’être à New York . 
Le lendemain pas d’ascenseur mais bon il est tôt ...  
visite de New York toute la journée , on marche, on visite !!! 
Arrivé l’hôtel vers 21h toujours pas d’ascenseur après 22 kilomètres à pieds c’est rude ...  
Le lendemain même histoire alors que tout le monde nous dit demain !!! 
Bref jusqu’à notre départ nous avons dû monter les 14 étages à pieds . Cela a vraiment perturbé notre séjour car à la fin de la journée nous n’avions absolument pas le courage de les monter deux fois. Nous avons donc  passé nos journées dehors et ne sommes rentres que pour nous coucher . Donc pas de sortie nocturne .
Au moment de quitter l’hôtel un des employés nous a promis un remboursement de 15% visible le lendemain sur notre compte mais cela n’a pas été fait ! 
Nous sommes très déçus et ne reviendrons pas .

title: LA QUINTA CENTRAL PARK
text: Very small rooms and only one small elevator available. Employees are very helpful and provide good information. The continental breakfast is very limited, but gets the job done. Good 20 minute walk to Times Square

title: Buena relación calidad-precio en New York
text: Después de buscar mucho, he encontrado este hotel con una habitación con cama King size, incluyendo desayuno en el precio, y sin meter un pago adicional por noche como si hacen muchos hoteles. Si es cierto que no esra en el centro, pero son 25 minutos caminando o 5 minutos en metro q esta justo al lado. El personal del hotel muy amable, sobre todo la gente de la limpieza que era encantadora. la habitación muy limpia. Otro punto positivo es que nos guardaron las maletas el último día hasta que nos fuimos al aeropuerto, y no nos cobraron nada. Lo único negativo que hay solo un ascensor y alguna vez estuvimos minutos esperando, pero en general muy bien y repetiria sin duda. También es muy útil que te dan en el checkin un mapa de bolsillo pequeño, muy práctico.

title: Keith is the best
text: My husband, mum and daughter stayed at LaQuinta New York and had a great experience. The location was good, the rooms were clesn but mostly Keith at the front desk was amazing. We had some issues with my credit card and Keith was able to reassure me and ensure that my family had a great stay while I dealt with my bank in Australia.  You're the best Keith. It's a pity their  new hotel isn't as good as LaQuinta

title: Upper West Side side street gem
text:
La Quinta Inn Central Park is located on a quiet residential side street right next to Central Park. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping, Central Park, and the Beacon Theatre, it is a great location. 
The hotel itself was very clean. The bed was really comfortable. Housekeeping was always working on common areas. The breakfast room had all day coffee and tea which was really nice. 
The front desk was very pleasant, with the exception of Keith, who was above and beyond! Always friendly, great eye contact, recommendations and help with anything needed, even bandaids! He made a good choice of a hotel into a great experience! Thank you, Keith!

title: Great Location!
text: Great location in Central Park West and very close to all of the museums around the park and the fine arts facilities such as Lincoln Center, Jazz at Lincoln Center, NY Ballet, etc. Our room was very small, with a full-sized bed, which took up most of the space in the room. But everything was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. As one other review mentioned, we did not have elevator service for a few days, but luckily our room was only on the fifth floor. I'm not going to ding the hotel for that. If you plan on spending lots of time at the hotel, this is probably not the best place, but if you are looking for a reasonably priced (for Manhattan) place to rest that is close to lots of the sights, this is a good choice.

title: Never Staying Here Again
text: Awful room. Extremely tiny. When I opened the door I was very close to walking right out and finding another hotel to stay at. There was someone else's hairs on my bed. I felt so claustrophobic in this room. The wifi also didn't work.

title: It's New York!
text: So if this is your first time going to New York, this is a GREAT location.   It's a few blocks from the metro and Central Park. New York doesn't have the ability to spread out so they have to go up. That being said, EVERYTHING about this hotel feels confined. The halls are narrower, the rooms are smaller, (BUT the bed is SO comfortable!!!.and honestly your not going to spend that much time in your room), the dining area is cramped, and the elevator is a two person and luggage or 4 people with out luggage. But it's New York, and this is a fact of life there. The worst part of our room was the lack of mini fridge and the crazy small (3foot long 2 foot wide) excuse of a tub. The staff was very nice and knew a lot about the area.   The best part of this hotel was the location. It's crazy close to so many things.  The worts part of this hotel was the elevator broke down half way through our trip, and still hadn't been fixed on the day we left. Thankfully my husband and I are in decent health and where only on the 5th floor. But we would have been looking for other lodging options if we where any higher.   Honestly, for our next trip, now that we know how the metro system works, we'll stay out of town a bit for a cheaper price and a larger room.

title: Perfect for West Side Museums
text: This was a great choice.  The location is perfect (perfect!) for tourists who plan to visit museums, walk through Central Park and experience a different flavor of NYC one can enjoy on the Upper West Side.  The rooms are small, but they reflect value.  We could not obtain a better price for our weekend stay. Our vacation intent was not to linger in the room, yet it certainly was tidy and had every single thing we needed. The room was quiet (9th floor) and we slept soundly (never even heard the baby next to our room).  As guests, we were among many families staying here.  Also, among our fellow guests were a great showing of Europeans.  This is pertinent as we found this hotel to be similar to many in Europe.  Small, compact and efficient.  The breakfast is a huge bonus.  Not fussy, but a nice extra.  Front staff very kind, friendly and helpful.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.  No valet, parking next block over. Quiet street.

title: Confortable
text: Muy buena ubicacion, cerca de central park y estaciones de metro. Desayuno variado y habitaciones aunque pequeñas bien aseadas y camas muy comodas. Personal muy atento aunque en la recepcion no hablan español.

title: Call before you check in -- otherwise you may find out there is no elevator service for six days!
text: So we showed up today at this hotel to check in -- a little before three.  It is only at checkin that we were told the elevator was down and would NOT BE BACK IN SERVICE BEFORE MONDAY!  (Today is Weds). Now, the clerk was apologetic and tried to help us find another hotel.  (I know the area, so I booked another hotel myself).  Problems can happen BUT WHY DIDN"T SOMEONE CONTACT US BEFORE we wasted cab fare, etc to get there.  We wasted money and when I told the front desk person that notice would have been nice, I heard her starting to call people who had reservations. There was a sign posted about the elevator when we entered the hotel so it wasn't something that had happened just at that moment.   Just not acceptable.  LaQuinta, you made  us waste money and time.  The only room they could give us was on the 7th floor.  And I asked twice to have my charges refunded.  And if they aren't, I will be even more dissatisfied than I am right now.  I have zero confidence that this will be taken care of, given what i experienced there.  Never, ever again.

title: Fun in the City
text: The location is awesome but the rooms are the smallest I’ve ever seen. I’m talking 10 by 10 with 2 twin beds. The elevator could only hold 4 people so you will have to take the stairs a lot (we were on the 6th floor). Perfect for people on a budget trying to experience New York without breaking the bank.

title: What a gem!
text: The staff and accommodations are top notch. The location is excellent being close to all the upper west side attractions. A walk or run in Central Park is just a hop away. Very close to some of the best restaurants in the city on Columbus ave. Lincoln Center is a 10 mins walk.

title: Klein, aber vollkommen ok!
text:
Mein Mann und ich haben fünf Nächte in diesem Hotel übernachtet.
Die Zimmer sind klein, aber vollkommen ausreichend ausgestattet und sauber.
In unmittelbarer Nähe zum Central Park gelegen, bietet es großartige Möglichkeiten, die Stadt zu entdecken.
Das Personal ist freundlich und das Frühstück vollkommen ok.

title: Great Hotel
text: Hotel & my room very clean, didn't have that chemical smell of cleaning products.Great location for Lincoln Center, Central Park, Met. museum & Natural History museum. Plenty of places to eat one block away on Columbus Ave.

title: great hotel with great location
text: The staff is top notch; the location is great (near the park and 12 mins walk to Lincoln Center). The beds are very comfortable! The breakfast has a nice selection and is also replenished quickly.  The corner king size rooms have nice views (the higher floors have two views, the lower floors southern exposure)

title: Perfect Location and GREAT staff!
text: Our son graduated from Columbia University and we needed two rooms for my husband and I and my Mom.  The queen rooms were small (this is NYC), but they were clean and the beds were quite comfy.  We were right between Central Park West and Broadway, easy access to the subway and tons of restaurants.  The best part of our stay was the front desk manager Keith.  He was knowledgeable about the area and made sure we had everything we needed.  If you need this location, I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location, good accomodations
text: Great location on Upper West Side, right across Central park, near subway station, close to museums, restaurants, local shops. Quite and safe neighborhood.   The rooms are small but clean, breakfast is average.

title: Great location and wonderful service
text: A block from Central Park and close to a few Metros but just a great experience all together as all of the staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. Breakfast was fresh every morning and I can't wait to stay there again!

title: Very convenient and reasonable
text:
A great location if you have any interest in this part of Manhattan.  Good bus service very close, goes up and down Central Park West.  Unfortunately the 72 street subway station (B and C) is closed for repairs until July (2018).

Newish, very nice, very clean and neat.  Good free breakfast.  The room is small (no surprise).  Bed was good.  No refrigerator or microwave in the room.  Good wifi.

There were two small problems in the room that the staff fixed very promptly.  Would definitely come back.

title: Very Quiet and Nice Hotel In NYC
text: The hotel is very clean. And Quiet. Ideal Location in upper west side. The subway station at 2 minutes walk. And 10/15 minutes walk from columbus. Really Nice Staff. Breakfast simple but good. We had the king bedroom and it was perfect.

title: Quick trip to see daughter perform
text: The rooms are TINY but I guess that is what to expect in NYC. The location was awesome. The staff was super friendly. If you want to see NYC on a budget, this place is great. Breakfast was a bit crowded but good.

title: Great location with excellent staff!
text: This hotel is in a great location to family and the staff was professional, friendly and kind!  Keith is awesome and made the experience wonderful here.  We will definitely be back on our next trip to the Upper West Side!

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Rooms are small, clean, and functional.  Staff are efficient, friendly and helpful. Location is ideal, adjacent to Central Park and the neighborhood has everything you need with great eating places nearby.  We stayed there for 4 days as we explored the city. Breakfast is included and met our needs. Would recommend for couples.

title: Horrefull
text:
The worst breakfast that I ever had : no place, distugsting potatoes / eggs / pancakes 
No duvet cover 
No Daylight in the room
Very expensive (>250$/night)
The only positive point is  the location (2minutes from central park)

title: Ottimo hotel
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in aprile, io e mio marito. Camera al 14esimo piano, molto spaziosa e pulita. Eravamo preoccupati dalle recensioni di altri utenti, che lamentavano le dimensioni ristrette, ma nel nostro caso pienamente soddisfatti. Bagno con vasca, cassettiera ampia e  piccolo armadio addirittura con asse e ferro da stiro! Letto king size. Pulizia impeccabile. Ottima la colazione dalle 7 alle 10, con il classico stile americano di uova,hamburger e patate, ma anche yoghurt e latte freddo. Succhi,the e caffe,marmellate,toast e tutto il necessario per cucinarsi i waffel.Banane e mele sempre a disposizione. L'area colazione è piuttosto piccola; capita di dover attendere per sedersi, ma andando alle 7.00 era solitamente libero e al massimo abbiamo dovuto aspettare una decina di minuti. Sono convinta che avere la colazione inclusa è un grosso vantaggio, perché evita di correre subito fuori per farla, con ben poche varianti di scelta. Come leggevo da altre recensioni, in effetti avere un solo ascensore per 14 piani implica attese,ma non è stato un grosso problema per noi. Forse è da considerare nel caso si viaggiasse con passeggini o con persone anziane.Posizione fronte central park è da favola, metropolitane vicine. Non abbiamo trovato supermercati nei dintorni, forse perché è una zona prettamente di hotel. Oltre al meraviglioso Central park, l'hotel si trova a due passi dal Dakota building. Al piano terra si trova un'area business con pc e stampante, usata per fare il check in al ritorno. Possibilità di lasciare i bagagli anche dopo il check out. Dispenser a pagamento per bibite e snack. Sicuramente da consigliare per un viaggio a New York!

title: Нам понравилось
text: Отель нас заинтересовал в первую очередь ценой и превосходной локацией - минимум два раза в день есть возможность прогуляться по главной достопримечательности Нью Йорка - последить за птицами, белками, утками и енотами. На завтрак в отеле лучше не расчитывать - выбор между хлебом, хлопьями и, если повезёт, ветчиной или скрэмблом. Запасайтесь завтраком в ближайшем Whole Foods. Номера небольшие (бывает гораздо хуже), но кровать очень удобная, в номере чисто. Есть утюг и небольшой шкаф. Интернет бесплатный, стабильный и скорость порадовала. Готов вернуться сюда ещё раз:)

title: great staff and location
text: Just two blocks away from subway at Amsterdam Ave. (the closest 72st and 5th Ave Subway Station will be close from May to October) Nice and quiet surroundings. Next to Central Park West entrance. Good STANDARD continental breakfast. Warmest staff ever!

title: Enough room for one (on a budget)
text: Location is great! I needed a room on a budget in a pinch and for $99!(plus tax) the room was small—less than 2 feet between bed and dresser... w tv. Closet was about 1 foot wide. Bathroom clean. AC loud and right on the bed. Could not imagine couple checking in before me for a week... but cheap and amazing location.

title: Mai più. Da evitare
text: Stanza tripla grande quanto una singola. Bagno piccolo. Impossibile sedersi sulla tazza, causa lavabo sporgente. Doccia con tenda. Teli piccoli e sporchi. Moquette lurida. Appena entrati in stanza abbiamo trovato calzini sporchi di precedenti ospiti. Nei cassetti mosche morte. Da chiudere.

title: Très bien situé
text: L'hotel est idéalement situé, près de Central Park, de 2 stations de métro, de plusieurs musées importants et de lieux de restauration. Les chambres pourraient être un peu plus grandes. Le breakfast est assez bien (en particulier on apprécie les gaufres)

title: small hotel in a lovely location
text: Hotel is in a nice location near Central Park and Lincoln Center--near many restaurants on Columbus Avenue.  It's situated among brownstones in a nice area.  All of the hotel spaces were very small--lobby, breakfast area, elevator, and hotel rooms.  The rooms could only accommodate a queen bed and a small square hassock--not even enough room for a chair!  The staff were very friendly.  Breakfast was a simple spread.  There was only 1 elevator so the wait was very long.

title: New York gem
text: I had read all — most all — the reviews of this La Quinta and decided to stay because of the proximity to an event that I was attending. The hotel is small and compact, but absolutely comfortable and accommodating. Any requests netted a quick response and though we were delayed only a few minutes at check-in the wonderful young lady at the desk remembered and provided us with wonderful service. I opted for the corner room with queen bed — great choice for small extra cost. If you want the “five-star” treatment you can walk around the corner to the big buck hotels. This is comfortable and relatively quiet. It is easy walking distance to everything —- Broadway Mall ... Lincoln Center and Central Park. A taste of the Upper West Side on a retirement budget.

title: Bon rapport qualité/prix
text: Hôtel très bien situé, proche de Central Park, des lignes de métro qui déservent très bien les lieux les plus fréquentés, des restaurants/épiceries ouverts jusque tard voir 24h/24h. Le quartier est sûr et agréable. Le personnel de l'hôtel est très agréable et sympathique. Le petit déjeuner proposé est très correct et bon, il est vrai que la salle est petite mais arrivé tôt permet d'éviter les inconvénients. La chambre était faite tous les jours, et les serviettes changées aussi tous les jours. Le point négatif: la chambre et la salle de bain très petite. Nous on y avons passé un agréable séjour. Je recommande.

title: Location
text:
Clean hotel, friendly staff and great location to Central Park and subways.
Breakfast was sufficient. Dining area is small and had to wait each morning for a table to sit at. Staff very helpful and willing to assist with tourist questions.

title: Good For What It Is
text: The location is fantastic and a short walk to the park. The construction on the building is a bit uncomfortable for those who are facing it. The rooms are quite small, but offer all the amenities needed.

title: La Quinta New York City Central Park - 04-21-2018
text: Good location, but rooms are extremely small.  Paint and wall paper is peeling.  Electric window shades didn't operate.  Stayed two nights; wake-up call on the first morning was 2 hours+ later than requested; wake-up call on the second morning didn't happen at all.  No refrigerator or microwave.

title: Best Hotel Near Central Park
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the LaQuinta NYC Central Park Hotel.  It was PERFECTLY located.  A good size, and very accommodating.  Free breakfast and Wi-FI.  Steps to great dining, subway, museums, and to The Park.  Loved every minute!

title: Not worth the money
text:
When we paid $200/night for this, We assumed we'd have a nice room with everything alright. It wasn't like that. The housekeeper woke us up at 0830 by walking and making noise outside. She also called us To the room To ask if our room Will be cleaned that day. We were sleeping. The toilet seat was leaking. There were two conditioners, but no shampoo. The room was so tiny, We actually had To go out everyday cause we couldn't spend the Day in. The walls were thin and we could actually hear people's snoring etc. WiFi was bad and signed me out all the time. The breakfast was average, but something was out all the time.
Anyway the staff was nice and helpful. 
The location was great, too. We were driving around east coast for two weeks and had also cheap rooms, like $60 but they were better than this. If you ask $200 for a room, it should be at least good, even if the location is the Best part of your hotel.

title: Horrible
text:
Dirty, bad service, breakfast room small, queue for the breakfast, receptionist not cooperative. 
When we arrived in the evening the receptionist was not cooperative. He 
Was not keen to indicate where the garage was while we booked the garage because of the discount granted in relation with our stay at La Quinta.
The room was dirty and the heating was not functioning.
The breakfast is served in a very small room so that there is a queue in the morning and nobody from the hotel to regulate this. Some people having finished their breakfast were still occupying a table of 4 persons and nobody from the hotel to invite them to let the table to persons making the queue.

title: New York 2018
text:
Rooms average size but tricky for 2 adults with 4 cases 2 of which were large. Once cases are open floor space limited. 
No mirror in sleeping area, unable to use hair dryer in bathroom and couldn't see what i was doing and no where to balance a compact mirror. 
Getting out during the daytime when housekeeping on duty difficult due to the fact they use the same lift as guests. Being on the 10th floor needed lift but often waited up to 10mins for an empty lift.

title: Vacaciones 2016
text: El hotel es perfecto para el que quiere conocer Nueva York y necesita algo céntrico, muy buena ubicación, y súper limpio, lo recomiendo ampliamente. Puedes encontrar estacionamiento para tu auto y yo regresaría

title: Location
text: Booked because of location near Lincoln Center. In a residential block, cab drove right pass the entrance, had walk back a block. Check in was fine. Room was small. How small was it? Had to go into hall to change my mind. Room was clean. Breakfast was okay, but ran out of food around 9:30. Good coffee. Not on my come back list.

title: Clean and great location
text: Room and hotel were clean and the location can't be beat if you are going to be working on the upper West side.  Rooms are small, but that's what you expect in NYC.  Stayed with husband in a double bed room.  Loved the neighborhood.  Walked every evening to grab pizza or food from a bakery.  Stopped by corner shop two blocks away and it had everything that we needed.  Safe and quiet neighborhood.  Great overall!

title: Super Stay
text: Recently stayed at the Central Park La Quinta - great stay - very quiet and quaint neighborhood location.  Very attentive staff - especially Keith at the front desk and all the staff that helped us during our stay.  Everyone had a smile and a good morning or good afternoon. We did the get the corner King room and loved it -- great view of 71st street.  Great location -- short walk to Central Park / Columbus Street! Elevator is a little slow and a bit of a wait -- only negative as mentioned earlier.  Will stay here the next time we are in NYC.  Great job La Quinta Central Park team.

title: very good
text:
L albergo si trova vicino central park e sulla 72st si trovano le metro A e C, se si fanno due passi in piû si raggiungono le linee della metro rossa, in quanto a posizione direi quindi ottima.
La mia camera era molto piccola ma c era tutto il necessario.
Pulita ed accessoriata, c è perfino il ferro da stiro.
La colazione è al self service, si trova caffè latte brioche oppure uova strapazzati o yogurt.
Qualitá prezzo molto buona
esito positivissimo

wifi gratis e funzionante
possibilità di deposito bagagli sorvegliato
si puö usufruire del pc e della stampante

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Friendly staff, clean rooms and great location.  The staff was very helpful and gave great recommendations.  Our rooms were small (but expected that in NYC) but they were clean. Location was close to subways, Central Park and many activities. Great Italian restaurant close by.  Enjoyed our time in NYC and our stay.   I would stay here again next time in NYC. Thank you for a great experience on our trip!

title: Buena ubicación
text: Las habitaciones muy pequeñas, la limpieza no es buena, la recepción no tiene espacio. El personal del desayuno super amable y con disponibilidad. La gente de recepción tiene un desorden en el área, tienen que cambiarles el mobiliario.

title: Pretty cool
text: Ok New York Hotels are small and this is no exception, but hopefully if you are coming to NY you are not hanging out in the hotel anyway. It is in a great location and that is important in NY. Front desk people very helpful. Breakfast is great unless you are a picky low carb guy like me..but there is a juice place down the block. :)

title: Get the corner King
text: Hotel was exactly as described in reviews we read. Overall very good. Hotel elevator, only having one, is the only negative we had. Love the quiet neighborhood the hotel is in, close to Subway and Central Park. Great staff, clean rooms.

title: À Éviter !!!
text:
Les deux seuls points forts de cette hôtel sont sa situation et la gentillesse du personnel.

Chambre exiguë ! Nettoyage des draps, oreillers et des moquettes douteux (Les premiers ne sentaient pas le frais, trou de cigarettes dans la housse de couette, et la moquette sentait les pieds !), aucun endroit pour déposer ses valises dans la chambre.

Chaque nuit nous étions bercé par le bruit du chauffage, de la climatisation de la chambre d’à côté et de l’ascenseur...

Salle de bain exigüe elle aussi, grille d’évacuation de la douche rouillée , Rideau de douche (pour l’hygiène on a vu mieux)
Enfin pour s’asseoir sur le trône, il faut éviter le lavabo…

Un seul ascenseur pour tout l’immeuble…
Salle de petit déjeuner à la capacité trop petite… Bousculade le matin pour pouvoir déjeuner avec de la vaisselle jetable ! Sans parler des poubelles qui débordent ! 

Au final trop cher payé vu de la prestation.

title: Unreliable accommodation
text: Don't book this hotel! The worst experience ever. We booked our rooms via Booking and chose to pay IN HOTEL. When we came to NY, after 15 hour flight (we came from Europe) we realized that the hotel cancelled our reservation. I couldn't believe this fact, so we came to the hotel. Receptionist, not nice at all, told us that my card was declined and Booking told them to cancel. That is NOT TRUE, I spoke to Booking already and they told me they didn't recommend cancellation. So basically La Quinta cancelled our reservation on the day of arrival and they didn't have other room for us. I absolutely don't understand how they could do that even when we chose to pay in the hotel, and this LATE? Just couple of hours before coming.. The worst experience ever. Don't book room in this hotel, you cannot rely on them and could end up without accommodation..

title: Great Choice
text: I keep returning because I love the Upper West Side location, the friendly and helpful staff, comfortable rooms and a price that doesn't "break the bank".  Central Park is only steps away and there are plenty of nice choices for dining nearby.  To get downtown the subway is literally right around the corner.  For me, it's the right place, in the right location, with the right price.

title: Una ubcación perfecta
text: Pasamos 7 noches en el hotel y la verdad es que muy bien, no esperes lujos, pero la verdad es que si lo que vas a hacer es andar como un loco por la ciudad necesitas poco más. Esta a un minuto de central park, a dos de strawberry fields, en una calle tranquila y a dos minutos de la parada de metro de la calle 72, también hay una parada cerca en el cruce de la 72 con Broadway, así que tienes opciones. Habitación pequeña pero limpia, cama cómoda y el baño igualmente pequeño, pero limpio. El personal del hotel atento y amable, tanto en recepción que eran muy agradables, el personal de mantenimiento muy profesional y la chica del desayuno que estaba siempre atenta y reponiendo. En nuestro caso, no se si en todos, el desayuno estaba incluido, desayuno normalito, tenías de bollería, bagels, muffins y tostadas, hay tostadora, y máquina para gofres. Maquina con dos tipos de zumos, no naturales, y máquina de café, americano, muy aguado, si te gusta así, pues bien. Microondas para calentarse sus cosas, hay bolsas de quaker oats que me encantan. En calientes solía haber huevos cocidos y alguna salchicha, nada espectacular. También había una nevera con yogures. Lo único negativo quizá sea el tamaño de la zona del desayuno, muy pequeña para la cantidad de gente que se acumulaba, si no ibas pronto no tenias sitio, y la verdad es que era un poco caótico. Pobrecita la chica que reponía las cosas de desayuno porque iba siempre hasta arriba de trabajo. Una buena experiencia.

title: Front Desk Staff are unbeatable
text: Although the maids leave a lot to be desired, the front desk staff are amazingly helpful!  There is only one elevator but the location makes up for it.  I love staying here and will be back without a doubt.

title: ok
text: The price was too high for what was offered. The room is very small. The price is very high. The location is good for restaurants. I would not stay here again. The entrance to the hotel is clean and tidy. The customer service is okay. I would not recommend this place to stay for the price you have to pay.

title: Pior opção de ny
text:
Já viajei várias vezes para ny e desta vez resolvi ficar no central park e para minha infelicidade escolhi esse hotel. Eu era responsável pelo checkin mesmo assim o hotel autorizou outra pessoa fazer o meu checkin (bastou ela dizer que era meu acompanhante) sem minha confirmação, conhecimento e/ou aprovação... para piorar essa pessoa fez checkin antes e o hotel debitou em meu cartão de crédito sem minha autorização???? !!!! Sim, um estranho só falou meu nome (a pessoa não tinha nem o número da reserva) e conseguiu fazer o
Meu checkin e adicionar novos itens no meu cartão de crédito. Continuando os problemas A forma de pagamento solicitada foi pagamento no hotel, mesmo assim no dia seguinte debitaram todos os valores no meu cartão.
Até o final da minha estadia nem meu passaporte ou qualquer outro documento foi solicitado. Um perigo é totalmente desorganizado. Próximo desse hotel você encontra hotéis maravilhosos pagando pouca diferença. Fujam desse lugar!!

title: Stay in NYC
text: Great place to consider for anyone who is travelling to NYC. Near to Central Park which is the best place to enjoy walking. Just 2 blocks away to the subway!! Rooms are not larger but enough to sleep. Just one elevator  =(

title: Girls Weekend
text: I took my mom to NYC for her 60th Birthday! We loved the neighborhood! So many great restaurants within walking distance. Everyone at the hotel was really friendly and helpful. We will be staying here again.

title: Great location - great room!
text: An affordable, clean hotel near Central Park and Lincoln Center. Friendly staff. We booked a "corner room"  with a King bed at 14th floor. Great view to Central Park, a quiet and cozy room. You can walk to Lincoln Center or Central Park with all the nice restaurants, theaters, shops etc. Breakfast was simple and OK (good coffee) but the space of the breakfast room was too small, because the hotel was booked out.

title: Beautiful and affordable for families near Central Park and Subways
text: I was travelling with 3 grown children ( 19, 20, 21)for our first sight seeing trip to NYC.  We secured a booking on line and were pleased with the price, location, cleanliness, friendliness of staff and the breakfast included!  The rooms are very small but lovely and clean and so close to everything and in what felt like a safe area.  Two minutes to  Central Park and subways to everywhere.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: nice spot in new york
text: the hotel had really nice room, helpful and friendly staff and it was near the subway and near central park so it was easy to access the places we wanted to visite. The only con was the breakfast room, because it was kind of small, but the food was good and a lot of variety.

title: Buen llegar
text:
El hotel se encuentra en una zona muy tranquila, a menos de una cuadra del Central Park y de dos entradas de metro (1,2,3 y B,C).
El lugar es acogedor, si bien las piezas son pequeñas, cabe todo lo que traes muy bien.
Los puntos negativos son, que cuenta solo con un ascensor y el casino es pequeño, lo que hace que ocaciones debas comer parado o esperar un poco más.

title: Great price, exceeded expectations
text: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a little concerned about booking this hotel.  Since it was almost half the price of every other NYC hotel I looked at, I decided to go ahead.  I'm so glad I did!  I personally believe that most of the complaints are people with ridiculous expectations.  We paid a little extra to get their "king corner room) because of all the complaints about the rooms being small.  This is NYC, we didn't expect a large room.  This room was more than adequate (a king bed, a desk and a small bathroom), especially since we didn't actually spend a lot of time there.  We were on one of the top floors and the elevator is a little slow, but we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes, usually less.  The breakfast place is small, but it's a good, free breakfast.  It's a half a block away from Central Park, very close to subway stations, less than a 2 mile walk to the Met, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and many other tourist destinations.  Because it's a little further away from the touristy places, it's pretty quiet.  An uber cost us about $45 to get to the hotel from LaGuardia.  All in all, I have no complaints.  I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone heading into the city.

title: Not for everyone - but okay
text: It's fine. Not horrible, not amazing, just fine. I wouldn't recommend staying here if you're planning to have more than two people in a single room, because it's true - the rooms are teeny tiny.  While it worked out okay for me, it's not best for those who have lots of luggage or are claustrophobic. What's also small is pretty much everything else in the hotel - elevator (which was infuriatingly slow and inefficient), dining room for breakfast, bathroom, shower.   I also kind of had a weird experience with the front desk. A day or two before arriving, I noticed I had a charge of $90 from the hotel already. The booking website I used said I'd be charged for everything when I checked in, so I wasn't sure where the $90 would be coming from before I was even there. When I called the hotel, they told me the charge was for incidentals and would "fall off" once I checked out. But, when I checked in, it was explained to me that it was a pre-authorization for my card and was part of the total booking fee. A little weird - maybe miscommunication/misunderstanding?  Now, despite all of that - the hotel is comfortable, quiet, and in a good location. The subway is a block away, Central Park is across the street (hence it being included in the hotel name...), and there is a Starbucks within walking distance. It's a good value for the price - but just know what you're getting yourself into before you book.

title: Great hotel!
text: We couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience. Staff was incredibly nice and accommodating, rooms were clean, location was perfect! The rooms are tiny but that's just NYC. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Great Front desk people
text: Really enjoyed my entire stay.  I came for business the first two days and vacation the second two days.  The breakfast can definitely use a face lift and the elevator could really use an upgrade but it was enjoyable experience.  I highly recommend the full time day time receptionist.  He went above and beyond and even introduced my to other guests who I had a chance to explore the city with.  It really made my trip.

title: Reasonable value for money
text: I booked a full-size room at this hotel because the rate was quite convenient.  It’s OK for just one person, as the room and the bathroom are *very* small.  My room was located on the 8th floor and facing the street so it was luminous on a sunny morning.  It was clean. I would find it a little depressing to stay in that room for more than two nights — unless you’re quite young and on a really limited budget.  People at the front desk were ok.  I went to the Metropolitan Opera in the evening, so it was great to walk back to the hotel.  The neighborhood feels safe and it’s beautiful and quiet.  So, if you’re on a budget and on your own, and you plan to go to the Opera, I would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

title: hotel review
text: hotel was in a great location. love the area. Hotel itself is average first time at La Quinta. Rooms was very small. Breakfast was no value. Crowded place dirty tables not space to seat. Food itself low .I was surprised.  Went to have coffee and be gal at Columbus Ave.

title: Nice location - don’t bother with breakfast though!
text:
The room was clean and comfortable. It wasn’t huge, but as we just needed somewhere to sleep, it was perfect. 

The hotel was well located near Central Park and about a 15minute walk from Time Square. 

There was free WiFi which worked well too. 

The only couple of negatives we had were that actually getting into the building was not very straightforward for us as my husband was in a wheelchair. We often struggled through, whilst staff wouldn’t offer to come and even hold the door open.  Thankfully, there was normally other guests around who were much more helpful. 

Also, sadly, the breakfast area wasn’t great to get into, or to actually get food in. Every time we went down there, there was no, or very little, food left and absolutely no space to move around or sit. It was hardly refilled and was like a circus! Whilst it’s nice to have breakfast on offer, we preferred to grab something out instead.

All in all, an OK hotel with just a couple of issues!

title: Small, but good for the price + Great Location!
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in Feb 2018. As the other reviews say, the hotel is very small! Our room slept 3 and there was not much space to move about, we were also placed in a room next to the elevator shaft, which created some noise but nothing too disturbing. If you are coming to New York to see the sights, you will not spend much time in the hotel room as was the case for us, which meant the size of the room did not really affect us at all (we were only there to sleep). The rooms are clean and the staff were friendly and accommodating. There is a complimentary breakfast which is basic but does the job. 

The best quality of this hotel is the location, it is within walking distance of the 1,2,3,C and E trains (all within 5 min walk) which will get you almost anywhere in Manhattan. It is also very close to central park and not far from times square (25 min walk).

Would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget as it will provide you a place to stay at a very reasonable price. If you are looking for something where you might want to utilise your hotel room a little more then I advise looking somewhere else.

title: Consigliatissimo!
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per 8giorni e ci siamo trovati benissimo, ottimo  rapporto qualita prezzo  e  posizione fantastica per visitare la  città . Non è un hotel bellissimo  e la  camera  un  po'  piccola ma  per la posizione ed il prezzo  ne vale  la  pena

title: Great location and price
text: My husband and I booked this hotel for a weekend trip to NYC. Price was great for location. Room was very small (barely big enough for the bed) and clean. However the continental breakfast is somewhat of a joke. We enjoyed being so close to Central Park and multiple subway lines.

title: Incredibly small room, bathroom, poor continental breakfast
text: The location is phenomenal but that’s where the positives end here. The room is so small that the bed takes up the entirety of the space. The bathroom is so small the door hits the bed, and the sink is so small and tilted downward that you cannot put anything on the sink or else it falls. The bathroom isn’t even big enough for one person. The continental breakfast was laughable in its variety, and there’s only one elevator for 14 (really, 13) floors which leads to wait times like you wouldn’t believe.

title: Nice location in nyc
text:
The rooms are small but clean and the location is very good in walking distance to everything.
They have fine breakfast included in the stay what’s make it easier for you if you’re jet lagged as we were. Opening at 7am!:)
Only what I don’t like was tiny bad and window facing to the wall

title: Small even for NYC
text: Queen bed room was small and heater was hard to program and get to work efficiently. Smallest bathroom ever: shower barely held my open med-size umbrella, the sink was tiny with no room to hold shaving supplies makeup or hair brushes.  TV remote missing; when staff brought one, she could not get TV to work; said probably due to heavy rain affecting wires. However, exc location near Central Park, museums, restaurants - if you can stand the above inconveniences.

title: Perfect
text: We stayed there as a family of 2 adults and I child in December 2017. The room was small, but this made it cosy and it was very clean. When outside  temperatures were below zero, it was a relief to enter a warm room. Beds were extremely comfortable and we all got a great nights sleep. Staff were fantastic ( exceptional service from reception), good selection of food at breakfast, and location..... PERFECT. A stones throw away from subway and some major attractions. Great restaurants around.. try big nicks.. typical New York style diner. Would go back any day

title: Just a few issues
text: Just to warn you that if you make a reservation through their 800 they won't tell you that 3 days before your reservation that they will run your credit card to make sure it works. If it doesn't they will cancel. They say they sent an email, never received but you think someone would pick up a phone and call and explain, yet NOPE, when I called to confirm my reservation Keith, manager, explained poorly this way of business. Customer Service, pick up a phone and call the person in the reservation, sending an email is just LAZY!! Checked in and Cynthia was great. Wore a smile and gave us some tips on where to eat. The room was clean, had one small problem but Cynthia the Great fixed it right away. Breakfast was a complete joke. We got down there around 9:30am (closed at 10am) and not much left and the young woman tending to the breakfast could careless to restock the food. So get there early cause it seems like they ration out their breakfast food. Also, if you have the a/c on and use the hairdryer you will blow a fuse. Late check out was awesome. Again thank you Cynthia for making our stay enjoyable. If it wasn't for her then I think this would have been rated lower stars.

title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
text: We decided to stay in upper west and also close to any subway station. Turned out to be that we were next to Central Park and not so far from shops and atractions. Excellent experience in La Quinta and will certainly recommend it in the future or even choose them again

title: Clean and quiet
text: I enjoyed my stay at La Quinta, it was a small room but it was located in a perfect spot, just a few steps from Central Park and it was quiet. The only problems I had was that the rooms were tiny, they had no fridge to store my drinks or food, and the breakfast is free but it was always full, there were out of food and had to wait and people were just bump you out of line and would be nice if they would refill constantly

title: Clean, comfortable, FABULOUS location
text: This hotel was excellent.  Just steps from Central Park, close to a subway stop, and the price was right (I paid around $100/night in Winter).  My hotel room was spacious (for New York) and clean.  Internet was free and the breakfast was generous and food I'd actually eat (A+ on the waffles).  The staff was incredibly friendly--even the cleaners and maintenance folks were super-nice when I ran into them.  The only downside is that the wait for the lift can be a few minutes, but I didn't mind.

title: Perfect place for short stay
text: If you are not planning to stay in the hotel except for nights - this is the place. Rooms are small but clean (except for windows from outside) and cozy. location is great - Few steps from Central Park and public transportation.

title: Buena atención y ubicación
text: Excelente la estancia en el hotel, sus empleados educados y atentos!!! La recepcionista un amor.. recomendado.. cerca de Central Park, de una estación de metro. Desayunos bien completos, café y té 24 horas

title: Great location
text: This hotel was a great find for us. It had sleeping for three. But it was small like every small.  I would travel light you have three drawers and that's all. The hotel staff is very polite and the location is amazing. Close to the Met and American history museum. We only had three days in NYC this time but had a great trip.

title: Hidden gem of a hotel
text: Excellent, friendly, and welcoming staff from the desk clerks to housekeeping and maintenance. Rooms can be small, but very comfortable. Shower had great water pressure. Love the noon checkout time. Located in a quiet neighborhood.

title: Excelente ubicación y zona
text:
Hotel pequeño pero súper bien ubicado a una cuadra del centra park y del Subway, por lo que es muy fácil moverse en el Subway a todos los paseos. Es un barrio muy tranquilo y agradable.
Las habitaciones son muy pequeñas pero tienen lo necesario y la cama está cómoda y la calefacción está perfecta. 
La presión de agua en el baño es excelente para la ducha, aunque hace mucho frío por la ventana. (Fuimos en invierno)
El desayuno del hotel incluido está más o menos no hay gran variedad y es muy pequeño el lugar por lo que la mayoría de los días o estaba muy lleno o ya no había comida. De cualquier manera es muy recomendable el hotel por su ubicación y comodidad. El personal fue siempre muy atento.

title: Location , location , Location and comfort
text: This spot is not only Central but safe. The neighborhood boasts connections to Central Park West within 1/2 block ,Columbus and  Broadway at the other end of the Block , The Met and enough fine restaurants to keep you thoroughly occupied for a week . Comfy neighborhood groceries and Bistros ranging in price and experience. The rooms are very small but so isn't the price in comparison to other local hotels. The staff is kind , hard working and always attentive. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable . Great pillows. The free breakfast is filling ( although the sausage would be better as links, the flat pieces are ...not appetizing .) An upgrade on the coffee might be worth it even if you charge by the pod for a kurig coffee maker in the room or in the dining room . Fresh fruit and yogurt , a waffle maker, cereals , bagels , donuts and other treats were great. The news was not conducive to vacation but it was a tough week for news. We really enjoyed our time there . Street view room could use wood blinds for noise but to be fair there was a women's march outside that weekend with thousands of chanting people and street clatter. I would highly recommend giving it a try if you are on a budget.

title: La Quinta West 71st, nyc
text: Great staff, clean, comfortable accommodations, incredible location, great value. We got in very early on a red eye and asked if we could check in early. There were no rooms open, so we had to go get breakfast and walk around Central Park for a while, but we were told to just keep calling back and checking. Sure enough, they got the room prepared as soon as they possibly could, and we were able to check in around noon. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom modern and clean with a nice, hot shower. The rooms are small of course, but what do you want, this is a great location in nyc for a good price. I will definitely be back.

title: Amaxing weekend's
text: It was an amazing weekend with my husband, the weather did not stop us from having a romantic walks on Central Park across the street from the hotel.eating dinner at Big Nicks pizza down the street from hotel.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
So, the room was on the small side, however the hotel was in a fantastic location, staff are lovely always say have a good time on your way out etc. I was worried about the location of the hotel being faraway however its defiantly walking distance to times square, rockefeller etc, theres also a subway station on the next street so very good location. The lift was slow however if you have patience its fine. Our toilet was blocked and they sent someone up straight away to fix it. 
We didn't have breakfast because the room was too cramped so this could be improver but I really recommend this hotel!!!

title: Good location
text: Good location in New York by central park , clean rooms, good WIfI, good breakfasts with all meals. Bad are noisy rooms, very small volume in rooms, traffic jam at breakfast (non place to seat) in the morning.

title: Avoid this place!!
text:
We stayed for a weekend to visit the city.  While the room was no bigger than a coat closet did t bother us because we were out all day walking.
We stayed here for the location and included breakfast.  What a waste!  The breakfast was TERRIBLE!!  We went down the first morning and never went back.  
Hotel also over-charged us.  I called twice requesting to speak with a manager.  They took down all my information, yet refused to correct the problem.  I ended up calling my credit card company and disputing the charges.
AVOID THIS PLACE!!

title: La Quinta Inn
text: The Hotel is located in a very good position, next to Central Park (only 5 minutes walking). The Staff is friendly and give to you all the information you need to have a happy holiday. In the hotel there is the opportunity to have a breakfast. Food is good. You can also buy drinks or food at the small shop. Overall it was a good experience to stay at La Quinta Inn Hotel.  I spent 3 nights and everything was very good. It is important the opportunity to book a taxi with fixed fee to go to the airport.

title: La Quinta Nunca Mais!
text:
Escolhi este hotel pela localização, o que de fato é muito boa. A uma quadra do Central Park West e a 2 quadras do metro.
Porém, é apenas este o ponto positivo.
O primeiro quarto que nos deram era pequeno a ponto de ser impossível acomodar nossa bagagem e ao mesmo tempo transitarmos nele.
Falamos na recepção e nos deram um quarto maior 3 dias após o check in.
O quarto era maior porém continuava com os péssimos travesseiros, não possuia cofre muito menos frigobar, sem falar nas persianas que não fechavam. Havia pouquíssimos canais de TV disponíveis.
O carrinho da camareira fica em frente ao elevador nos corredores por todo o tempo, desorganizado e obstruindo o local.
O café da manhã estava incluído na diária, porém era tão ruim a ponto de no terceiro dia não irmos mais. Todos os itens são descartáveis, tais como pratos e talheres, o ambiente é minusculo para a quantidade de pessoas do hotel, os itens são repostos muito lentamente por uma única funcionária, muito mal humorada por sinal, sem falar na sujeira do local.
No dia que nevou foi o apse! Colocaram toalhas de banho no chão da recepção para conter a água.
Quem merece destaque por tentar driblar tamanhos desencontros do hotel são os funcionários da recepção Cynthia e Keith, que são extremamente profissionais e cuidadosos com os hóspedes.
Não indico para ninguém este hotel.

title: Good location; horrible infrastructure
text: The renunciation seems to have partioned rooms into smaller and more rooms, and subsequently increasing the amount of guests. As a result the (already small) elevator is blocked and backed to a crawl.

title: Tiny airless dark room
text: Good location, clean room, but that's all it has going for it.  Room so small only one person could stand up and get dressed at a time. Furniture dysfunctional for space. No chair or desk. Tiny window on air shaft. Undersized slow elevator (half hour wait at times). Breakfast room too small, and coffee undrinkable. Room would be OK at hostel prices, but when we stayed, was being charged at full Manhattan prices.  A scandal to charge such rates for a room like the one we got. Much better choices around here if you book in time (we were stuck with this because of low availability).

title: Pre Weddinf honeymoon getaway
text: Best location, major subways within a couple blocks. Central Park down the street. Keith, the front manager,  was extremely caring and knowledgeable. So much fun. The breakfast had so many options. The room was small but perfect. Never to hot and never to cold. Very quiet as well. The value is unbeatable.

title: petites chambres mais au calme
text: Réservation de 2 chambres (double et triple). Hôtel au calme à 50 m de Central Park et proche du métro. Petit déjeuner inclus dans une mini salle. Pas exceptionnel mais complet à condition que le service suive et là, problème d'organisation. Les chambres sont très petites, sdb encore pire, glaciale, on ne peut même pas faire demi tour sur soi même. Lit contre le mur, pas des king size mais literie très confortable. Cafetière, télé. Son emplacement compense l'étroitesse des lieux et le personnel à l'accueil est très agréable et au service du client. Rapport qualité prix raisonnable

title: Très bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Super séjour passé dans cet hotel, sa proximité de Central Park et parfaite ainsi que la rue située juste derrière l hôtel qui est très commerçante. On peut se restaurer à 2/3 pas de l hôtel sans se ruiner.
Le personnel est très agréable et à l écoute des clients, le petit déjeuner mieux vaut se lever tôt pour avoir une place assis sinon vers 8h30/9h il est pris d assaut et il est compliqué de s asseoir car le local est assez petit. Les chambres sont petites mais on y reste pas toute la journée uniquement pour dormir donc pas très ennuyant , bon séjour je vous recommande l hôtel pour son prix et sa localisation.

title: Delusione
text: Avevamo prenotato una camera tripla io e due miei amici in questo hotel per 8 notti nel periodo di capodanno, visto il buon prezzo offerto e la buona posizione. Appena arrivati in hotel e dopo essere entrati in camera siamo rimasti delusi. La camera non era assolutamente come quella in foto (dove sembrava mooooolto più grande) ed era invivibile in 3 adulti e bagagli al seguito. Non riuscivamo nemmeno a passare o ad aprire la porta in maniera corretta. Il bagno era minuscolo, quando si era seduti sul water si aveva il lavandino in bocca, l'ascensore lento e soprattutto uno solo per 14 piani. Il top è stato raggiunto con la colazione: stanza minuscola che non poteva accogliere tutti gli ospiti, scelta insufficiente. L'unica cosa positiva è stata la reception che, dopo aver ascoltato i nostri problemi, ci ha aiutato nel decidere la soluzione migliore. In due persone sarebbe potuto andare anche bene, ma la camera assegnataci non era ASSOLUTAMENTE per tre adulti. Fatto sta che di 8 notti che dovevamo fare, ne abbiamo fatte solo due perché la situazione era insostenibile.

title: Awful hotel
text: Might as well have slept with the bums outside. Would have been the same temp but with more room. The windows were very drafty, pillows were tiny, heating unit did not work. Barely got in the door with our bags because the room was so small

title: Great hotel
text: Worth the price, location is awesome. Real close to Central Park, lots of cool stuff to visit in a short walk. Plenty of restaurants nearby, with great variety. The hotel breakfast is satisfying with plenty of variety and enough to fill your belly.

title: Terrible experience in NYC
text: A complete fiasco with the choice of the hotel: good location was the only positive thing. I reserved a room for three people and barely was sufficiently large to accommodate a queen size and a single size beds. It was very cold: a portable heater was plugged. Really undecorous.

title: Cozy and friendly
text:
Comfortable and reasonably priced.
Would recommend 
Friendly welcoming staff
I would use this hotel again as in an ideal location.
The only thing I wasn’t so keen on was the breakfast amenities which was in a very crowded area.

title: Excellent location, friendly helpful staff but rooms very small and one lift frustrating
text:
Rooms are extremely small with only the bed to open suitcase! Only one lift means a lot of waiting time for guests and staff going about their work. 
Breakfast room is small and very crowded.
Staff very helpful and ,location great - safe and easy to walk around, good amenities close by.

title: For NY is good quality-price hotel
text: Really nice hotel, next to Central Park and one block to the subway with a good connection. Room was small but enough for the stay, everything very clean and the attention very friendly. Only thing to improve is the breakfast room that is small, but the quantity and quality of the food is good. We have bad luck because the elevator broke at breakfast time; they told us it was am unusual event. I recommend the hotel in general.

title: VERY GOOD OPTION
text: This place was the best choice for us, the location is in an excellent place. Close to Central Park and the subway.  Staff always friendly. The only thing is the toilet seats are to small. Very nice restaurant close to the hotel.

title: convenient staying
text:
Our grandchildren live in the next block which is very convenient location to stay whenever we visit them. The last several times we stayed, our room was so tiny, it was the smallest hotel room we ever stayed anywhere, but the last stay was in queensize bed and better.
We are planning  to use it in the future visit.

title: Central Park
text: Great location rooms are small but clean the staff were very nice. I would stay there again. Breakfast was ok could have been hotter. Needed to be decorated better for Christmas maybe some lights or Christmas music.

title: excellent value in NYC
text: In a great location on the west side this hotel offers value for its cost. While the rooms are tiny, they are clean, well kept and if you request a room with windows with a view you get an expansive city view. The staff is friendly and helpful.
