title: Stay at La Quinta Central Park West
text: The hotel offered good hotel value for NYC.  I especially appreciated the location: near Central Park, a subway station, the Natural History Museum, and restaurants and shops on nearby Columbus and Amsterdam Avenues.  I especially appreciated the in-room safe.  It would have been nice to have a small refrigerator though.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Upper west side
text: One block from Central Park, subway close, great bed, variety breakfast, friendly staff.  Room was ready when we arrived which was before posted check in time.  Friendly staff.  Multiple restaurants in the neighborhood.

title: Great place to stay - I will definitely stay here again!
text: Location was perfect.  It’s less than a block to Central Park and easy walk to subway.  Neighborhood has plenty of great local restaurants and shops.  Room was small, but spotless and very comfortable.  The staff was excellent; professional and friendly.

title: Great place
text: Our room was very clean, bathroom was small but clean and our own. Hotel looked to be recently remodeled. Breakfast was great with lots of choices. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Close to Central Park and other sites. Would highly recommend staying here and I will stay here next time I am in New York.   pjs

title: Small but Clean & Convenient
text: Hotel was very close to Central Park, Subway and CitiBike.  On a quite street in Upper West Side (71st & CPW). Hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling alone (small rooms) and looking for a good value in New York City.

title: Great Location, But That's About All
text: The location of this hotel is great.  It is a short distance to the park and a nice walk to the MET.  There are good restaurants around and it is close to the Beacon Theater, which is why we we stayed there.  Our room was laughably small.  You could literally sit on the toilet with your feet in the shower and your hands in the sink at the same time.  The staff was professional, but far from friendly.

title: Small rooms , Pricey. Great customer service
text: Small rooms do not equate to a lower room rate. Breakfast and customer service was excellent!! if you can endure a room of about 90 square feet and a bathroom that barely contains one person, then this I the place for you. Price not commensurate with the quality of the room. Outstanding customer service and yummy breakfast.

title: What a gem in NYC
text: Want to see Central Park from your hotel window yet not spend a fortune on a room? The La Quinta Central Park is for you. Surrounded by such a quiet, safe neighborhood but footsteps from two subway entrances, great eats, and lots of shopping. This will be my NYC home away from home from now on.

title: Nice location, great staff
text: Staff was very personable and accomadating. Price was reasonable, nothing fancy but I didn't pay a fancy price tag either. Small elevator which which was a bit of a pain. The location was great so close to the park.

title: Be sure to shop around and watch for deals!
text: This hotel is in a great location and has great staff! Rooms very small and pricey ! I have had better deals in Times Square ! Be sure to watch for better deals and plan in advance ! We really did love the staff and they make it optional to leave luggage there until time to depart!

title: Solo Traveler
text: Small boutique hotel in a great part of the city especially for someone who is interested in attending an event at Lincoln Centre.  Great shopping on Columbus Avenue without the frantic pace of Time Square.  Good subway service to 72nd Street.

title: So so
text:
Was expensive for a very small space 
There is no closet space will not stay there again. The location is what drew me here. Area was noisy. Great little shops close by. Central Park close by. Take subway everywhere

title: 1st trip
text: Our first time to new York and would definitely recommend staying here. So close to central park, with a subway on next street and close enough to walk to everything. Want to personally thank Keith who made our trip the amazing experience it was, not only did we get to share our engagement with him but our first trip to New york!

title: NY Tourist
text: Not clean, very small rooms, phone in room not working,   and on top of that I missing shower turbant and staff showed no concern.   They had a "how cares" attitude.   Will never stay at these chain hotels.

title: Excelente
text: Muy atento y limpio, la gente muy amable y su ubicación excelente. Seguro y con muy buen servicio. El desayuno de primera y me parece excelente el wifi gratis! Seguramente volveré en una próxima estancia

title: Thanksgiving in NY
text: We loved staying at this hotel - wonderfully priced considering NY hotels - place was clean - friendly staff - we had a great time!  Will definitely use this hotel again anytime we are staying in Manhatten!

title: Relación precio calidad
text: La ubicación es perfecta es lo único valioso pero la relación precio calidad es mala el hotel está abajo de 3 estrellas, cuartos sumamente pequeños y ruidosos, baño increíblemente pequeño, un poco sucio, la atención del personal es regular.

title: Lovely small space
text: The rooms are small but they made the space beautiful with wonderful choices of bedding and furniture. Even the towel racks were upscale. Pillows were too puffy and not a lot of outlets. Overall, a wonderful location and free breakfast was fabulous.

title: Slow Elevator and Breakfast Bar Nightmare
text: The staff was the best part of this hotel as they were friendly, professional, and very helpful.  The room was clean, but the radiator was propped up by raw 2x4" boards at one end and clanged all night long whenever the heat came on.  The elevator was horribly slow and small, causing a backup at all times of day.  The breakfast room was so small and understaffed that there was no where to sit, let alone food to have as everything kept running out and the poor solo employee couldn't keep up with the demands of the guests.

title: Great locale
text: Very nice location and clean rooms. Also, very small rooms and tiny bathroom. Still, great for its location. For the money it's good value in New York City. Very easy to access points of interest and a pleasant and safe neighborhood.

title: Little gem of a hotel
text: Lovely little hotel just down the street from Strawberry Fields in Central Park and close a block away from the subway station. Had a lovely stay here and very good for the price which includes breakfast. As with most hotels in New York the room was very compact and had a double and twin bed. The beds were lovely and comfortable and we slept really well. There was everything that you needed in the room including a safe and the beds were made every day. The beds were very high so there was nowehere to actually sit in the room other than on the toilet, probably because of the extra bed, but the layout suited us. We stayed for 3 nights and all the staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Un hotel para sentirse como en casa
text:
Excelente ubicación cerca de tiendas, restaurantes, a media cuadra de Central Park West y a una cuadra de la estación de subway 72th Street.  Instalaciones cómodas en la habitación y facilita mucho tener el desayuno incluido y cafe/té disponible las 24h. 
El personal de recepción muy amable y siempre dispuesto a ayudar al huésped.  
Definitivamente lo consideraría como opción cuando regrese a NYC.

title: Treasure on the Park
text: This compact and cozy hotel perched on the western rim of Central Park could not be more terrifically located on the Upper West Side. When we travel to NYC we are doing so to visit friends/family and sight see.....little time  spent in room. Our requirements are clean, friendly, efficient, and centrally located......this is it.

title: Excellent stay
text: Our stay were very satisfied and very impressed with the friendly staff and the hot and cold breakfast selections. It was out of my expectation. The room was so quite and clean.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Warning!
text: Room was too small, no place for luggage, no place to walk, room was hot and did not have adequate air circulation from the window unit ac, room had overwhelming smell of bleach, hallway was obstructed daily by housekeeping cart and supplies, bathroom so small you can't close the door while using the sink, closet do would not close if with clothing hanging inside.

title: Great Location
text: Perfect location between Central Park West and Lincoln Center very friendly helpful staff small but very clean rooms nice amenities lovely breakfast however check the price of the room because Saturday night rate was $200 more than the Sunday and Monday night rate

title: Excellent all the way
text: Fantastic location, excellent service and a wonderful stay!  The hotel is ideally situated for exploring New York and centrally located for local attractions and sightseeing.  I would definitely recommend it!

title: Friendly, perfect location
text:
Room was spacious - for NYC. We had 2 closets. Not the fanciest hotel, but quiet and clean with strong free wifi. This location is super for popping to Central Park, seeing the Macy’s Parade, easy walk to Columbus Circle, CP Zoo, Met Museum of Art, etc... It’s a 15 minute $15 cab ride from here to 5 Ave / 51 St (Moma, shopping, Rockefeller Ctr area). 

Keith at the front desk was patient and made magic happen for guests in front of us who had misbooked their stay. Keith offered us fabulous nearby dinner options and we loved being welcomed home. Loved the apple cider donuts at the front desk!! 

Complimentary delicious Breakfast is eggs, waffles, pastries, yogurt, fruit, beverages. 

Looking fwd to returning to this location in another trip.

title: Good option to see NY
text: The location is perfect, near  Central Park and there are two subway stations in a short walk distance. Neighbourhood is safe and quite. All the greates museums (MET, Natural History, MoMa , etc)can be reached by pleasant walking.  My room was small, but cosy. The breakfast is OK to start the day. Staff is really helpful and nice. But I was lacking the refrigerator in the room.

title: Friendly Staff but that's all
text: Really friendly staff but quality of the room is terrible. AC, television and room's size issues. For the price that they offer is really terrible quality. The breaskfast was really poor and the quality of the drinks and food is so poor. I do not suggest this hotel at all.

title: Location, location, location
text: I have been staying at this property since the 90's.  The location is perfect.  Close to two subway stations and 1/2 block from Central Park.  It was remodeled this year and the changes are amazing.  The staff is the best in the city.  The employees do all in their power to make each guest feel very special.  I am looking forward to my trip this spring.  I wouldn't consider another hotel.

title: Decent stay not spectacular
text: We stayed for 3 nights in the central park location. Just like most places in new york the rooms and hallways were extremely small. Bed was comfortable and room had what you would need. Breakfast in the morning was better than what I expected after reading some negative comments about it, offering numerous warm items as well as yoghurt, fruit, and pastries with a choice of warm and cold drinks. Only issue we found with breakfast was that a number of items regularly ran out despite the employee working hard to keep everything topped up, might be a good idea to give her some help during peak breakfast rush times. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. And price was reasonable considering location. The location itself was close to all that is located near to central park, and about a 30 min walk to times square, which is close enough to uber for $10 a time if you don't feel like walking. Overall satisfied with the stay but not blown away

title: Country Mice in the Big City
text: This hotel and all of the staff made us feel totally comfortable and at home .The neighborhood is quiet and quaint with easy access to cozy restaurants ,bistros and shops. Having the breakfast included was also a great time and money saver . Our first adventure into NYC was so positive and fun we are anxiously awaiting a return trip soon !

title: Outstanding !
text:
Outstanding Service and Location!

I
Traveled from Seattle to NYC for the first time and cannot enough how impressed  I was with Hotel, Staff, Services and NYC ! Definitely would recommend La Quinta Inn to anyone!

title: hotel in ottima location
text: hotel dalle linee generali ottimo, con una grande pecca, le stanze sono veramente piccole, il resto va bene tutto per essere a new york. colazione abbondante anche se spesso c'erano sempre le stesse cose, ma comunque molto abbondante. le stanze erano abbastanza pulite, anche se poi essendo piccole diventa anche difficile pulire perchè con le valigie, noi eravamo in tre, diventava praticamente ipossibile potersi solo muovere.

title: Top-Notch Staff, Great Location to experience NYC like a local
text: This hotel is in a fantastic location.  It is close to the subway station, Central Park, and one block from the shops on Columbus Avenue.  The best part about this location is that it did not feel "touristy"- we felt like we got to do the NYC experience like locals, away from the tourist traps.  Although the room and bathroom were quite small, (hey it's NYC where real estate is precious!) it was a very comfortable stay.   A suggestion might be to add some shelving/hooks on the wall to stow toiletries in bathroom.  Bed was inviting and comfortable and the accommodations were clean.  Complimentary breakfast was great:  waffles, eggs, fruit and much more!  Most importantly, the LaQuinta staff was top notch.  Keith, who runs the desk, was so welcoming, friendly and very helpful.  He made sure our stay was wonderful!    We could not ask for any more than that.  We will definitely plan a return trip and stay here again!

title: Perfect
text: Todo perfecto. Hotel moderno, la cama muy cómoda, el baño limpio. Desayuno inlcuído bastante aceptable. El personal amable. Localización muy buena, al lado de Central Park y muy cerca de dos estaciones de metro.

title: La Quinta NYC CP: a very good hotel
text: La Quinta  NYC CP is a very good hotel with an excellent location. The overall attention is very good and some services, for instance: the breakfast and the room service reach remarkable outstanding califications

title: Our stay was comfortable
text: It is nice and cosy hotel. I could see many travellers in the hotel. Metro station is very nice. Staff and front desk staff was very supportive and cheerful. They resolved our queries quickly. Overall it was a very good experience.

title: Great Stay
text: Yes, the rooms are on  the smaller side, but it was sufficient space for me and my 2 night stay.  I can see where the bathroom size might be an issue if there are more than 2 people in the room.  There is a complimentary breakfast and free wifi, although I thought the speed was a bit sluggish. I would definitely stay here again, as the rooms were clean and the staff was friendly.

title: El lugar ideal para un viaje en NY
text: En agosto me hospedé con mi hermana en este hotel. Es un hotel pequeño y sus habitaciones no son muy grandes, pero es muy acogedor. Todos los trabajadores están atentos a tus necesidades y siempre te reciben con una sonrisa. Incluso, un día el administrador nos imprimió las indicaciones para llegar a un lugar y cada vez que regresabamos de un día largo, nos preguntaba por cómo nos había ido. Las mujeres que se encargan de la limpieza y el desayuno son las personas mas atentas!! Lo mejor de todo es si eres hispanohablante ya que muchos ahí son de Latinoamérica o Centroamérica. Es el hotel perfecto si no deseas gastar mucho en hospedaje. En nueva york casi no vas a estar en tu hotel, todo el día estas afuera, ¿para qué gastar en un hotel lujoso? Además es barrio es tranquilo y lindisimo!! recomendado!!

title: Great deal, great neighborhood
text: First time staying here. The pros: breakfast included, bed comfortable, room was very clean, staff were very nice and helpful, the price was great. The things to be aware of: old windows with moisture in between so could not see out some of them, windows needed weather stripping to prevent wind and noise getting in, there is one small elevator and it’s very slow, the shower water would shut off in the middle of showering then come back on (probably just old plumbing). I would stay again.

title: Average
text: Small rooms this was ok for over night but not for any longer,people screaming at each other during the night no staff came to sort it out so was awake most of the night when i spoke to reception i got a glazed look so just left it,over priced for what you get although breakfast was not bad

title: Looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan?
text: If you're looking for a reasonably prices hotel in Manhattan that is accessible and close to stores, restaurants and Central Park, La Quinta NYC Central Park is a great choice.  My friend and I were able to take public transporation from Newark Airport to the hotel.  We were close to the subway for trips to Midtown and Soho.  We shopped, dined and were beautified in the neighborhood.  We walked through Central Park to the eastside.  It was great.  Of course, it didn't hurt that the weather was also fabulous.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great value and UWS location
text: If you need the best UWS location and a simple, clean, well-priced hotel then this is the place for you. We spent all our time outside the hotel and used it for sleeping only. The only downside was the tiny room size (barely fit 2 big suitcases on floor next to bed and bathroom was a tight squeeze to get in and out). We had a Queen bed and next time I will go for the King bed and a little more room.

title: Just what we wanted
text: Ideally located. Quiet. A pleasant walk through Central Park to several attractions. Spotless and comfortable room (Corner King). Staff helpful - even returned to UK property which we had left behind.

title: Bed bugs
text: I stayed at the hotel on a business trip. The hotel check-in process was smooth and staff efficient however the room and amenities for spending approximately $300/night makes this a poor value. Combine this with the fact that my room had bed bugs and this was a disaster of a stay and not worth the risk.

title: Pleasant stay at La Quinta New York
text: Friendly, helpful staff. Room satisfactory, clean and bed was comfortable. Great location if you want to be out of the hustle and bustle, but close enough to walk.  Great local restaurants and shops at the end of the road.

title: Great location and friendly staff.
text:
Close to subway and on a beautiful residential street. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. 
Had a Corner King room which was perfect for us size wise. Free breakfast was a bonus also.
The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Excellent Price for the Location
text: As other reviews stated the rooms at this hotel are small but has everything you need.  The neighbourhood is so quite and peaceful and yet you can walk to central park and just south are all the best tourist attractions.  I didn't get on the subway once as I could walk to everything and ran in Central Park every morning.  Staff were super friendly and the free breakfast was sufficient.  I would defiantly stay here again.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Warm friendly staff welcome you.  Clean hotel.  Near many great restaurants and Central Park.  Staff accommodating.  Staff gave us great dining suggestions and provided menus for places that delivered food to the hotel.  Half price parking available nearby.  Would stay again!

title: The location is the only redeeming factor.
text: Very small room, as noted in other reviews. Had to kill a bug in the bathroom. Breakfast area was too small to acccimodate people, so ate breakfast in lobby. Had to walk a block to get car in $38 parking lot.

title: Localizacao excelente
text: Proximo a 3 estacoes do metro, quarto pequeno porem acomoda 2 pessoas sem problema. Nao ha frigobar no quarto mas a maquina de gelo no terreo ajuda.  Muito silencioso. Chuveiro e cama excelentes. Café da manha com paes doces e salgados, waflees, frutas, iogurte, sucos e café. Funcionarios atenciosos em especial Penny que fez nosso check in com muito bom humor de madrugada. Proxiymo a lojas e locais diversos para comer, fast food, saladas etc.  Voltaremos com certeza

title: Small and cramped
text: You must like sleeping against walls if you stay here.  The rooms are EXTREMELY SMALL!  The photos are deceiving.  At least it was a nice location.  The elevator has issues.  This is a problem if you are on the top floors.   I did not receive a requested wake up call.  I did not receive a final bill at departure because the night clerk could not generate it.  This should be a must for management to make sure staff is trained.  I'll stay in Brooklyn next time and subway it into the city.  The location to Central Park was not worth the lose of sleep.

title: Great location/ excellent Staff
text: We would definitely stay here again if in NYC. Outside of the room being a bit cramped for the size of the bed, we were impressed by the professionalism of the staff, the cleanliness of the hotel and the incredibly great location on the upper west side. We're pretty fit and everything we wanted to experience was walkable- the Museum of Natural History, great cafes & restaurants and the Met just a stroll across Central Park. Too much to describe here.

title: Clean and reasonable
text: I have stayed in much more expensive NYC hotels that were not this clean.  For the price, I was very pleased.  Great location, two blocks away from the John Lennon memorial and Central Park.  Short cab ride from most attractions, and they also have car service.

title: Small but clean - come here for the location!
text: This property used to be a Comfort Inn. The Comfort Inn had regular bed bug reports so I was really scared to stay here -- but I'm glad I did. The rate was very good, the room was clean. I checked everything for bugs -- outlets, mattress seams, furniture -- none found. There was a giant silverfish on the bathroom wall, but it didn't bother me. The thing I really disliked was the breakfast space. Really cramped. I'm claustrophobic and I just couldn't eat in there so I took my breakfast to the lobby. I've seen other reviews that complain about the size of the rooms -- yes, the room is an efficiency. It's best if you are a solo traveler because the room rates are low and you have ample space for one person. If there are two of you --  you'd better be very much in love because you'll be in tight quarters. The rooms are cute. The window unit air conditioner is odd, but I get that this is an old property. The best feature about this hotel is that Central Park is right across the street. I had breakfast in the lobby and then walked to the park for my morning exercise. Fantastic location!!!!

title: Muy bueno
text: Buena ubicación, agradable, muy buen desayuno, esmerada atención lástima que las habitaciones sean tan estrechas y los placares tan pequeños que no entraban las valijas, ante nuestra queja nos cambiaron de habitación sin problemas pero igual era muy pequeña

title: Well maintained, good value in Manhattan
text: Exactly what I needed in New York City. When you're on a budget in Manhattan, don't expect a lot of space. Room was about 12 x 12. Just enough for a large bed, chair, tv set; OK bathroom, decent closet. Strong points: CLEAN! Staff did a really good job of keeping entire facility clean. EVERYTHING WORKED! Elevator, A/C, faucets. Ice machine not on same floor, but whenever I needed ice it worked. This hotel included breakfast, the typical La Quinta DIY waffles you find across the country. Not elegant, and breakfast room crowded. But, DECENT FOOD at the right temperature. Staff had a great attitude of "how an I help you." Really good location just west of Central Park in a neighborhood rather than tourist zone. Subways downtown about a block away. Same for crosstown but to museums on east side. Would do it again.

title: Useful
text: Near to Central Park you can walk to time square and Columbus cercle all what you need it's near by restaurants bars supermarkets subways.... very quiet area small but practical rooms  covenant for couples

title: Not impressed
text: The hotel was close to the theatre I planned on attending. Besides that, it was extremely small, no refrigerator, no microwave, extremely noisey and the breakfast area was crowded and gross. The extravagant rates are apparently for the zip code. I shall not return.

title: good value for location, would return
text:
This wasn't my first visit to expensive NYC or the UWS. This also wasn't my first experience with La Quinta Inn properties which is a step up from Motel 6. I choose this budget hotel for it's proximity to Central Park (across the street), Museum Mile, subway lines (around the corner and 2 blocks away at Broadway) and grocery stores (along Broadway) for bottled water and snacks. Thanks to the 2017 TripAdvisor reviews, I knew what to expect, enjoyed my stay and would return. 

Requested a quiet room and received a room near the top floor with south and west views. Noticed that some of the windows were duct taped. Had to improvise redirecting the A/C air (window unit) so it wasn't blowing toward my face all night. If you need to soak your legs after a long day of walking/standing, the bath tub measures approximately 40" x 20". Grabbed the free breakfast around 7:30am for eggs, sausage (in warming trays), toast, yogurt and a small fruit. Get your coffee on Broadway before you hop on the subway.

title: Второй раз и снова сюда
text: Пончики на завтрак и кофе 24часа в сутки заряжают позитивом на все время пребывания в отеле. Вышел утром из отеля и сразу начал день с прогулки в Центральном парке. Да, номера маловаты, но в них возвращаешься только вечером, поспать. Вид из окна отсутствует, но это беда всего НЙ. Нас все устроило, поэтому вернулись в этот отель второй раз.  Добраться до аэропорта на метро из этого отеля не составляет труда, всего одна удобная пересадка. Спасибо всем. В следующий раз снова к вам

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
text: i travel a lot for work. the most important things to me are cleanliness and sleeping comfort. we didn't spend a lot of time in our room because, new york adventure! but our room was clean, the bed was super comfy and everyone that we encountered that worked here was friendly and made us feel right at home. we booked a corner king room and our view was lovely. this hotel is a gem.

title: Hôtel très calme
text:
Pour notre premier voyage à New York, nous souhaitions un hôtel proche de central park et proche du métro.
Cet hôtel concilie les 2 : central park à quelques dizaines de mètres à pied et métro à peine plus loin.
De plus il est situé dans une rue très calme. 

Concernant la chambre, nous avions choisi une king size, très spacieuse, la literie était de bonne qualité.
La salle de bain était un peu décevante, petite baignoire sabot, peu de place, lunette des toilettes légèrement cassée, déco vieillote...

Nous avons trouvé le petit déjeuner sympa avec du choix, salé et sucré, suffisant pour nous sans être dans l'opulence. 
Ce petit déjeuner nous permettait sans soucis de tenir jusqu'à 13h

Le personnel de l'hôtel, à l'écoute et très sympa, nous a permis de régler un problème de navette vers l'aéroport en quelques minutes (alors que l'opérateur nous avait raccroché au nez en comprenant que nous étions français).

L'hôtel n'est pas exempt de défauts, et ne conviendra sûrement pas si vous chercher un hôtel chic et haut de gamme. 

Par contre niveau rapport qualité/prix, nous avons trouvé cela très bien par rapport aux différents prix pratiqués à New York. 
(c'était l'un des moins chers lors de notre réservation) 

Bref, nous n'avons pas été déçus, et dans le cadre d'un potentiel futur voyage, nous n'hésiterions pas à retourner dans cet hôtel.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: This hotel has everything you would ever want!  Great rooms, especially the corner rooms which have a great  city view.  The breakfast included is perfect, the staff a pleasure.  The location is ideal for hitting the subway, plus easy access to restaurants and shops. Would highly recommend this hotel in NYC.

title: Give it a try
text: I agree with the other 5 star ratings. This is not a 5 star hotel but if you consider the location and personnel it deserves to be highly rated. I was skeptical about staying here due to the other reviews (and seeing other La Quintas in small cities) but from the moment we walked in the door and were greeted by Keith, we felt extremely welcomed. Keith is a great asset to the hotel as are the other employees (woman in the breakfast room, cleaning personnel) who are friendly and outgoing. The property is clean and the location on the UWS is perfect if you want to be in that location. We had a corner king and I recommend you reserve that size room as a couple. I did see a regular room as I passed by one being cleaned and YES it is SMALL. The corner king was just right. All in all, a great stay in NYC and exceeded my expectations.

title: Never saw a room so small
text:
This was cheap and I guess if I were alone the room would be OK but two people. This was not acceptable. My husband could almost touch the walls when standing in the center. I could not fit myself into the closet to get a hanger. 

While clean and it does have a free breakfast and free wifi. I will never stay here again. It was like staying in a closet. If you are claustrophobic  at all do not stay here. 

I had booked a queen room and this was not a queen sized bed. Hotels.com should be ashamed for selling something like this to the public and so should La Quinta. 

I rarely give bad reviews. I will say it was clean and new but it was unacceptable, especially at the price I payed.

title: Great location, service, and price
text:
I had a really excellent experience. From the moment I walked in, Keith made sure I had an efficient, welcoming checkin (and a free donut). Rooms are not large but very cozy, quiet, clean, and well laid out. Lots of hot water, and great shower pressure! Lots of variety for breakfast. Close to Central Park, Strawberry Fields, John Lennon memorial. Close to subway station too. Also suggest you eat at Big Nick's on W71st and Columbus. 
I highly recommend this hotel. It has all you need, and Keith is a truly nice, friendly man who goes out of his way to ensure you have a great stay. Thanks!

title: THE VERY BEST IN NYC AGAIN THE BEST
text: This hotel is the BEST IN NYC. From Mr VJ the General manager to Suzanna to Miss Penny to house keeping. From the moment you walk in the door you are "not" a guest "YOUR FAMILY" VERY CLEAN Kind Helpful Attention to detail are just a few of the wonderful things about them.  My best advice FORGET THE REST STAY WITH THE VERY BEST LQ CENTRAL PARK

title: MUY RECOMENDABLE
text:
Fuimos 3 amigas en mayo, 1 semana para patearnos la ciudad, cogí la quinta por la "ubicación" que no podia ser mas buena.. te caes de la cama y tienes una parada de metro, el dakota building, central park, el museo de historia natural.. todo a menos de diez min andando... una zona muy segura... y nada mas que ves la calle del hotel te enamoras!! Parece sacada de una serie....
Las habitaciones son muy estrechas, pero para lo que la queriamos: ducha y descanso bastante bien, las camas comodas y habitaciones limpias y sin ruido
El desayuno (buffett) bagels, donuts, goffres.. creo que alli engordé unos cuantos kg!! Que ricos!!!
La camarera y el recepcionista de 10!

title: Bottom of the chain La Quinta
text:
La Quinta Hotel on 71st Street in New York has one thing, a great location,
very close to Central Park just on the West side. This hotel has very little going. Though the staff at the front desk was fine, the lobby is not much. My room was terrible, sink size of a shoe box and shower too was way too small. the room in need of repair.
Bad furniture, one tiny elevator. Though I will stay in other La Qunita properties, never again on 71st in NY. On top of all of this, the room was expensive for what it was.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
L'albergo è molto accogliente, le stanze sono molto piccole, così anche il bagno, per colazione si possono fare i waffles, ci sono ciambelline, muffin, frittatine oppure uova sode, salsiccette, patate. Caffè, latte e succhi di frutta con i dispenser. Bello il fatto che tutto il giorno la sala colazione è aperta e si può prendere un caffè o farsi un cappuccino.
Personale gentile e disponibile. Ottima la posizione ad un passo dal Central Park. Fermata metro B e C vicino.

title: Bad breakfast area and tiny room
text: I'm used to small rooms but this was smaller than I expected.  Breakfast area was crowded and not clean enough.  Not as nice as other La Quintas. I do not recommend this hotel. The location near central park was nice.

title: Accogliente ed in buona posizione
text:
Malgrado le piccole dimensioni delle stanze e degli ambienti si è rivelata una struttura accogliente. Le camere venivano rifatte con cura ogni giorno, il personale è sempre cortese e disponibile a soddisfare le domande degli ospiti. colazione inclusa nel prezzo più che soddisfacente con selezione di dolce e salato (dalle 7 alle 10 ). 
Bagno un po' troppo piccolo, letti e cuscini comodi. 
Gradito il deposito bagagli gratuito il giorno della partenza, posizione centrale comoda per entrambe le stazioni della 72esima strada.

title: la posizione è favolosa
text: Appena arrivati in questo hotel, siamo rimasti un pò perplessi per le dimensioni ridotte di tutti gli ambienti: stanze microscopiche, bagno essenziale, hall piccolina, sala colazione con pochi posti a sedere. Nel corso dei giorni, tuttavia, il soggiorno si è rivelato sempre più piacevole. L'albergo è pulito e accurato, il personale è sorridente e disponibile,la colazione è più che sufficiente - i waffles te li fai da solo ed è molto divertente - e con un pò di pazienza abbiamo sempre trovato il posto a sedere. La location è strepitosa : ad un isolato si trova il Dakota Building (dove fu ucciso John Lennon), la fermata della metro e di fronte lo spettacolare Central Park. What else ?

title: JJ
text: When I first walked in the room, I noticed that the pillow cases look like someone has slept on them. Once I opened the blanket it became clear that they made the bed but did NOT change the sheets or pillow cases. There was human hair in the bed. That was unacceptable. I called immediately and they sent some to change the sheets and remade the bed. Make sure that the sheets are clean before you go to bed!  The wind that comes out of the fan of the air conditioner is too strong and faces directly toward the bed. There was no way to control it. I had to use the iron board to block the strong cold wind.

title: Best Location
text: A very pleasant hotel next to the park and restaurant. Location excellent. Good clean hotel with pleasant staff. Rooms were small but adequate. Decent breakfast to start the day. I would definitely book again.

title: Keith!!!!
text: I was travelling alone at 19 years old and felt very safe in this hotel which myself and my parents were happy about! 2 minute walk from Central Park which is very nice, also up the road from lots of restaurants! Keith was AMAZING, he was very happy to help and a friendly chat! Recommend this hotel a lot! Thank you Keith again! :)

title: Great Location
text: Great Location to Walk across the Park to the Met.  Close to subway and crosstown bus.  Great bed, large room, all clean.  Excellent near-by restaurants.  Great neighborhood.  Excellent value.  Not upscale, but more than adequate!  I'd stay again and recommend the 71st St. La Quinta!

title: Good value hotel in NYC
text:
We just returned from a 12 night stay at this hotel and we were quite happy there.  The people who work there are extremely nice.  There is free WiFi and free breakfast. The rooms vary in size.  Some are evidently quite small, but we stayed in a 'corner king room' and found it very good for the two of us.
It is located in the Upper West Side of Manhattan, which is less 'touristy' than Times Square.  It is right next to Central Park, which is very beautiful and very near subway stations to any location in the city.  It is also within easy walking distance to many restaurants and shops.
I would be happy to return there.

title: Very pleasant, friendly, welcoming mid priced hotel
text: Booked into this hotel at short notice after being totally dissatisfied with one previously booked. I viewed the room beforehand and despite its small size settled on it for the atmosphere, cleanliness, and the friendly and accommodating staff. My only disappointment was that there was no fridge or microwave in the room . I was able to access microwave in the breakfast room at all times. Coffee and ice on tap 24/7 and bed extremely comfortable. Very tight room and bathroom but atmosphere and staff made up for this. Conveniently located in Upper West side near Central Park and Subway.

title: Good location
text: Hotel is very close to central park. Rooms is very small. No view.  Otel Central Park'a çok yakın fakat odaçok küçüktü. Penceremiz  apartman boşluğuna bakıyordu ve devamlı klima gürültüsü vardı. Odaların ve banyonun temizliği iyiydi. Sonuçta sadece yatma amaçlı kullanılacağı için tercih edilebilir. Kahvaltı seçenekleri de tatmin ediciydi.

title: Very nice hotel
text: We stay by cuple, the stuff was very helpful any time we need them. The cleaning in the room is as should be. It' near to subway, by walking distance you can find very tastefull restaurant. The only issue is the breakfast area, it' too small for all the guests of the hotel. Definitely we would book this hotel again!!! Thanks the whole team of the front desk to be so helpful!!!

title: room too small
text: the room was too small. stayed there for 6 nights and the staff would just make the bed instead of changing the sheets. bed/matress was not comfortable...couldnt get good sleep in it. location was great. price was too much for the room size. breakfast was ok. room is ok for just ONE person, defiantly not for couples. staying in Queens or jersey would be a better option. Pluses are the central park and train location just around the corner

title: Not real
text:
The size of the room was so,small that had to stand in bed for my son to,go bathroom
Never in my life been in a room so small
Couldnt used ac because it was next to bed so to much noise and direct flow of air

title: Small but close to Central Park
text: This hotel has very small rooms and the elevators are too slow. But it is clean and provides free breakfast. If you are planning to see the city and only sleep in the hotel, this is a good choice. This hotel's proximity to Central Park makes it a great choice for its location.

title: Tight squeeze
text: The hotel itself was ok, but the room was Super small! I hope you don't have to use the toilet because the sink will be in your chest. If your a large or obese person you will not be able to use the toilet. Seriously. The room service didn't clean the room good. When we left and came back I noticed that old rags were still there and new clean cups weren't replaced. It just wasn't a good experience

title: Konumu harika..
text: 4 gece 5 gün kaldık. Otel odasına iyi diyebilirim. Central park ve metronun dibinde. Bir kaç hoşumuza gitmeyen şeylerin başında asansör geliyor. Asansör geç gelmesi ve beklenmesi, en üst katta kaldığımız için asansör bekleme süresi baya uzun olabiliyor. Özellikle check in ve out zamanında.. Fakat buna katlanmak zorundayız sanırım. Çünkü otel eski bir bina ve ekstra bir asansör yapılması söz konusu olamaz sanırım. İkinci konuda şu oldu. Booking den rezerv etmiştik oteli ve otel çıkışında ücret booking den daha fazla ücret ödedik eyalet vergisi, otele günlük birşey için bir ücret ödedik vs vs yani neredeyse 500-600 tl fazla bir ücret ödemesi oldu. Daha önce nyc de başka bir otelde kalmıştık ve hotwire den almıştık yani otele ödeme yapmadığımız için ekstra fiyat artışı ile karşılaşmamıştık. O yüzden bir sonraki sefer nyc ziyaretimde bu otelde kalmayı tercih ederim fakat booking vasitasıyla bu oteli almak istemem ve sizide bu konuda uyarmak isterim. Ayrıca kahvaltısı yeterli düzeydeydi. Klasik Amerikan kahvaltısı işte..

title: One very satisfied customer
text: I rate this as an excellent property because without exception the staff was so very nice and acommadating. Also, the location was perfect for what we had planned. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Gray hotel on park
text: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for our week long visit to New York City. It's so wonderfully located between subway stops and of course Central Park. We walked to the park every morning for breakfast! The staff is wonderful, although the elevator is slow and breakfast was always crowded. Price was amazing for the location! We would go back anytime!!!

title: Love this place
text: The staff is extremely nice, friendly and helpfull. Rooms are small but very cozy. Breakfasts are great. You can make your own waffles. Its not just dried toast like I was used to with other hotels. I love the area and how its easy to access.

title: Disappointed
text: The staff was excellent and the location was great, but the arrangement of the room was disappointing and the TV didn't work.  For visitors or tourist, the hotel is located in an ideal location.  It's near central park is in walking distance along with all types of shops and restaurants.

title: Great stay!
text: Such a wonderful hotel in a superb location.  My daughter and I walked to the Met and the Guggenheim, strolled through Central Park, and hopped on the subway to farther away sights via the convenient and close stop near the hotel. If I am ever in NYC again, I will definitely book this hotel again. The staff were friendly and helpful with advice for two small town girls from NM.

title: Great location!
text: Staying at the Upper West Side just half a block from Central Park was perfect! Beautiful residential area away from the congestion of Times Square and conveniently located 1-1/2 blocks from subway station. Plenty of markets, stores and restaurants within walking distance.  Also the Natural History museum is less than a mile away and the Met is across Central Park.  Service was great and we were warmly greeted by Keith at the front desk who gave us the top floor corner room that had a little view of Central Park and rooftop gardens.  While this is not a luxury hotel with fancy amenities, the location and boutique feel makes it ideal if you want to feel (pretend) like you live in NYC and aren't a tourist.

title: Great for short stay
text: The hotel is clean but very small rooms. It feels kind of stuffy but for a few days not bad. The front desk staff was very nice! The location is just a 1/2 block from Central Park. Very safe and local.

title: Birthday Get away
text:
Excellent staff. Great location.  Easy to commute. Good food and people all around. Friendly atmosphere.. 
Great area to live in.  Awesome attractions and plenty to do. Highly recommend area and hotel to everyone.

title: Great Location
text: I stayed at the hotel  and I would definitely stay here again. The location is perfect right next to Central Park and great access to the subways. You have a short walk to the Broadway with lots of restaurant/shopping options. Although, this is a small hotel it was perfect for our trip as we were out for most of the day. It was nice and clean and staff were very helpful.

title: Very disapointed
text:
We had to book last minute, this hôtel is more than average.
It is much too extensive for the kind oh hotel.
The breakfast more than ordinary
However liked the area but not a walking distance from Time Square , etc

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: Love staying at this hotel.  Very friendly staff and I love the location.  It is so convenient to subways, Central Park and Lincoln Center.  The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. It is tucked away on a street with all brownstones and lovely neighborhood.

title: Ottimo
text: Hotel molto bello e pulito nel pieno centro di Manhattan's, il cuore di New York City; le stanze sono un po piccole come anche i bagni ma per visitare la città è un ottimo punto di partenza. Consigliato!

title: Good experience
text: Spent over a week here while attending my brothe-in-law's exhibition at the Whitney. Normally stay at a boutique hotel but wanted to be closer to visiting family.  While the hotel needs a facelift badly, the staff made the stay feel like home - friendly and very accommodating!  While not spacious, rooms and hallways are clean.  The breakfast provided several choices and the attendant kept the room flowing well. The neighborhood is a nice area with a small town feel.  Central Park was a 1/2 block away - a real plus. Recommend asking for the end rooms to achieve a little more space

title: Excellent!
text: Perfect location, less than a block from Central Park. Hotel very clean.  Staff was excellent, especially Keith and another gentleman at the front desk. Room was tiny, but it's NYC so expected.  Room was very clean and cutely decorated. Beds were comfy.  Elevator was tiny but wasn't as slow as I thought by seeing the reviews.  Breakfast was Ok, but not a lot of seating.  We will for sure stay here again. Parking was $38 but easy to find and just around the corner.

title: Room and bathroom too small but great location.
text: Room and bathroom were too small.  Unmanageably too small...  Elevator and breakfast room also too small. Great location though. A minute walk from Central Park and a few minutes walk from the start of 5th avenue, Broadway, 7th avenue, etc...

title: Great hotel,highly recommended
text: Spent almost two weeks with 2 kids. Great location,clean and cozy, wonderful staff. 1min walk from central park, 2 min walk from subway. Anything we needed was happily answered. I highly recommend to families, but not only

title: Perfect Spot in NYC
text: The employees offer their guest exceptional customer service. The price, location, breakfast and cleanliness of the property were perfect. The location is close to Central Park, a historical site. We will certainly return for future trips.

title: Nice hotel for a single traveller.
text:
I was traveling alone and I must say I felt very safe in this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I was given a complimentary late check out which was really appreciated. The room was small but extremely clean. There was no view to speak of as the window looked into an inner yard area and across to other windows but this didn't matter as I kept the blinds closed. Air-conditioning was very efficient with a remote control so I didn't even have to get out of bed to adjust it. 
The hotel was in a perfect location very close to Central park. The complimentary coffee and breakfast were a bonus too. I would highly recommended the hotel for cleanliness and location.

title: 4 stars
text: When they made this location into La Quinta they really turned it out. I'm very happy with the outcome. More modern look and feel. The breakfast selection is decent I would change a f one or 2 things but overall very happy.

title: Reasonably priced hotel near Central Park
text: Good value for money at convenient location near Central Park and two subway lines, attentive staff, good breakfast, clean and quiet. The single elevator in a 14-story building can sometimes be a bottleneck.

title: Holiday in NYC
text:
The service was truly excellent in every way  and the front desk staff were always ready to assist  with whatever needs we had.  Their smiles helped to make us feel right at home.  The location just off Central Park West was perfect for visiting many of the most important museums and sites  and  buses and subways were nearby. 

staff was always ready to help in every way to make our stay as comfortable as possible.  The great location near Central Park West permitted us to visit  easily many of the most important sites and museums.  We found the hotel more than family friendly and would certainly choose to stay there again.

title: Si può fare
text:
L'hotel rispecchia in pieno le descrizioni e recensioni precedenti.
Punti di debolezza : camere veramente piccole (difficoltà per sistemare i bagagli). No frigo in camera ( ma troverete un asse da stiro??!!!!mah), moquette in camera, hotel datato, attesa per l'unica ascensore, stanza colazione molto piccola e colazione "essenziale".
Punti di forza : posizione ( vicinissimo a central park, in un bellissimo quartiere, con possibilità di raggiungere a piedi i maggiori siti d'interesse). La colazione seppure "essenziale" comunque c'è ed è sempre rifornita. Gentilezza del personale, sempre disponibile e pronto a trovare una soluzione a qualsiasi richiesta.
Fatte le mie valutazioni ho deciso di dare una valutazione complessivamente positiva.

title: Small rooms but great location!
text: My wife and I stayed here three nights before heading to Europe. Room was a little small, but from what I have heard, that is normal in NYC. Very close to Central Park and 72nd Street subway station. First night, we walked to Times Square with no problems. Staff was very nice and gave us recommendations on some local eats. Neighborhood felt safe, even when walking at night. Walking distance to several restaurants, including Gray's Papaya. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great value for the Upper East Side
text: We paid $190 for a double-twin combination in a small room on the window well. That's a great deal in New York, considering that the room was immaculate. Some drawbacks: the lights in the public bathrooms did not work. The desk in the room was so big it prevented the bathroom door from opening fully. The bathroom is so small you cannot change in it. And the twin bed did not have a reading light. Still, the hotel was quiet, and at that price, a great deal.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Ottima posizione, vicino alla subway linea rossa (che t porta ovunque).
Sei vicino a tutto quanto, Times square. Central park, rockfeller center , history museum ecc.
Personale gentile

Difetti: Camera un po' piccola. 
Pulizie non proprio rifinite.
Colazione un po' ripetitiva.

La consiglierei comunque per chi come me ha sempre girato e in camera tornavamo la sera tardi.

title: Small rooms but good for price...
text: Location was primary reason we chose the hotel. Rooms were small for three people but OK for price charged. Breakfast area was crowded with no sitting room. Front desk helpful but water and snack items for sale pricey.

title: Wonderful Find!
text:
The staff here are all nice and very welcoming.  We were able to check in early on our arrival day, the room was exactly what we needed, and breakfast is included.  Very easy access to Central Park and the subway.  Nice area, we felt comfortable walking around at night.
Our last evening, they hosted a Wine and Cheese night for Returns Members that was wonderful, and Cynthia invited us even though we had already checked out that morning.
We are definitely coming back!

title: Clean nice rooms but with elevator and noise levels, we will never return
text: We booked this knowing the prior reviews with elevator issues.  When we arrived, we received a very nice room with one double and one twin as requested.  Small but definitely sufficient for our one night stay.  Very clean.  Unfortunately, the noise with the elevator throughout the night and morning prevented any restful sleep.  I'm in agreement with others that the elevator was an issue with getting down in the morning, 15+ minute wait for it to arrive to the 14th floor.  We would have been ok with that one time a day issue but the noise was horrendous.  When I mentioned it in the morning, they said you should have called and we would have moved you to another room.  I travelled with a child who was exhausted and why would you place anyone in that room to begin with if other rooms farther from the elevator shaft were open.  I even tried white noise on our phone but even that couldn't drown out the groaning of the older elevator throughout the night.

title: Nice hotel-great location
text: This is a great hotel if you are visiting the UWS and want to be near Central Park, Lincoln Center, the museums etc. Very friendly and helpful staff at check in/out. The rooms are small but typical for NYC. We took the king corner room and it was fine.  Small bathroom and shower but adequate. Great bed and mattress.  Very clean rooms and bathrooms. Breakfast buffet was same as in most hotels: powdered eggs, make your own waffles,  boring pastries and bagels etc. nothing fancy but adequate. The only negatives: 1) the hallways are very narrow. Housekeeping staff leave their carts and the trash removed from rooms in the hallways making it difficult to walk and roll luggage down the halls In addition who wants to see bags of trash and dirty laundry in the halls?  It was removed later in the day, but they could use some covered carts to conceal it as the staff are going down the halls cleaning rooms. 2) there is only one elevator in the hotel shared by staff and guests. Very slow. Just prepare to wait awhile or take the stairs.

title: location
text: location is great, price is great for NY, rooms are small breakfasts were adequate, we would stay here again and again. If a small room would bother you skip this hotel. the hotel is i block from subway on A LINE.

title: Muito ruim
text:
Os quartos desse hotel são minúsculos mal cabe as malas e duas pessoas...resolvi escrever porque acho importante que outras pessoas não passem por uma experiência ruim...quase impossível se movimentar no quarto.
São arrumados mas inacreditavelmente pequenos.
A recepção é boa... localização tbm

title: dont do it
text: total rip for the price. 350 a night for a room 12x12. using the toilet couldnt even reach the toilet paper when sittig.we had to use teh bathrooms on the first floor. the shower had a shower curtain that barley closed to keep water in cheap to say the least. we didnt expect a room so small for the price.the tv was bigger than the bed. it could have been mounted on the wall to save dresser space. definately not worth the money staying there.  breakfast was the usual. stale doughnuts, sausage laying in puddles of grease. only good thing was that it was close to central park, 1/2 blk away. plenty of eateries close by. front staff very helpful.

title: Excellent NYC hotel
text: The La Quinta - NY Central Park has a good westside location. The staff is top-notch, the rooms are small but very nice. Hint: allow 5+ mins. when taking the single small elevator that's shared by guests/staff. The beds are firm and comfortable.  The breakfast spread is tasty and well stocked.  This is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in the city!

title: Fantastic location and clean room
text:
The location of the hotel is really the best feature. You are one block west of Central Park and a few blocks away from two different subway stations. There are plenty of stores surrounding the hotel if you need to step out for a snack or something you may have forgotten. 

The room was very clean and we had no complaints about the room. The room is obviously very, very small. We had a 1 bed queen room and the entire room couldn't have been more than 80 square feet. It really is small but it's to be expected in the city. 

The downside is there is only one teeny tiny elevator that takes quite a while to reach your floor. Plan accordingly! 

I would definitely stay here again. It is a great value given the location.

title: Great Price and Good Location
text: Manhattan hotels are expensive during the summer. We booked this hotel because of the good rate. However, the room we had was very small. If,you book at this hotel, request a king size bed and you will have a larger room. Breakfast is included which is a plus.

title: Tiny rooms and overpriced
text: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and kids. Pros: Nice location on the Upper West Side; friendly greeting; rooms pretty clean. Cons: The rooms are tiny, even by NY standards; rooms are very noisy - I could hear the person in the room next to me taking a shower; the bedding is worn and needs updating; there is no real storage in the rooms as the closet is laughable; the bathroom is tiny; the hotel cost was way too high given the size and quality of the room.

title: Clean and affordable
text: I visited here for a couple days with my daughter, fiancé and I. The stay was pleasant the bedroom and bathroom were clean and smelled nice and the staff was very friendly and helpful.I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Solo 1 notte!!
text: Struttura piuttosto basica... camere troppo sacrificate... bagni troppo piccoli al punto di non essere utilizzabili decentemente... non vale la pena nemmeno per una notte... spiace solo per l'ottima ubicazione...

title: The Best location
text: I visit New York every 3 years but stayed with friends. This location is perfect! Everything I wanted to see and do was on the West side, starting from Battery Park all the way to 125th Street. Central Park is one block away and the museum is within walking distance of the hotel.

title: Priced too high for room
text: The room was small and claustrophobic. It was very stuffy without the A/C on. The bathroom had no tub and was hard to turn around in. Not luxurious at all compared to other hotels of the same price. I would rent it again if there was no other alternative. Otherwise no.

title: Fantastic property.
text:
This is in a FANTASTIC neighborhood and just a quick hop off Central Park. There's an entrance to the subway just a block away, and food options around each corner. Inside, the hotel is well maintained and feels modern in its decor. 

Our room, for being in downtown, was very large. We sprung for the corner king, and it was worth every dollar after seeing the room next to ours. There's not much of a view, but it was still worth it in exchange for space. Traditional LQ amenities (conditioning shampoo and bar soap). There wasn't a hair drier in the room, but we called the front desk and they were happy to accommodate. My husband went down to get it and it was literally brand new in the box. There was no fridge, which unusual for an LQ.

The breakfast room is probably my only complaint. It's fairly small, but options were good. They had eggs and potatoes, cereal, pastries, fruit, coffee, juice.

It's a fantastic hotel. I'm not sure why so many reviews have issues with the elevator, we never had a problem. We would certainly come back.

title: Beautiful, Clean, Good Price, Great Location
text: Brand new hotel, was very clean and had modern accommodations.   Free donuts and breakfast every morning. Nice, friendly staff. They let us keep our bags behind the desk when we had to check out but still wanted to explore the city.  In an amazing location, 1 minute walk from Central Park. Absolutely loved our stay, would stay again.

title: Another great stay
text:
It was out our second stay here in the last six months. The hotel is very nice.
Is it a nice location half a block from Central Park and it's on a very quiet street. If you go try to get the corner king room as they are quite large.
The staff is very helpful and accommodating, they also have a nice breakfast.

title: Small, but good value!
text: I've stayed here twice now. The rooms, although very small, are pleasantly decorated and are very clean. The staff is great, and I slept well every time. Great location, too - just a few steps from Central Park, and a few blocks from Lincoln Center.

title: Gutes Holtel
text:
Das hotel liegt direckt am central park
Die Metrostationen sind auch in der Nähe.
Man kann hier auch Frühstücken
Der flur zu den zimmern ist ein bisschen muffig. Aber alles in einem ist es ein tolles Hotel zu einem günstigen Preis
Das personal sehr freundlich und man gibt sich Mühe den Gast zu verstehen( deutsch) wenn der nicht gut englisch kann.

title: Lo justo y necesario, muy buen descanso, servicio y relacion precio-calidad.
text: Considerando que mi visita a New York me mantuvo de caminata practicamente todo el dia, este hotel fue una perfecta eleccion. Habiendo leido comentarios con antelacion, reserve para dos la habitacion de tres, ya que muchos hablaban de lo pequeño de las habitaciones y realmente era cierto...extremadamente chicas, pero bueno en la de tres que me aloje estuvimos bien! El descanso fue excelente, la cama increible, no daban ganas de levantarse, el baño pequeño pero justo, TV, cafetera, caja fuerte y un desayuno ideal que no teniamos previsto en la reserva y nos dieron de todos modos. El Hotel es para manejarse independiente... una pequeña recepcion, una maquina de comida chatarra y PC para consultar internet. WIFI Free en la habitacion y zonas comunes  y una ubicacion si bien alejada del midtown perfectamente conectada con las lineas A,B,C y D a una cuadra y la 1,2 y 3 a dos cuadras. A una cuadra y media de Lincoln Av y Brodway, 4 cuadras del Lincoln Center, media cuadra del Central Park y a la vuelta del edificio Dakota ! mi experiencia fue sumamente grata!!

title: Perfect location
text: Outstanding location, great restaurants close by and also public transport services. Short walk to central park. Well maintained accommodation, in a very pleasant area. I really enjoyed my stay and had restful nights on a very comfortable bed. Thank You.

title: Perfect location
text: If you are looking for a room with a view, then this may not be for you. If you are looking for cleanliness, comfort, a good nights sleep away from the hustle and bustle, then this is absolutely perfect. Situated within yards of central park, picturesque neighbourhood, clean, nice breakfast staff were friendly and helpful.   Room was very good, comfortable bed , clean and plenty of hot water for showering in the morning. Restful nights sleep and could be downtown in 30 minutes or less, depending on mode of transportation. I highly recommend this hotel, would or even probably will go back in a heartbeat. My stay was too short.

title: La Quinta Central Park West
text: Location is perfect for going to the NYC Ballet and the price is the lowest for the upper westside.  It is also close to Columbus Circle, a host of good restaurants and bars, and of course Central Park.  There is easy subway access at 72nd and Central Park West as well.

title: Great place for a stay in NYC
text: Stayed here for 5 nights visiting NYC.  Immediately I was greeted by Willington, a great guy at the desk.  He was friendly, had great advice, and was a real pleasure to talk to.  The rooms are surprisingly spacious for NY, and the free morning breakfast has been well above average: waffles, sausage, pastries, eggs, cereal.  The rooms are well kept and the service/maintenance staff are all very friendly and polite - they even hold the elevator for you and greet you in the morning.  And then there is the location.  The hotel is a block from Central Park, an easy walk from Broadway/Amsterdam, and a block from a subway station.  All told, I couldn't be happier with my stay!

title: You get what you pay for.
text: It was cheap, and my room was so small that I had trouble walking around the bed. The only view was of another building and was scary. The towel hook on the bathroom door was completely off. The drain in the shower was broken. That being said, the room was pretty clean. The staff was super friendly. The location is fantastic. The bed was firm and great. Overall, it was a mixture of good and bad.

title: Perfect Upper-Mid Town location, nice hotel!
text: Great value hotel with a hot breakfast included. Hotel staff is very nice, extra shout out to Mo who stirred us in the right direction on one or more occasion! Location is PERFECT as you're a short walk away from great restaurants and stores, metro station and Central Park. The only down side is the slow elevator and small bathrooms. But the bed and pillows were super comfy!!

title: Excelente hotel
text: Reservamos el hotel sin tener idea cuál sería nuestra experiencia. Hemos ido varias veces a New York pero nunca nos alojamos en esa parte de la ciudad. Desde que llegamos la experiencia ha sido excelente. Todo el personal nos hizo sentir como en casa, desde las indicaciones para tomar subte, los lugares donde podíamos comer o simplemente alguna consulta. Si bien el tamaño de una habitación doble es pequeño, eso no dejo de dejar 100% conformes con nuestra elección. El desayuno súper completo, las facilidades y ame otros buenísimos y la ubicación más que excelente. Recomiendo este hotel para todo tipo de viajes.

title: Best Hotel
text: *Great Location ... 1/2 block from Central Park and Tavern on the Green.  3 1/2 block from TV Studios.  1 block from subway.  *A very friendly, helpful staff *clean rooms *would definitely stay here again

title: Знакомство с городом
text:
Если Вы хотите найти место, откуда удобно добираться до интересных мест, и не слишком требовательны к комфорту - этот отель для вас. Великолепное месторасположение! Рядом Централ-парк, знаменитый дом "Дакота", музейная миля, можно пешком дойти до Бродвея и Таймс-сквер. 
В отеле приветливый персонал (есть администратор, говорящая по-русски), чистые постели, работающая сантехника, лифт. Это безусловные плюсы. 
Минусы: Очень маленькие номера. В двухместном номере у нас было только одно кресло и одна тумбочка возле кровати. 
Плюсы: есть гладильная доска с утюгом и кофеварка. Шкафы небольшие, но их два. На первом этаже всегда есть лед, а в номере стоит ведерко для льда.
Минусы: крайне скромный завтрак. Если описывать поштучно - получится много наименований. На самом деле завтраки более чем скромные. Да и зал маленький - иногда непросто найти свободное место.
Плюс: есть две вафельницы. Желающие могут быстро освоить это нехитрое действо и баловать себя свежими вафлями к завтраку. Во время завтрака Вас будут развлекать новостями по ТВ (на стене телевизор с приличной диагональю).
И еще один немаловажный плюс: Wi-Fi, действительно, есть и он бесплатный. А вот каналов на русском языке мы не нашли...

title: Usual
text: Negative issues: Only one and small elevator Room without a table Room without a fridge Positive issues: Location Breakfast Personal We were vwry satisfied to be in this hotel and stayed for longer than we first booked

title: Like coming home...
text: We always stay at this NYC hotel when we come to play. It's like being with family, and close to everything we want or need. Clean, cheerful, convenient, and welcoming. Yes, the rooms are small; we don't go to New York to sleep.

title: NOT REMOTELY ACCEPTABLE FOR WORKING
text: This hotel has two great things going for it.  It has an amazing location and its staff is both friendly and helpful.  After that nothing here was really acceptable.  My bill for 3 nights including one weekend night averaged over $200 per night.  For NYC that is not outrageous but still high enough to expect much more.  The problems were ones that normal hotels (even ones much cheaper) solve every day.  The rooms in NYC are always small.  This one was smaller than average.  Unfortunately with what space they have they failed to provide any working surface like a desk.  Therefore any work you do has to be done on the bed.  That is hard enough but to make it worse, during our stay the wi-fi was so slow that it was essentially unusable.  I carry a hot-spot which I used but for the price I should not have to use up my data.   TO SUM THIS UP -- DO NOT EVEN CONSIDER THIS HOTEL IF YOU WANT TO USE IT AT ALL FOR WORKING.  THE ROOMS ARE NOT SET UP TO MAKE THAT POSSIBLE AND THE WI-FI IS AWFUL.

title: "Recomendable"
text:
Hotel con una excelente ubicación, con estaciones de metro muy cerca y a un ladito de Central Park lo cual es un lujazo.
La habitación  que me toco 606, muy pero muy chiquita y con el equipaje se hizo mas chiquita, pero super limpia y comoda.
el desayuno muy bien sin mucho lugar para sentarse pero hay que bajar a buena hora para estar comodo.
 Definitivamente recomendable.

title: Small but very comfortable room
text: My stay was enhanced by the helpful and friendly staff. My room was small but very clean with a large flat screen TV. The staff was very responsive to my requests and very helpful in helping with transportation. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent position for visiting
text: I primarily chose this hotel for its position and it was an excellent choice, close to the subway, close to bus stops and hop on hop off service. A short walk across Central Park to the Met and also close to the Natural history museum. Reception staff are welcoming and efficient. We travelled with our son and had a room for 3 which was adequate if somewhat cramped. The beds are comfy and the room was clean. Bathroom small but lots of hot water and a good shower. There is a free breakfast which has a reasonable choice although unfortunately the breakfast room is rather too small for the size of the hotel and we noticed some guests had to stand up to eat as there was insufficient seating.There are two computers in the reception with printers which is handy to print boarding passes ! I would stay there again on my next trip.

title: Great stay!
text:
We reserved 2 Queen rooms. We called the day before and we were told we could bring our bags even if rooms were not ready. One was ready at 11am when we got there. It was nice to put our stuff in a room. Freshen up and head out to Central Park! Great location!!! 
Parked on 71 st, hotel rate was great! Just get ticket stamped by hotel. 
Rooms are small, but clean, mattresses are awesome!
Great to have breakfast included! Food was adequate. Coffee and juices were very good!
Hotel staff were all friendly and helpful!
They let us leave bags at hotel even after checkout so we did not have to take our car out of garage until later in the day!! 
Great stay!!

title: コスパ最高
text:
受付の人を含めスタッフの方が親切。
地下鉄、Citi Bike Stationから近く移動も便利。
高級住宅街なので、タクシーも捕まえやすい。
セントラルパークを毎朝走れる。
トレーダージョーズというオーガニックすぱーが近く、そこで夕食なども帰る。　
部屋はそこそこ清潔だが、バスタオルの1つに染みがあったのが残念。
ただ、私が予約したときは一部のHostelより安かったので、コスパはいい。
朝食のマフィンも美味しかった。

title: Small but comfy & affordable
text: If you are claustrophobic this probably is not the place for you.  If you are ok in small places then this hotel is great!  The elevator is tiny, the hallways are narrow, and the rooms are tiny.  With that out of the way, the beds are comfortable and rooms have all the comforts of home.  The hotel breakfast is better than the standard hotel breakfast.  It is right across from Central Park and only a short few minute walk to Lincoln Center.

title: Tutto perfetto! Peccato per la cameriera della colazione e la colazione!
text:
Ciao:) 
Sono felice di potervi descrivere la mia esperienza in questo fantastico hotel! Rapporto qualità prezzo ottimo !! Posizione centrale! Vicino all hotel c è di tutto, bar m
, pizzerie ,metro etc... il quartiere sta a 10 minuti da time square ma allo stesso tempo fuori dalla confusione!
La colazione potrebbe migliorare ma io caccerei proprio la cameriera... una scortesia unica! Peccato!
La pulizia delle camere potrebbe migliorare ma nel complesso.... se dovessi tornare a ny ci ritornerei! 

Ciaoooo

title: Ligging geweldig!
text: De driepersoons kamer was echt super klein, we konden onze 3 grote koffers amper kwijt. Je kon nog geen 6 stappen zetten. Ook de badkamer was erg klein. Bedden waren erg comfortabel. Goed geslapen maar kan me voorstellen dat het zomers niet te doen is. De airco is namelijk recht op het derde bed  gericht en kan niet verplaatst worden. Dan krijg je die koude wind op je hoofd. Uitzicht: praktisch geen, ingebouwd  tussen andere muren. Elke dag nieuwe handdoeken en opmaak van het bed. Ontbijt: goed, maar de ruimte was veel te klein. Te druk voor die ene medewerkster om alles goed bij te houden en te kleine ruimte zodat niet iedereen kan zitten. Wafels, eieren, broodjes (ook bruin!), grijze worstjes (?), sap, koffie en thee uit een automaat. Boter, jam, Philadelphia kaas als beleg, en een paar soorten cereal. Lift inderdaad traag, een paar keer de trap genomen. Vriendelijk frontdesk personeel. ATM en drank-/snackautomaat in de lobby. Geweldige locatie in een zijstraat van Central Park. Geen gezellige restaurantjes in de buurt. Wifi was traag.

title: Value is park proximity, not room size
text:
Location by park is fantastic but keep in mind the rooms in this hotel are really, really small (basically a private room at AirBnB). Have an overnight bag and not much extra space for larger suitcases. Upper West Side is a quiet getaway from the hustle and bustle from tourists centers like Times Square. 

Hotel is on 71st which opens right at one of the entrances of the park.

title: Bien situé
text:
L'hôtel est idéalement situé, à 50 mètres de Central Park et entre deux stations de métro. La litterie est de bonne qualité, les chambres sont propres.
Points négatifs : impossible de vider les valises par manque de placards. Difficile de circuler dans la chambre très étroite. La salle de bain est minuscule. 
La salle prévue pour le petit déjeuner est trop petite pour le nombre de clients.
Un seul ascenseur pour tout l'hôtel, pas très pratique.

title: Excellent lighting, clean bathroom, excellent location
text: Strong lighting, a very clean bathroom and location (6 easy blocks to the Natural History Museum) almost overcome the cramped room and unappetizing eggs (folded over and undercooked and undercooked (or so it appeared) sausage for the free breakfast.  Stubbed my toe badly coming out of bathroom in the middle of the night on the corner of L-shaped room and still recovering 2 weeks out.  Two people can't pass by each other without maneuvering.  Don't worry about the dirty windows; there's nothing to see and they do let in a little light.  On the other hand....lighting, bath, location, good beds made my husband appreciate it and its Upper West Side location.  Breakfast room has plenty of breads, cereal, yogurt.  How about a really sturdy whole wheat bread?  A second waffle maker or pancake maker would be nice for busy weekend mornings.  Room was so full of people, there was a waiting line to get in and I had to lean against the wall to eat.  Weekday was better.  Price was excellent for what you get.

title: Vacation
text: This review is very difficult to write because I'm so conflicted. The hotel location is fantastic. One block off Central Park. Close to subway stop. Close to nice restaurants. The staff is very nice. We arrived at 10 in the morning and our room was ready. That never happens. But oh the room. So very very small. But heck we're not in the room much. Just to sleep and shower. Well the place is loud! Very loud. We heard every noise our neighbors made. And rooms are small. Which was not a big deal. And there was minimal hot water in the shower. Which was a huge problem. We reported it. Repairman came right up and tried but told us there was a pipe problem. He got water tepid. I'm still ambivalent. Great location vs lukewarm showers. Probably won't stay here again. But I'm not 100% certain of that.

title: Not great but has a few nice qualities
text: Hotels in NYC are way too expensive. I have stayed in different areas in the city, and upper westside is even more challenging than other areas.  It is never worth the money. Old carpet, old shower, very small bathroom, very small bedroom but clean. Very friendly staff. Fantastic location. Good neighborhood. Close to a subway station. The very best thing was the bed for me. It is one of the best hotel beds I have slept in. If you are not planning to spend to much time is your hotel room, this hotel may work for you.

title: Comfortable and Convenient!
text: Great staff here made the visit trouble free. Room was 'pretty tiny' but the price was right, and all amenities were good enough. Lobby is well cared for, and check in and check out were a breeze. Breakfasts are SPARTAN, but I didn't come here to eat breakfast :-)

title: A eviter
text:
Séjour à  3 dans une chambre si petite qu'on ne pouvait se croiser. Placard de rangement trop petit les cintres ne tiennent même pas dans la profondeur
Salle de bain petite on se cogne partout .
Petit déjeuner plus que passable peu de choix
Les plus calme proche central parc et métro et personnel sympa mais si vous voulez être dans le N'Y  qui bouge 10 a5 15 minutes de métro ou 30 minutes de marchés
Ne vaut pas les 1300 euros pour 7 jours

title: Posizione ottimale, ma attenzione alla metro
text: L'hotel offre un discreto servizio, potrebbe migliorare nella pulizia. Se si ha la colazione inclusa avviarsi molto prima perché ci sono pochi posti a sedere per la quantità di ospiti dell'hotel. Avendo 14 piani e un solo ascensore c'è la possibilità di aspettare anche 5 minuti per poter usufruirne. La posizione invece è ottima, il quartiere molto tranquillo nell'upper west side vicinissimo a central park. La metropolitana più vicina purtroppo è la linea C e B che non passa spesso... Si consiglia quindi di recarsi alla fermata 72th street incrocio con Broadway linea rossa 1-2-3 che distano a 5 minuti di camminata, ma si aspetta decisamente meno.

title: Great place to stay that won't break the bank....
text: Our stay was great. Check-in was a breeze and we booked a second night on arrival and the clerk was efficient and pleasant. The price of under $200.00 for a corner rooms with a view of Central Park made this hotel number one on our list. Great rooms that were clean and comfortable. Free breakfast in the morning what more could you ask.

title: Posizione molto favorevole
text:
L'hotel si trova vicinissimo a Central Park e alla fermata delle metro, quindi la posizione è veramente ottima.
Appena arrivati abbiamo avuto dei problemi con le carte di credito, il ragazzo alla reception non sembrava neanche molto competente, infatti quando gli abbiamo chiesto di fare il pagamento con il chip e non strisciando la carta è andato in confusione, non sapeva proprio come utilizzare il pos.
Risolto questo problema delle carte, la vacanza è proseguita senza problemi.
La colazione era abbastanza ricca, si poteva scegliere tra uova, patate al forno, yogurt, latte con i cereali, varie brioche e ciambelle, ed anche waffle. 
Il personale che puliva le stanze era gentile, l'unico problema era che nessuno di loro parlava inglese.
Alla reception c'erano delle signore molto competenti e gentili.

title: Suficiente/céntrico
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado. Al lado de Central Park y con una estación de metro al lado. Habitaciones pequeñas pero bien cuidadas. Desayuno escaso, con poco sitio donde sentarse. Zona tranquila y sin ruidos. El personal en general muy amable. Dispone de cajero en el hotel, bebidas o chips y hielo.

title: I expected a tiny room but not all the long black hair in my tub and on my towels, yuck!
text:
I stayed a week for business.  I liked the area and all the conveniences.  The staff was friendly but that is where my positive review stops.

There are like 14 floors and only one elevator.  I chose many times to walk the flights down versus waiting for the elevator.  It can't be helped and I understand but give yourself time to exit, because it can take a while.
