The breakfast area is tiny, there were times when there was no seating and the line to get food was long.  The breakfast was not good.  The eggs and sausage were not appealing, the oatmeal consisted of packets of plain but no brown sugar or nuts or dried fruit to add.  The orange juice was good one day but terribly watered down the next.  After the first few days I just didn't access this area.  My room was tiny but I read the reviews and expected it, but I was just disappointed in the care of the room.  My bed had a wrinkled comforter, it was nicely made each day when I returned to the room but had stains and wrinkles.  The bathroom had bath towels and hand towels and wash cloths all hanging on a towel rack.  Two days before I left I picked up a washcloth to wash my face and it was full of long black hair!  This is a tiny washcloth and they fold it in such a way to make it a little fancy to finish their towel ensemble on the towel rack.  So please don't expect me to believe the house cleaning person didn't see it!  The first day of my stay, I took a shower and at the conclusion I noticed several long black hairs in my tub and tried to reason to my self that perhaps when wiping out the tub after they cleaned, maybe some hairs stuck to the side.  But as I stood there staring at this tiny washcloth with at least seven long black strands, I couldn't help but think that someone was bitter with their job and planted them there!  It grossed me out and I just could not appreciate my stay.  The last complaint is the wifi, I could not upload my data to my company and had to use my phone as a hotspot.

title: Great location with cramped rooms
text:
I usually stay in other parts of Manhattan on my trips; this was the first time I stayed on the Upper West Side.  GREAT LOCATION! 

Not only is it close to Central Park, but Strawberry Fields (the memorial for John Lennon) is less than half a block from the hotel.  Definitely worth a visit for meditation and history.

There are also A LOT of fun places to eat in close proximity to the hotel.  I did take out from Zabar's (2245 Broadway at 80th St) - a bagel, sable and lox from a deli counter where the counter help are fish carving artists and treat the fish like it was gold (only more expensive), some cream cheese, and two pieces of rugelach, and some chocolate babka to bring home) and brought it back to the hotel for dinner one night.  

I also recommend:  Tasty Cafe (2062 Broadway at 70th St) for coffee, soups, sandwiches, and delicious baked goods, with free WiFi.  Empire Szechuan (193 Columbus Ave at 68th St) delivers excellent Chinese food and sushi to the hotel.  Gray's Papaya and Franks (Broadway and 72d St) is a good place for cheap eats - $6 for two franks and a drink, stand at the counter and eat it there.  And Hummus Place (305 Amsterdam Ave at 74th St) - lots of good vegetarian choices in a small and intimate setting; and Joe & the Juice ( 247A Columbus Ave at 71st St) - the smoothies sound like odd mixes but are really tasty.

The subway is only two blocks away, so getting around Manhattan is convenient and cheap.

The hotel is a little tired and the rooms are small.  The shower was ok, but the sink could only muster lukewarm water.  What's up with that?  And don't pay more for a room with a better view - the windows are so dirty you can't see outside anyway.  The free breakfast is below standards for hotels of this sort - yes, it has the usual waffles and a few baked goods, but the eggs and sausage were inedible. And it is time to replace the towels and washcloths - they are so old and have been washed so many times they are almost transparent.

title: Small dark smelling room run by imbeciles
text: I think the title says it all, except that there was no way to control the heat, only the AC.  Staff was friendly but unable to help deal with a stay during a potential natural disaster, and help through the website took too long to matter.  I checked out early.

title: Nice location, very small room in need of some work
text: The hotel is nice enough as a base for seeing NYC. Everything is very small; the lobby, elevator, rooms, breakfast area. The location is good for sightseeing, it is right next to Central Park and also a few subway stops. This made it easy for us to get wherever we needed to go. Our room looked like it was under slight remodel, as there were patched areas of the walls and ceiling. We were there during a very cold week and our heater didn't work very well. The breakfast was nice but somewhat limited and crowded.

title: Excelente e tranquila opção em NY
text:
O hotel está numa localização privilegiada e tranquila de NY. Ao lado do parque, do museu de historia natural e metro. 
Tem boas opções de restaurante ao redor, mercados e lojas.
O quarto é minusculo mas muito limpo e confortável.  Silencioso ideal para descansar após um dia cheio na cidade.
O café da manha é farto mas não muito variado, mas está bom. A recepção do hotel é atenciosa e prestativa para o que precisamos.

title: Quarto pequeno porém ótimo custo benefício
text: A meia quadra do central park, do strawberry fields, do dakota, da estação do metrô. Mto boa localização. De metrô vc faz tudo em nyc. O quarto é pequeno, mas bem limpo e os funcionários mto educados. Diferencial: café da manhã incluso - é tumultuado a depender do horário, mas é uma grande economia! Voltarei!

title: Great location - nice clean room - quiet
text:
We stayed at a nice hotel in NYC right off central park on the west side. Its in a protected brownstone area, so quiet and kind of had a local feeling with great little restaurants around as you walked towards Columbus street. It was quite affordable and provided a nice, clean, newly renovated corner room with a king size bed. Although the room was small and bathroom too, it was cosy and really all we needed to start our day early from a walking distance to almost everything we wanted to see. 

I would go back for sure.

title: tiny rooms, needs renovation
text: The pictures on website are misleading: tiny dark rooms in need of a renovation. Not what is shown on website, which makes it seem like you're in a larger, sunny room with a view - soooo far from the reality. I won't be staying here again.

title: Recomendable
text:
Estuvimos una semana. Tiene desayuno incluido. La ubicación es óptima para el metro, centros comerciales y para el Museo de ciencias naturales.
El hotel muy lindo, si ben las habitaciones son pequeñas para dormir es excelente. Hay personal que habla en español. 
También nos brindaron un taxi particular para el regreso al Aeropuerto.

title: Economico ma senza pretese
text: Questo hotel ha di positivo soltanto l'economicità e la posizione strategica di fronte al Central Park e vicinissimo alle fermate della metro. Per quanto riguarda lo standard dell'albergo direi molto basso. Anzitutto siamo arrivati e il pagamento non è stato consono a quello che ci aveva offerto booking. Non è la prima volta che acquisto un pacchetto con Booking e non mi era mai successo che il prezzo non corrispondesse a quello offerto inizialmente. Stanze minute avevamo chiesto una tripla e c'è stato dato un letto che non era matrimoniale ma bensì una piazza e mezza. Bagno non piccolo ma microscopico. Molto comodi i letti. Per quanto riguarda la colazione alle 7:00 della mattina non c'è mai tutto pronto come dovrebbe essere. Locale non freddo ma polare. Yogurt e merce rara non disponibile alle 7:00 della mattina. Per quanto riguarda la camera come ci c'è sembrato che fossero sparite degli oggetti intimi e delle creme. Per quanto riguarda la cortesia del personale ha lasciato un po' desiderare.

title: review of La Quinta at NY ZCentral Park
text: Excellent value for moderate type of room. Great location for us, but the upgrade of the hotel seemed to be spotty and not complete. The bathrooms really need an upgrade, perhaps taking out the tub and installing modern shower. Also need workout room and faster elevator. Staff was very good, however.

title: NYC Upper West Side Find
text: I was visiting my daughter in college, and this hotel was a couple of blocks from her dorm. It's located on a quiet Upper West Side street within sight of Central Park and half a block from a mix of restaurants and a great Dry Bar for a hair touchup. The beds are new and extremely comfy, and the rooms have more windows (unfortunately dirty) than I've ever seen in a NYC hotel! I was amazed at the free wifi and ample breakfast included. You can't go wrong here, just be patient with the elevator.

title: Great service, Great location
text: This LaQuinta is on a quiet street walking distance from the museums and Central Park. The staff and management were very accommodating, and their helpfulness made for not just a great stay, but an excellent experience.  I can not wait to return!

title: Cozy, comfortable, great price & location
text: I felt right at home here, everyone is so nice.  The location is wonderful as it is in a nice and quiet neighborhood right by Central Park.  My favorite part about this hotel was the free breakfast!  They offer a wide variety of breakfast items and that saved us money and time on a meal.

title: Regular
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado a una cuadra y media de una estacion de metro, a dos cuadras de otra y a media cuadra de Central Park. Espacios EXTREMADAMENTE pequeños pero con lo necesario para dormir y asearse. Cuentan con caja fuerte que es básico. El desayuno bastante simple y repetitivo, pero cumple con que no salgas a recorrer las calles con el estomago vacio. Genara, la encargada del comedor es una lindura, muy amable y servicial, asi como un señor latino de mantenimiento. De las personas de recepcion no puedo decir lo mismo. Tampoco me parecio correcto que pidan que liquides tu estancia desde tu llegada, pues normalmente uno paga al hacer el check-out. Al hacer check out pedimos ayuda para conseguir un taxi y nos dijo la señorita que ellos no pueden hacer eso... primera vez en un hotel que me niegan conseguir un taxi. Yo consegui una tarifa bastante baja por lo que no hice corajes, pero si hubiera pagado tarifa regular pensaria que el servicio no vale el costo.

title: NYC Marathon Weekend 11/6/16
text:
For anyone that's running in the NYC Marathon, this hotel is near the West 72 St exit of Central Park. After crossing the finish line, I walked right to the hotel. I read reviews that said Queen size bed rooms were small but read that the King size bed rooms were better. So I reserved a King size bed for my wife and me. Very nice room, plenty of space!! Free breakfast was good.
On the day of the marathon, the street is closed off for traffic. My wife (who was not running the marathon) didn't have any issues crossing police barricades.
Subway is 1 block away. 
I'm running the marathon again and already have my room reserved for Nov. 2017.

title: Fine hotel, very close to Central Park
text: The rooms are small, as would be expected of a NYC hotel, but they were adequate, clean, and comfortable.  The staff was friendly as well.  The main benefit of the place is the price and location, which were both great.  Perfect location for a morning jog in the park.

title: New York
text: Hotel is well located, near to Central Park, subway station and nice restaurants. Very good place to sleep, service is perfect. Recommended to improve rooms (too small) and breakfast  food & drinks (not enough choice).

title: Toilet Clogged Repeatedly
text: Toilet clogged and backed up repeatedly even after staff said it was fixed. Each time I reported it the staff said someone is coming to fix it and when I returned for the night the toilet backed up again. I don't use much paper if you are wondering and I ate very light each day. The bathroom was so small I had to sit sideways to get on the toilet. Bumped my knee a few time to get around the bed. NOT worth the savings.

title: Super situation et chambre parfaite
text: Pour notre premier séjour à New-York, sans un budget énorme, nous avons été véritablement conquis par ce charmant hôtel de 94 chambres, à quelques dizaines de mètres de central park. Chambre spacieuse (on a été gentiment surclassés par l'adorable Suzanna), propre, literie idéale, salle de bains pratique même si un peu froide, petit déjeuner diversifié et bien approvisionné, personnel disponible et agréable.. Et Manhattan a fait le reste :)

title: BBB
text: A localização é excelente, o hotel como um todo é nota 9, com exceção do café da manhã, que é nota 5. Acredito que poderiam colocar ovos mexidos, omeletes, sausage e bacon todos os dias, mas eles só colocavam os bons pratos no final de semana e durante a semana ovos cozidos. As camareiras são super simpáticas e atenciosas.

title: I would not go back.
text: The rooms are tiny.  Tinier than any hotel room I have ever been in.  Any room near the elevator is very noisy, and there are many rooms near the elevator.  The WiFi didn't work.  The TV didn't work.  The "parking", which is an unrelated garage, is on the street behind the hotel, with no back access to the hotel, so you have to walk up, over, and down a street to the hotel carrying everything you might need because you can't get back in your car once its been parked by the valet.  No venting in the bathrooms, and the windows are blocked so you can't open them.  Beds feel like a thin layer of foam over plywood.

title: Excelente localização
text: Muito perto do Central Park, do Museu de Historia Natural, do Metropolitan Museu, da Columbus Circles, com bons restaurantes e lojas de conveniencias na proximidade. Localizado na Upper West Side, você se sente como num filme.

title: Great location & new remodel
text:
1/2 block from central park - clean & quiet & small rooms. Excellent / new bed & sheets.
Good free breakfast. slow elevator. Good prices in winter. Very efficient / friendly front desk by Susana & Penny

title: Great Bargain Excellent Location
text: Recently remodeled and very clean with excellent staff.  This hotel is a great bargain for the location 1/2 block from Central Park.  The rooms are small but comfortable.  Beds are very comfortable.  Free breakfast was adequate.  The dining room is a bit over-crowded but that was our only complaint.  The staff was the best part - very helpful and friendly.  Definitely recommend!!

title: Winzig - Zimmer und Preis
text:
Ob in qm, oder preislich her gesehen, in diesem Hotel binden sich wohl die kleinsten Zimmer überhaupt. Wir haben in der Nacht die Türe halb offen gelassen, hatten Platzangst und das Gefühl nicht genügend Sauerstoff zu bekommen... 😐
Positiv aber die 1A Lage, direkt am Central Park! In dem, für New York recht niedrigen Preis, ist Frühstück inbegriffen. Wer keine Platzangst hat und nicht viel ausgeben möchte, ist hier gut aufgehoben.

title: Great value, perfect for economic tourist
text: Great value,but tiny room because it's Manhattan. Good service and comfortable for our purposes. Would not recommend if you were planning to spend a lot of time in the room. Definitely would recommend if you are planning on touring New York on a budget.

title: INCUBO FINO ALL'ULTIMO GIORNO
text: --LEGGETE TUTTI-- Iniziamo dicendo che un giorno prima della nostra partenza per NY ci arriva una mail con scritto che l'hotel ha rifiutato la carta ma vabbè l'abbiamo cambiata. Arriviamo in hotel il tizio senza nemmeno salutare ci chiede la carta con cui era stata fatta la prenotazione online, tempo qualche secondo e alla mia compagna gli arriva un messaggio dalla banca con scritto che era stata effettuata una pre-autorizzazione (secondo booking la pre autorizzazione sarebbe stata fatta sulla prima notte della singola persona) noi eravamo 3 e la carta della mia compagna è stata svuotata perchè il tizio tanto furbo ha effettuato la pre-autorizzazione sull'intero soggiorno di tutti e 3. in pratica sulla carta c'erano tipo 9 dollari. Altro problema essendo una visa debit lo sblocco dei soldi avviene solamente dopo 15 giorni a meno che LA BANCA DELL'HOTEL NON COMUNICA ALLA BANCA INTERESSATA CHE SI POSSONO SBLOCCARE SUBITO. Ovviamente tutto ciò non è stato fatto perche nessuno ci capiva niente solo un giorno prima della nostra partenza il manager ha inviato una mail fatta da lui che ovviamente non ha avuto valenza per la nostra banca. Fatto sta che ci avevano  detto per tutto il soggiorno che stavano risolvendo la questione tra continui giochi e bugie soprattutto da parte di chi aveva commesso l'errore. Come si è risolta la situazione?? io ho pagato per la mia compagna tutte le spese da gite a pranzi e cene lei i soldi li ha rivisti sul suo conto una settimana dopo essere tornata in italia. Ma non è finita, la notte prima della nostra partenza esattamente da circa mezzanotte iniziamo a sentire musica latina a tutto volume cerchiamo di capire da dove viene chiamiamo la reception ci dicono che mandano qualcuno, il tizio sale dice nel corridoio -abbassare la musica per favore-e se ne va. Si fanno le due di notte e dopo altre 3 chiamate alla repetion risolvo io la situazione trovando il tizio e minacciandolo. Ciliegina sulla torta finalmente arriva il sabato della partenza ormai io ho saldato l'hotel per me e la mia compagnia dobbiamo solo partire e tornare in italia e ovviamente che succede ricevo la mail che il mio conto è in rosso....perchè? semplicemente perche dopo aver pagato l'hotel quegli incompetenti hanno pre autorizzato un altro soggiorno di circa 650 dollari mandandomi sotto. Ho dovuto aspettare che sbloccassero i soldi alla mia compagna che mi ha fatto un bonifico ovviamente sono stato per poco più di una settimana sotto pagandone ovviamente gli interessi alla mia banca. Morale della favola punto primo non andate in america con una visa debit, punto due non scegliete questo hotel perchè a parte la posizione non ha nulla di positivo. Ho aspettato a scrivere questa recensione perchè ovviamente sono stati presi dei provvedimenti. Cercate bene altri hotel e valutate altre opzione perchè questo non ha le competenze base per definirsi HOTEL.

title: Great location and even better price!
text: This tiny boutique hotel was a perfect stay during our trip to New York. The rooms are quite small however you don't need much more than a bed, bathroom and room safe while visiting New York! The bed was extremely comfortable and the room had an a/c unit that worked wonders! The staff was super friendly and made us feel at home and very welcome. The location is just a few minutes walk from Central Park and the subway station so it is super convenient to go anywhere. The rooms come equipped with lock safes which are helpful if you are travelling from outside of America to keep your passports in!

title: Ottima posizione e rapporto qualità prezzo
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo albergo cinque notti che ha la fortuna di essere situato a pochi metri dal lato ovest di Central Park e della stazione 72 w della metropolitana.
Le camere ed il bagno sono molto piccole, ma il letto è veramente comodo, comunque ci siamo accontentanti visto che nel periodo natalizio era l'albergo con il miglior prezzo nella zona.
Per quanto riguarda la colazione siamo lontani dagli standard italiani, infatti abbiamo deciso di farla nei giorni successivi fuori, tanto in zona ci sono una miriadi di locali dove fermarsi.

title: Posizione strategica
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato quattro notti in questo albergo che gode di una ottima location: vicino a central park, la metro, colazione abbondante, eccellente pulizia e letti comodi.
Unica pecca sono gli spazi veramente esigui. 
Lo consiglio caldamente

title: Great hotel
text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for four days on a quick New York vacation. The price was the cheapest I could find in the area and the staff was friendly and helpful. The bathroom was very small but I was able to make it work. I'm 6'1 and it was a tight fit to say the least. The park is a block away and there is a late night dinner called Big Nick's a half block away. I found that from LGA a taxi is about $30 to the hotel. We enjoyed our stay and wouldn't mind staying again. The elevator is slow so try and get a lower room but if you can't it wasn't the worst thing in the world.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: My wife and I stayed here for a getaway trip to NYC. The hotel staff was very polite and accommodating. They didn't have our queen room together for an early check in and upgraded us to a bigger King room without hesitation. Everything was super clean and comforting. Also, the hotel is located very close to a Subway entrance along with being less than half a block to Central Park! We will be staying here again!

title: A week in NYC
text: Great location, friendly staff, and reasonable pricing easily sum up this hotel experience.  We were able to check-in at the assigned time and found the rooms clean, spacious enough and perfect for our needs of having a "home base" to visit with friends and family.  Close to Central Park and public transportation was a nice plus.  There were a number of nice restaurants in the neighborhood that we enjoyed.  We will look into future accommodations as required.

title: Clean hotel in very nice neighborhood
text: We were very pleased with this hotel.  The location is EXCELLENT, it is in a very nice neighborhood.  It was the most reasonably priced for a weekend stay that I could find on short notice.  We were able to check-in early, which was a big plus.  They have a small market with drinks and snacks, it was not overly expensive either.  We had to laugh at how small the room was but we were in New York, right?  Space is limited!  However, we were only in the room for sleep and showers so we really didn't care.  The elevator can be a bit slow and the breakfast is standard continental (and can be very busy & crowded) but again we were in the big city with a thousand places to eat (see my review of Big Nick's just down the street) so, again, we didn't care.  I will probably stay at this hotel again when I return.  Highly recommend.

title: Big City
text: Based on the location of this property, we found the rooms to be very small for the price. Reminded me of some of the properties I stayed in over in Asia. Only 1 elevator and made for a hard time getting down from the 8th floor with a cart full of baggage. Parking was very limited and the garage was very expensive for a daily rate. Would have been nice to have had a heads up on that issue. Due to construction on the front of the property there is a very small sign that you will miss as the property resembles other buildings in the area on a neighborhood type street. The staff really made the stay worth putting up with the small issues we faced...

title: Return? YES!
text:
Great location for our plans to attend a concert at Lincoln Center, see the Metropolitan Museum of Art,  visit NYC Historical Society, dine at Robert, and stroll around Central Park. 
    Our room was clean and a good size with a king bed, a desk and chair, and two closets. The views from the windows were beautiful back-cityscapes, including a glittering Christmas tree. 
    The staff could not have been nicer!  We arrived about 11:00 AM inquiring if we could drop off our luggage.  To our surprise and great delight, our room was ready!!  This made our stay more comfortable and made the hotel room more than just a place to sleep.  Breakfast was simple fare and quite crowded. 
    Considering our budget, I will definitely keep this La Quinta in mind for our next visit to NYC.

title: ÓTIMO CUSTO BENEFÍCIO
text:
Hotel em ótima localização alguns poucos metros do Central Park, lado West. Estação de metrô quase ao lado, em contrapartida está localizado numa rua super tranquila e segura.
O atendimento foi excelente, todos os profisisionais muito atenciosos e simpáticos. A limpeza do quarto sempre em dia. Em especial o rapaz da recepção Mario é uma pessoa muito atenciosa e agradável. Precisei da ajuda do gerente para me auxiliar à falar via fone no estádio Madison Esquare pois havia perdido meus tickets de um jogo que iria assitir, e recebi todo suporte e atenção, mesmo não sendo obrigação dele.
Não tem luxo, entretanto, cama (muito confortável), chuveiro e café da manhã são muito bem ofericidos pelo preço que cobram.
Não ha do que reclamar, e durante minha estadia de 7 dias o hotel estava em obras.. Imaginem agora depois de reformado.. Com certeza ficou ainda melhor.

title: Just a place to sleep
text: Location excellent. Elevator is the slowest I've ever been in. Cleaning ladies the friendliest I've ever come across. Female receptionists friendly. Don't expect much from the breakfasts - they are very basic.

title: Volveremos a este hotel
text:
Hotel muy bien situado, muy limpio y agradable, el recepcionista llamado Mo , nos ayudó en todo y fue súper amable, mucho más que sus compañeros .  Es cierto que el ascensor es lento , pero no es ningún problema.
Volveremos a este hotel cada vez que vengamos a Nueva York.

title: A Fine Hotel If You Get the Right Room
text:
This hotel is in a great location and I really have no complaints. I was staying for 4 nights and booked a Queen room. The first room I was given was barely larger than the bed plus the bathroom. Perhaps OK for one night but not 4. I asked promptly for a room with a desk and chair and they obliged which was much better for my needs and a 4 night stay. It was still quite compact, but manageable. 

I would consider staying here again for the right price. But to be honest there are other nearby hotels I would consider first if the price was competitive which I believe are part of the same management or chain.

The staff was great and the internet worked fine. Breakfast was basic but certainly fine for my needs.

title: Excelente ubicación Metro y central park.
text: Nosotras sólo necesitabamos un lugar para dormir, no para estar durante el día. El espacio si es reducido, pero esta muy bien ubicado a media cuadra de Central Park, a 4 cuadras del Museo de Historia Natural, estacion del metro a la vuelta de la esquina. Reservamos con tiempo por lo que el precio fué bastante razonable, ya que incluía desayuno sencillo.

title: Pretty Disappointing
text:
I want to be fair so I will start by telling everyone I was using LQ points on this stay.  Therefore, I did not have to pay a lot of money to stay here (more on that later).  However, the points required were earned with many many nights I stayed at LQ hotels and that is just as valuable as money.

With that as my prelim, I must admit that this hotel is not only underwhelming it is pretty disappointing.  But before I cover the negatives I do want to call out the few good parts of our stay.  First, the staff is both helpful, knowledgeable and pleasant.  They are a real plus to this location.  Second, the location is nice if you are looking for a quite and more out of the way place to be in Manhattan.  With easy access to the 1,2,3 subway it is fairly convenient but again not very close to anything but the park.  

Now for the downsides.  It is often said a team or business is only as good as its weakest link and I will cover that first.  The free breakfast was mediocre at best (not the items but the lack of having it hot and stocked).  For instance, they ran out of butter and a few other things two days before our stay ended and made no apologies for not having items for the rest of our stay.  Also, the room where breakfast is served is far too small and there is almost never anywhere to sit.  To add to the problem the start time of 7 AM is late enough for those of us with places to go but is exacerbated by the lady fixing breakfast.  She did not even get started setting stuff out until a little after seven.  The start times was at best 715 to 730 and that was even with lots of folks milling around waiting.  She starts too late and frankly is over matched to get the job done.  Items never seemed to stay stocked and she just never operated with any sense of I need to get this done to meet our commitment to the guest.  Finally on the one day she was not there a man had the job.  A different guest other than me did something he did not like and he purposefully embarrassed her in front of all of the rest of us (that occurred on the Friday morning of our visit).  Not classy at all and again this happened to someone I do not know.

Other issues with the hotel were (1) virtually no hot water in the shower most of the time.  This was true even after they staff came to our room to investigate,  (2)  Maybe the slowest and smallest elevators in NYC (and that is saying a lot); (3) the rooms are very very small and not laid out to accommodate both work and sleep; and (4) this is the only LQ I have ever stayed at that charged a small fee $5 per night when using points.  That is not a big thing but it seems counter intuitive to get a free room and then be charged.  To add to that they taxed the $5 at a rate that made the overall tax rate over 40% of the $5 fee.  Again this is not a big thing but it is the only hotel of any kind which has ever charged me to use points.  Sadly it was also the hotel I enjoyed the least of any I have ever used with points as well.

In conclusion, this LQ is not an awful hotel but lots of things went wrong that made it well below par.  I noticed that on some nights they want well over $300 for a room and even in NYC that is way over priced for this place.  Therefore, I would say buyer beware and you would perhaps be better off staying somewhere else.

title: Pensión Loli, a precio de Hotel Palace
text:
Siendo como son los hoteles en NY no especialmente buenos ni especialmente baratos, éste se lleva la palma en la abusiva relación calidad-precio: es, con diferencia, el peor hotel en el que me he alojado nunca.
Viajamos este pasado Puente de Diciembre en familia, ocupando dos habitaciones de 2 y 3 personas respectivamente, a un precio medio de 280 euros la noche.
Las habitaciones son ridículas, de unos 5 metros cuadrados, sin espacio vital mínimo ni para una persona, cuando menos para dos. El baño también, más propio de la casa de Pin y Pon.
El nivel de confort es lamentable, con un calor insoportable en el mes de Diciembre y ventanas bloqueadas, dejando como única opción tener que encender el aire acondicionado, algo kafkiano cuando menos, pero que además hacía un ruido insoportable.
El armario se reduce a un hueco de 40 cm, con 3 perchas, que encima está ocupado por todo tipo de enseres como portamaletas, tablas de planchar, etc... que en caso de que uno se decida a utilizar, deberá desplegar en el pasillo, puesto que en la habitación no caben.
El nivel de limpieza es también deplorable. Nos encontramos a nuestra llegada una moqueta que no había visto una aspiradora al menos en los últimos 2 años, y así se quedó cuando nos fuimos.
Un único ascensor sirviendo una distribución de, al menos, 14 plantas, hizo que subiéramos y bajáramos más escaleras que en toda nuestra vida, lo cuál, al menos, compensa la ausencia de gimnasio.
El buffet del desayuno, sin espacio suficiente para todos los huéspedes, desabastecido y de muy mala calidad, sólo nos atrevimos a probarlo el primer día.
El personal de recepción, más preocupado de cotillear sus asuntos personales delante de la clientela, poco servicial y sin ningún interés por hacer la estancia de los clientes algo más agradable, eso sí, muy displicentes a la hora de vender "shuttles" al aeropuerto.
En definitiva, una estafa. increíble la mala relación calidad precio, incluso para NY. Id a cualquier otro sitio, de verdad.

title: Good option in Manhattan
text: Clean throughout, great location, includes decent breakfast, pleasant staff...and good value!! First time I stayed there and on that date I couldn't find another decent hotel in the Midtown/Central Park area for under $500 until I found this!

title: La Quinta Upper West Side - Nice option for short visit
text: This hotel is located perfectly in the upper west side one block away from central park. The neighborhood is nice and there are many restaurants about a block away as well as a convenient store.   The room we stayed in was a double/twin which was tiny but comfortable since we pretty much just slept there while visiting NYC. I would definitely get a bigger room if the stay was longer.   Accommodations were basic, and the only thing we really stayed away was the continental breakfast. Not too much of an option in food and quality was average. Not a big deal as you could walk down one block to get breakfast.   Staff was very friendly. I would stay here again if it was a short trip again.   The subway was only one block away which was also a BIG plus.

title: No recomendable. Pésimas instalaciones y trato
text: Nos alojaron a dos personas en una habitación individual que en España no sería legal por sus dimensiones. Baño mínimo y armario ridiculo en el que solo entran dos abrigos por lo que no hemos podido siquiera deshacer las maletas, por encima de las que teníamos que saltar para acceder al baño, en una semana de estancia. El personal de recepción hizo caso omiso a las continuas peticiones de cambio de habitación. No se limpia el polvo desde hace tiempo. Un timo en toda regla

title: First Trip to NYC
text: The room was small, but the location was great for visiting my daughter who just moved to NYC in the Upper West Side. We were able to get up early and walk out the door to a great spot on the corner for the Macy's Day Parade.

title: Very Nice Hotel
text:
We were surprised by how nice this hotel was.
We have stayed in quite a few hotels in the city in the last few years and we know that rooms can be small-- 
We had the corner king room which was pretty large.
The bed was very comfortable and we slept very well.
The hotel was on a very quite street very close to Central 
Park so it is perfect for exploring the park...
Yet it was close to places to eat and Bloomingdales outlet was close. 
We were impressed how clean the hotel was and the staff and management were to notch...
It was nice also that breakfast was included.
Looking forward to going back.

title: Too small, too small, couldnt be smaller. But its NY.
text:
Its not a good place to stay, even if you are just coming just for the night. Rooms are too small. I was not comfortable. Plus its expensive. 

The location is good though. Its close to Central Park and some good restaurants.

title: Ok but wouldnt go back
text:
The room-was a room for 3. Beds really comfy and clean but room was soooo tiny. Even ended up using the toilet as a seat as there wasnt enuf room for us all to sit!!
Hotel-ok but small and nothing special. Ok for a few days. friendly staff who are really helpful...couldnt fault them. Really noisy can hear everything in the nearby rooms.
Location - great for central park and some other attractions. Next to a tube station but a bit too far to walk back at night from main areas.
Breakfast-dont waste your money paying for breakfast. Awful!!! Cold eggs. Microwaved potatoes. Ran out of pastrys and  bread etc.

title: Good location, tiny tiny rooms and cluttered corridors.
text:
If you wanna be on the upper west side, this is a great place to stay. A few yards from central park, a nice street with some cool places within walking distance. The rooms are also clean, with comfy beds and good showers. We had a triple room - a double bed and a single, and it was pretty small. It was also very hot, despite being november and us having all the windows open. We ended up having to use the aircon to cool down. 

Breakfast is pretty awful - but they have coffee so I suggest heading out to one of the many good places around with a takeaway. The really annoying thing was the lift - only one and incredibly slow, and always filled with cleaning staff and their trolleys for dirty sheets and towels, so would often take awhile to get in to one. Plus the corridors were always full of cleaning trolleys which made is tricky to get into the room if carrying bags.

title: My ruined first visit to NY
text: As much as this hotel is good located, I wouldnt stay there again, not even FOR FREE!. Had to shorten my stay as I couldnt take it for the entire 3 night stay originally reserved. To say that the rooms are  small is an understatement ... they are for lilliputiens!  Going to the bathroom was an ordeal as the size was 1.5 square meters total IF, shower-basin-toilet all cramped in this tiny cubicle in a tiny room as well... nightmarish experience for my husband who is 6´ tall. 1 tiny elevator that you have to share with housekeeping staff that dont care AT ALL to push you and other paying guests during rush hours...if you suffer from claustrophilia, you are IN for the ride of your life! Oh and breakfast time!... the hotel was overwhelmed many times by the number of guests staying for Thanksgiving holiday as there were people eating breakfast standing as the "dining room" couldnt accomodate the number of people staying; no eggs nor bread, nor sugar, no waffles available and one single employee who was struggling trying to refresh supplies but surpassed by the number of patrons. Definetely not a good deal cause if you consider the number of taxes you end up paying (flat rate, unit tax, occupancy city, sales tax) we ended with a daily rate of $226.88 not worthwhile price-value.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Check in was a breeze, got in early and the room was ready, we got a corner room with a view of Central Park and the city...the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean and very big. 
The front of house staff, Mo and Penny were fantastic, really friendly and helpful. 
I'm a bit of a germaphobe and I felt like the whole hotel was very well maintained and clean.
The location was really good, Columbus circle was near, heaps of places to eat and a wine store... 72nd street subway is closer and has the blue line that gets to the heart of the city in 5 minutes... the hotel is a great place if you're out all day and want a clean, comfortable place to come back to and relax in your room...

title: Great location, very small rooms
text:
The room was very neat and clean but extremely small. There was a full dresser in the room which made it even tighter.  It was almost too small. 

However the location is excellent. One block from the 72nd Street station and Central Park. Great place if you just need a place to sleep. 

Another thing, when I arrived the night attendant was totally disinterested. He neither greeted nor looked up the whole time. He seemed upset I had interrupted his previous personal call. Not a very good start to my first night there. 

Overall it was ok. But I don't think I'll be staying there again.

title: Fiyat uygun ama....
text: Odalar minicik. Yatağın yanında bavulu koyup açacak kadar bile yer yok. Fotoğraflar aldatıcı. Pencere tipi klima çok sesli çalışıyor. Kahvaltı rezalet. Kağıt tabakta plastik çatal kaşıkla yiyorsun. Bütün otel 3 kişi ile işletiliyor.

title: Piccole stanze ma posizione comoda
text: Confermo le recensioni precedenti: la stanza è piccola! Se avete valigie molto grandi sarà difficile collocarle (nella mia stanza c'era un piccolo armadio ma non sono riuscita a far entrare nemmeno la valigia che ho utilizzato come bagaglio a mano!). Ambienti abbastanza puliti. La colazione è servita fino alle 10 del mattino ma se si arriva sul tardi si rischia di non avere più molta scelta e posto disponibile per sedersi. Lato positivo: è possibile prendere il thè anche fuori dagli orari della colazione. Lato negativo:non è presente un distributore d'acqua potabile gratuito (c'è solo per il ghiaccio) come è abitudine in molti alberghi negli USA.  La posizione vicino a Central Park e alla metro è molto comoda.

title: très belle situation
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé à quelques mètres d'une station de métro. Le personnel est plus ou moins agréable. Nous avions réservé par hotel.com et nous avons été très déçu pour le prix payé. La chambre n'était pas très propre, très petite (même pas d'armoire pour défaire les valises !!!). Le lit vendu pour un grand lit était en fait un lit de 20 cms. Nous sommes allés réclamer et on nous a gentillement dit que c'était comme ça et qu'il n'y avait plus rien d'autre de libre. Le petit dej est correct mais toute la vaisselle est jetable.
Pas digne d'un 4 étoiles

title: Perfect Location
text: We got here earlier than check-in time, but our room was ready so we were able to drop off our luggage and explore Central Park.  Front desk was very helpful.  Small room, but we were only there to sleep.

title: Great Location
text:
- Great Location between Central park and Columbus Avenue with lots of restaurants  within the vicinity. 
- Amazing staff and helpful front desk
- Clean room and bed is okay
- Free breakfast
- 1 block from B and C train (72nd)

- Small rooms
- 1 small elevator for the whole building (14 floors)

title: Great Location!
text: Great hotel in a residential neighborhood. Many wonderful choices for restaurants. The staff is most friendly! Close to the subway,.. a  great choice! The room I was in was a bit small but not outrageous for New York City,

title: Great spot!
text: This hotel has been recently redone and is very well located. The rates are extremely reasonable and the customer service was really great as well. I am glad that we decided to stay here and were able to check out some fantastic shopping at Columbus Circle and on Broadway also. It is quaintly nestled on a more residential street, away from the hustle and bustle. Great hidden gem! I highly recommend it!

title: Amazing staff and location
text: This hotel is right by Central Park on the Upper West Side.   We had come to Manhattan for the NY Marathon and they were fully booked and busy.   As many of the reviews mention some of the rooms are very small but for NYC, the location and the price, not surprising.   The rooms have been recently renovated and clean.   We had a problem with the tub (stopper wasn't working - problem when they renovated) and they didn't think it could be fixed.  They were willing to move us to another room  but they warned us it was much smaller than the room we were in and even went so far as to show me the room.   The facilities engineer found a part that might work and then spent 30 min fixing it.  Really felt they went above and beyond.   I normally don't stay at LaQuinta but if this is the type of service, I'll definitely stay again.

title: Funny, convenient and value for money
text:
Well located, near to Central Park and 1.5 block distance to the subway, breakfast included ! 
Rooms are just to spend the night, clean, well equipped, private bathroom
There is just on elevator which is too busy at peak time
All you need for a reasonable price will recommend

title: Ideal location for us, wander into Central Park on way to town
text: Our first NYC stay; 3 nights, busy days and a show. La Quinta's location, welcome with slick and span make it a good choice. We arrived just before midnight fresh from Yellow cab excitement to an efficient friendly sign in. The single and double bed in our room left little room for the desk with TV and the en suite was compact too. We simply wanted to be central, safe and sleep well. The beds were very comfortable, the hotel quiet and very clean. Grouting, linen and shower stream all perfect ! Breakfast room we'll run self-serve and I learned waffling - delicious. We returned to airport much more comfortably and safely with a driver the reception organised for us. Delighted.

title: Cerca de 2 Paradas de Metro y en Frente del Central Park
text: El Hotel la Quinta es una buena opción si solamente buscas un lugar para pasar la noche y no pasar el día ahí! Sus habitaciones son estilo loft ósea, son pequeñas pero cómodas. Se encuentra cerca de la calle 72 donde paran las líneas de metro B y 1 y 2 pero si no te molesta caminar puedes hacerlo caminando en el central park, una excelente forma de ver una belleza escénica insuperable. Resumen: Económico, No tan cercano al centro, pero bonito y la recepción muy servicial!

title: Great location and AMAZING staff!
text: We've stayed at the LaQuinta on Central Park West for years (even before it was a LaQuinta) - We love it and the staff!  They make you feel like you are a part of a family.  Suzane and Fritz are amazing and are an added bonus to the LaQuinta Hotel chain.

title: Great stay!
text: Excellent staff (Penny, George and even Ray!).  We were surprised our room wasn't as small as some others described. King room with plenty of space for two people--bathroom was small but, hey, it's NYC!   Nicely remodeled in a quaint, nice neighborhood.  Walkable  to many areas including Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller center, 5th avenue and grand central station!

title: Small but very clean, fantastic staff!
text:
I'd read about the rooms being small, so I was pleasantly surprised that our room was a little bigger than I expected. We had a corner king room. I'm a germ freak and even I considered the room very clean!!! It looked like the walls were recently painted. The staff was so friendly! They helped my son and I with figuring out the subway system, held our luggage twice (arrival and departure day), and even found a place for my son to practice saxophone since we were there to tour conservatories. The location is perfect!  Yes, the breakfast room is crowded, but I've never been to a free breakfast that wasn't. The elevator is small and slow, but it really wasn't bad. We never felt the need to walk up or down the stairs. I will definitely stay here again! The beds are super comfortable and the front desk staff is AMAZING. 
They were even very sweet to me when I misplaced my jewelry and called to ask if anyone found it. The front desk person was trying her best to help find it when I found it in a pocket of my suitcase I don't normally use. I was completely at fault, but she was very sweet to me!!! Love this place.

title: a due passi da central park e dalla metro 72nd
text: piccolo ma accogliente. le camere sono molto piccole ma i letti king sono una favola, comodissimi e riposanti. appena arrivati alla reception ci hanno cambiato la camera senza sovrapprezzo perchè ne avevano una superiore disponibile. unica nota dolente la colazione che è veramente misera (anche se è uno dei pochissimi hotel a fornirla a NYC)

title: Bom custo x benefício
text: Muito bem localizado, bem perto do Central Park, porém numa área mais tranquila o que permitiu termos todas as noites de sono tranquilo, sem barulho. O quarto era pequeno, porém limpo e com tudo funcionando. O WI-FI era ótimo e funcionou o tempo todo dentro do próprio quarto. Café da manhã bom, com o necessário para uma alimentação matinal. O atendimento de todos os recepcionistas também foi bom, em especial o da Susanna que foi o nosso primeiro e último contato. Indico e voltaria a me hospedar

title: Petit hôtel bien placé
text:
Les plus :
Emplacement très agréable, à 50 mètres de Central Park
Proximité du Museum of Natural Sciences
Quartier plutôt Bobo, très agréable. Je l'avais justement choisi ca j'ai habité longtemps dans la maison à côté !
Vient d'être rénové et les chambres sont propres et confortables
Le personnel est accueillant et aimable

Les moins :
La première chambre que l'on m'avait donnée était minuscule, sans doute la plus petite que j'ai jamais vue et impraticable car on ne pouvait pratiquement pas ouvrir les valises ! Après avoir réclamé, le manager m'en a aimablement donné une beaucoup plus grande, pour le même prix.
Le petit déjeuner est correct avec des gaufres délicieuses, mais ni fromage ni charcuterie, ni saumon… Les assiettes sont en carton, les couverts en plastique très bon marché. Cela manque vraiment de classe pour un prix qui n'est pas bon marché, surtout dans un quartier de New York un peu excentré.

title: Great service from receptionist to housekeeping!
text: Great service and great housekeeping doing an amazing job, I will always take my family there. highly recommended. newly renovated and close to the city. staff with smiles and ready to serve you at your needs!

title: Violated By Management
text: A truly horrendous week long stay at La Quinta Inn on West 71st Street in New York City.  Twice management entered my room and removed things.  The first time they removed a nightstand (one of two), and then a few days later they removed all the clothes hangers.  It might have been just unsatisfactory that I had no hangers, but I felt violated that someone was rummaging in my room.  I brought this up with the manager, but he thought I complained too boisterously and then threatened to spread my good name to other hotels to blacklist me.  This certainly is no way to run a hotel.  I ultimately brought my complaint to senior management at corporate, and while they apologized and offered me 2 night’s stay at any La Quinta I did not feel that they had the wherewithal to correct the problem on West 71st Street.

title: 改装したばかりで、セントラルパークやレストランも地下鉄駅も近くで便利です
text:
現在のホテル名は、「ラ キンタ イン&スイーツ ニューヨークシティ セントラルパーク」ですので、ご用心を。改装が9月上旬に終了したばかりだそうです。
到着したニューアーク空港からは、疲れていたこともあり、タクシーを利用。
料金は、100ドル越えでした。（後で調べたら、ニューアーク空港からは、ニュージャージー州からニューヨーク州に来ることになるため、タクシーはメータ制の金額、途中に有料の橋を通る必要があり、その料金の往復代金が取られるそうです。スーツケース代も1$とられました。）
ホテルは、アッパーサイドということもあり、夜に食事に歩いて（近くまで）でかけても全然危険は感じませんでした。
部屋はダブルルームにして、正解だったようです。現地下合流した仕事仲間はシングルにしましたが、狭くてデスクもありませんでした。事前にメールで聞いていた情報（デスクがあるのはダブルルームのみ）が正しかった。
室内には、デスク、引き出し、椅子、クローゼット（扉付、幅が狭いけれど2か所）、コーヒーメーカー、コーヒーセット（紅茶はなし）、ボックスティッシュ、タオルはバスタオル、フェイスタオル、ミニタオルが2枚ずつ。テレビは壁掛け。エアコンが旧式なのか、窓のところに設置してあるタイプで、音がとってもうるさかったのが難点。冷蔵庫はなし。セーフティボックスはクローゼットの上段にありましたが、平均的身長の日本人女性には高すぎる位置でした。
床にスーツケースを広げても、まあ、まだ余裕があるくらいには、広かったです。
ニューヨークとしては、結構広いほうになるのかな？
バスルームには、かなり小さ目のバスタブと久々のシャワーカーテン。安心してシャワーがあびれました。でも、シャワーが固定式でちょっと使いにくかった。
セントラルパークがすぐ近くで、散歩にいくのにちょうどいい距離でした（昼間限定）。

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
El hotel tiene una ubicación increible, a media cuadra del central park, a una cuadra y media de la avenida broadway donde podes encontrar muy buenos lugares para cenar. También tenes cerca  un lavadero y la estacion del metro está a una cuadra.

El hotel es muy limpio, muy bien equipado, pero las habitaciones son muy chicas. Nosotros eramos tres y la habitación era demasiado chica. Para dos hubierado estado bien.
El baño si bien era chico, era funcional, estaba en perfecto estado y muy bien decorado.

Dan desayuno, con cafe,te, wafles, tostadas, jugo y fruta. Nada del otro mundo pero muy util. La atención en el hotel fué buena.

title: Great value for location
text:
Stayed here for 1 night to see a show in Central Park.  Excellent location for the park and the Museum of Natural History.  Prior reviews complain about the renovation but the front desk staff said that is all done.  The renovation of the rooms and lobby are very nice.
We had a room for 3 with a single and a double bed, and while it was small, it was fine for us.  Can’t give any info on the double rooms but they must be really small.    I think even if you are just 2 people it may be worth paying for a triple for the extra space.   
 We had a room on the 14th floor (really 13, which I always find funny when hotels skip floor 13) we actually had a view of the tree tops of Central Park which I thought was cool.   
If you just need a room for a day or two or are sightseeing all day and just need a place to shower and sleep this hotel will do just fine.   I’m kind of picky when it comes to cleanliness and it was acceptable.    The bathroom had a slight mildew odor but I have to admit I’m really sensitive to smells, too sensitive according to my husband.  Anyone who is a clean freak should be okay here.  
The window A/C unit cooled the single bed well, but not the double bed, which was further away.  The bathroom also gets no A/C so that gets warm and muggy.   
Stay here with really close friends or family because there is no privacy when getting ready in the morning.
The free breakfast was okay.  Gets crowded and busy, but I think that is every hotel that has a free breakfast.  
We will probably be back if we need to spend a night in NYC if the price is right.

title: A due passi da Central Park
text: Nonostante la camera fosse piccola, ci siamo trovati molto, ma molto bene. Personale gentile, cordiale e pronto a soddisfare ogni nostra richiesta. Uno dei pochi alberghi con colazione annessa, vicinissimo a Central Park e a due "block" dalla stazione metropolitana "72 ST". Bello e pulito!!!

title: Small but excellent
text: Travelled to New York to drop son off at grad school. We knew the rooms were going to be small, but we still were a bit surprised. It was all good though as it was recently renovated, very functional and most importantly, clean!  We travelled with two precious large musical instruments that had to be brought into room, and still made it work with three adults. Yes, it's tight, but I loved the location (1/2 block from Central Park and the Dakota, 1 1/2 blocks from express subway stop, quiet). Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Ottimo rapporto prezzo-qualità
text: Seppur la camera è abbastanza piccola penso sia molto difficile trovare sistemazioni migliori a quel prezzo. La posizione è fantastica soprattutto per la vicinanza a central park e alla fermata della metropolitana. È disponbile anche la colazione dove si possono mangiare waffles appena fatti. Nel complesso siamo rimasti molto contenti e lo consiglierei tranquillamente.

title: Rooms the size of a regular bathroom.
text: Rooms the size of a regular bathroom. I have never been in a room so small, not even New York, like this ones. Virtualy my wife and I had to take turns to enter the room or use the bathroom, the tv is located at the side of the bed that if you want to see something, either you turn your neck in a weird form or have half body in bed. The customer service people seemed to be friendly but the place was not.

title: A day in NYC
text: I read a lot of reviews before I booked this hotel.  Most everyone reviewed how small the rooms were so I was not surprised when I checked in.  George at the front desk was so nice and helpful.  Location is PERFECT!  Close to the subway and shopping!

title: Camera minuscola,  bagno più piccolo di una vasca da bagno
text: Albergo in posizione eccellente a 2passi da central park. La nostra stanza,  una tripla, era minuscola, in un altro albergo sarebbe stata una piccola doppia o una singola. Il bagno ha dimensioni ridicole,  si ha difficoltà persino A sedersi sulla tazza.  A completare il tutto, il condizionatore (rumoroso) attaccato al letto, e quindi inutilizzabile durante la notte.  Colazione senza infamia e senza lode.  Spendete qualche euro in più per un'altra struttura che è meglio.

title: Great Location!
text: I stayed August 13-16, 2016.  It was under some construction at the time, but overall a great place for the cost and location. Clean, tiny room, neatly decorated, friendly helpful staff.  Breakfast was good two out of three days, but that is because I arrived late to breakfast on the second day and everything was picked over. It's New York, I only need the bed at night to sleep in anyways.  I will return next summer.  I had a blast!

title: Ótima localização e atendimento!!
text: Acredito que seja dos mais simples, mas tem o melhor custo beneficio, muito bem localizado, ao lado do Central Park, do Museu de arte natural, lanchonetes, comércios, estação e inclusive do lado de uma Magnolias becary! Em todos estes lugares acima fomos a pé, super fácil acesso e seguro, no primeiro dia fomos até a Time Square a pé também é foi uma delicia estava uma noite linda e foi super rápido!

title: Close to central Park
text:
We stayed there two nights. The location is good but that's the only positive comment I can make. 
It wasn't so clean and the room it's the smallest room I ever saw in my life. I never thought  that  rooms like that can even exist in a hotel.
The breakfast was poor and the staff not so helpful. 
We were so disappointed.

title: DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL
text: Everything was a disaster. I don't think this is a hotel by all means. Very tiny room, Could fit the baby stroller through the hall way, had to carry the baby and fold the stroller!! This is the hallway from the elevator to the room. This is the worst experience by all means. Very noisy since they have construction going on. Extremely mean workers, the guy yelled at me for not squeeze in my wife, the baby, and I in a small tiny elevator and cursed at me. I will ask for my money back for misleading advertisement.

title: Muito bem localizado, funcionários gentis
text: Chegamos antes do check-in e fomos bem recepcionados. Os funcionários acomodaram nossas bagagens temporariamente numa salinha até o horário do check-in para podermos passear enquanto isso. Além disso o quarto é bastante confortável (a vista não era nada de mais) e é muito bem localizado. Como pegamos a diária sem café da manhã, sempre procuramos locais onde dê pra comer ali perto e ficou super conveniente. Indico!!

title: Great Staff and Location
text: I stayed July 19 thru July 22. The staff was extremely helpful. The front desk person, Moe and George took time to explain the subway and city in detail. The continental breakfast was great, Thomas took great care in keeping the place a pleasant and clean place to eat a quick breakfast. One employee, Babbita was exceptional. One evening as she got off work, she waited for my family and I to show us the ins and outs of the subway.  She was on her way home and we were on our way to 42nd street. The room was small but suited us fine as we were only there to sleep and shower. The location is very convenient to central park and subway. Neighborhood has many cafes and grab and go eateries. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Good location
text:
I stayed two nights at the hotel. The location is very convenient, many restaurants nearby, also beauty saloon for ladies, very close to the hotel
The rooms were tiny, but as I was travelling alone, no problem
The staff were friendly
Central Park is just a block from hotel, good!

title: Great location Upper West Side
text: Steps away from Central Park's Strawberry Fields and near the infamous Dakota - home of Yoko Ono. Shopping, restaurants and museums are all within walking distance.  This newly renovated hotel was a great find for us at a reasonable price considering its location. The rooms are small, which adds to the total New York experience and gives you an idea of how regular New Yorkers really live on this island of 9 million. Simple, clean, comfortable, it was the perfect place to stay. The staff were polite and helpful and check in went smooth and quick. Comp breakfast is offered but of course we chose to go out because after all, I am "the bagel snob" and it's what I do. So, if you are planning a trip to the city, and the type where you'll be out and about more than staying in  your hotel room, this place is perfect. Oh, and remember, you are in New York and city noise is part of the deal 24/7.

title: Horrible Hotel
text:
The worst hotel! The rooms are so tiny one can't even get in them, no windows, no air, dirty!
They had renovations, blocked our room door with building materials, elevator was for everyone-clients, builders, staff...it took 20 minutes to go from 9th floor down to the lobby. Phone did not work in the room. There was absolutely no service, noone to help with baggage...
Would not recommend even if all of it for free!!!

title: Muy bien ubicado pero con un muy mal servicio
text: Servicio pesimo. Muy mala actitud de los empleados y poco empeño en su trabajo. Un hotel con una ubicacion exelente en central park new york y muy lindo ya que esta en su 85% del total remodelado. Solo hay un muy buen empleado que se llama Mo. Es hjmilde y amable. Atendo y resuelve rapido. El resto son unos pedantes.

title: Comodo e funzionale
text:
Ho soggiornato a fine giugno e l'hotel era quasi al termine della ristrutturazione.
Stanza pulita, mobilio, materassi e cuscini nuovi, bagno piccolino ma funzionale.
E' possibile avere la colazione inclusa, grande comodità in una città come NY!
Segnale wifi ottimo e gran silenzio lungo la strada per riposare la notte.
Comodissima la Metro e la zona ricca di ristorantini a prezzi accettabili.
Grande cortesia del manager che ci ha risolto un iniziale problema con la prenotazione di Booking.
Consigliato!

title: Gran ubicación
text:
A sólo media cuadra de Central Park, Dakota Building, Strawberry Fields (donde se encuentra el memorial a Lennon) y de las líneas A y C del metro de Manhattan, está este hotel. Parte de la cadena La Quinta Inn & Suites antiguamente era parte de Comfort Inn, ambos del holding Choice Hotels. Al día de hoy, aún hay pisos que se encuentran en remodelación, pero no es ningún inconveniente para los huéspedes. Con wifi gratuito y desayuno americano incluido, fue el hotel más conveniente que encontré para quedarme con mi familia en Manhattan. El único inconveniente es que con 14 pisos y un solo ascensor a veces hay que esperar mucho para subir a la habitación. Las habitaciones no son muy grandes, salvo por la king, y encuentras habitaciones hasta para 3 personas con una cama queen y una twin. A menos de 2 avenidas están las líneas 1, 2 y 3 del metro, un outlet Bloomingdale's, tiendas y muchos lugares para comer. Yo lo recomiendo totalmente! 
PD: Parte del personal habla español y la impresión del check in del avión o la tarjeta de embarque es gratuita en el lobby.

title: Tiny rooms, bad service
text: Though a great location, I was very disappointed with the service at this hotel. My first night I was kept up by the dripping of condensation from the air conditioner above onto ours. I even had earplugs on and it didn't help. I complained and they said they'd fix it but didn't, so two nights no sleep. Also they were doing construction on the floor below and promised there would be no noise. Second morning, hammering at 7:30 am. And the construction crew were overusing the one elevator so it could take 5 minutes to get up and down. For all the trouble, they gave me a $20 credit. That's just insulting. Very disappointing.

title: OJO tambien ofrecen este hotel como Comfort Inn Central Park
text: Reserve y abone el total de mi estadia de 5 noches en junio, cuando llegue tarde casi media noche me entere que habian sobrevendido varias habitaciones y estaba sin alojamiento. Como yo habia otras personas que eran rechazadas con la excusa que no estaba la reserva cuando era todo mentira. La recepcionista nos ubico en otro hotel de la misma cadena Comfort Inn que queria cobrarnos todo nuevamente . La Quinta o Confort Inn Cetral park nunca se hizo cargo de nada. Pesimos no reserven con ellos.

title: Great staff, Great Location
text: I was a bit concerned after comparing prices of other UWS/ Central Park hotels and this one.  I was pleasantly surprised!  George, Zain, and Mo are the BEST - so helpful, really make you feel welcome, and know that area.  There are so many great restaurants just a half a block away.  Subway access is super easy.  The hotel is being renovated (almost done) and is beautiful but still a few glitches.  It still holds the historic charm and is updated.  Remember that those buildings are historic.  Rooms are small but for the service, area, and price we could deal with it.  We will return!!

title: Boa localização
text: Localização ótima, há 1 quadra do central park e 2 quadras da estações de metrô além da proximidade com grandes avenidas. Os quartos são bem pequenos e os banheiros são bem antigos. Mas vale pela conveniência.

title: Otima localizaçao
text: Localizado perto do central park, da janela do meu quarto ainda dava pra ver uma pontinha .. Da pra chegar no Met e Guggenheim andando através do parque. Fica perto do metro que fica na 72. Vale o preço.
